Hazy red color, small pinkish head. Aroma is mostly blackcurrant indeed, some spices. Sweet fruity taste and palate, although the fruitiness is not as abundant as i expected.
Fruity (blackcurrant) nose. Hazy, orange-red coloured with a lasting head. Taste is fruity (blackcurant), some sourness. Fresh and a bit dry beer. okay.

Beautiful deep pink-orange, clear; pinkish foam, slowly disappearing despite lively bubbling. Nose definitely blackcurrant (=zwarte bessen), as well as a spicy touch. Soft sweet, with sourish, very fruity surrounding. Fine fruity flavours of cassis, raspberry and citrus (lemon). Spicy finish (nutmeg, Laos-root). Light, but very refreshing, dry finish, with long fruity aftertaste. Bravo - after a few very bad cases, a proof that an extra-small brewery, originating in homebrewery, can make something very wort(h)wile. I want more of them!

Bottled 20.09.01: beer gushes out of the bottle. Dark red color with a small head. Blackcurrant all over, earthy and dusty aroma and flavor. Slight sourness. Thin and fairly bitter. The yeastiness dominates the beer and spoils the flavor.

Bottled 750ml (BB 03/2013) Thanks bierkoning! Murky pinky color, small pinky head. Strawberry and cherry aroma, some tartness. Medium-bodied. Berryish, strawberry, cherry flavor. Light sourness, some sweetness. Very homebrewish fruit beer.
Bottled. Hazy orange colour, small off-white head. Aroma is berries, fruits, yeast, and mild maltyness. Flavour is fruits, mild wooden and earthy notes along with some slight yeasty notes.
Standard golden color. Smell yeast and orange peel. Ok taste, low carbo and body.
Like most of their beers this one smelled a bit like Chinese food (ginger i guess). Pretty average score.
A hazy orange beer with a white head. The aroma is light, but what is there is sweet and primarily yeasty. The flavor is malty with notes of oranges, leading to a dry end.
Sweet nose of citrus, oranges and some yeast. Yellow colored body, medium sized white head. Weak flavor, quite sweetish.

(Bottle 33 cl) Pilsener golden with a white, creamy head. Somewhat sweet, citrusy aromas. Rather light body with a soft, light citrusy sweetness - oranges. But this contains no less than 6 additives (E-numbers)! 280705
Bottled. Hazy yellow coloured with a small white head. Aroma of vegetables and fruits with spicy notes. Flavour of spices with notes of vegetables and fruits. Nice hoppy finish.

Bottled March 03. Wheat beer packed with adjuncts. This beer contains E422 (used as anti-freeze for cars, but can also give body to beer), E110 & E124 (colourings that cause a wide variety of reactions including vomiting and hyperactivity), Sodium Benzoate (which is used both as a preservative and to disguise the taste of poor quality food) and citric acid from low grade lemons. I drank mine chilled - I would hate to experiment and try this warmed up. Anyway - it tastes artificial and chemical and just plain nasty. I personally don�t mind if a brewer plays around to create a fun drink with additives, but this one is simply not to my taste. There is little fun here, just a bitter flavour that could be spices, old hops, or any of the E numbers tipped in by the mad scientists who concocted this. The nearest flavour I could relate to is one of those ice pops that as I kid I used to buy - they came in long plastic condoms and were packed with preservatives and articicial flavourings - hey, just like this little sucker! Seriously - save your palate and your body, avoid this. It�s a drain pour - and Joris has just gone down in my estimation by giving this garbage a 3.1 and saying "It isn�t really bad."

Gold-orange, very slight haze; slim snow-white head, good carbonation. Preserved sugared orange, much coriander, very slight sulphur in the nose. Taste yields coriander, tons of it. And a flavour that reminds me (sorry) of "Lumpfish eggs" (fake caviar). I wonder if it's colouring agent - there's a list of 6 E-numbered additions on the label (NOT for German export, this). There's a touch of acidity like in a wheatbeer - or are the coriander & orange deceiving me? It has a rather fresh mouthfeel - surprising with all the coriander. What IS the idea here? One-off for a Dutch royal wedding - the orange label for every orange-mad Dutchman, taste or not? It says "type:orange beer" ont the label. Type??? It isn't really bad, but it doesn't exactly inspire confiance.

From bottle at Bier Xperience Steenwijk 2016. Aroma is sweetish malt, apples, some notes of grapes. Flavour is moderate sweet. Body is medium. How is this a Wibier? Drinkable, but very dull and unfresh.

Bottled 20.09.02. A bit darker as an average witbier. Cloudy with a small persisting head. Yeasty aroma, with a touch of grapes. Creamy, yeasty, slightly fruity flavor. Very light and inoffensive aroma and flavor, but also lacks character. Refreshing beer, though.

I poured this beer looked at the colour, and while i was judging the colour i smelled something weird. Took a good sniff and i smelled Chinese food. That�s the best way i can describe it. Probably ginger-like. Also noticable in the taste. I like Chinese food, i like beer, but i don�t like Chinese food in my beer.
Again that weird, unfresh smell. According to other raters it�s probably ginger. But anyway this beer is just off. Totally unbalanced, just weird.
Sehr trockener Gew�rzantrunk mit etwas Herbe. Modrig nach Traube, hellmalzig, prickelnd. Zunehmend trockener, im Abgang dann insgesamt schw�cher, nur noch belanglos herb und w�rzig. 7/6/7/5/6/6
Bottled. Cloudy goldn, small head. Cellary cinnamon aroma. Sweet and fruty, medium bodied with chewy malt and rounded mouthfeel. Rather spicy with some herbal bitterness.

Bottled 05/2007 Courtesy of bierkoning, ty Edo! Hazy murky orange color, small white head. Cellary, earth aroma. Flat mouthfeel. Earthy, a bit fruity. Propably infected and seems that MiP had same problem.
Bottle shared by TBone, thanks!. Hazy golden colour, not much head. Aroma is very much wet earthcellar and mild caramel. Flavour is raisins, yeast, earth and caramel.
Bottle, 5%. Oxidized cardboard aroma. Cloudy copper colour, small white head. OK cardboard flavour, a little plastic. Does not seem fresh.

Bottled. Citrus aroma with some flowers. Orange/golden color, off-white irregular head, fair lace. Very spicy, gingerale-like flavors (yuck!), light sweet, metallic bitterness, rather thin. Not my kind of flavors and rather amateuristic.
Thin head. Aroma has yeast and blackcurrant. Yeasty, very fruity flavor with some licorice. Fairly thin, just a bit watery. Nothing special.
Aroma of malts, also a bit grassy. Flavour is dry with some woody notes. There�s some malt sweetness in the finish.
Sampled at omhper, thanks. Oxidized aroma. Some marzipan taste and sweet. Thin body and medium bitterness.

33 cl bottle. Originally rated on 20110122. Pours dark amber color with a medium head. Aroma of sweet caramel, toffee, some caramel and ripe fruits. Flavor of ripe fruits, caramel malts and yeast, some toffee and spices too. Somewhat boozy but nothing disturbing.
Bottle@tasting (2005), 33cl. Head: thick beige colored foam. Color: red copper. Aroma: grain, hay, fruit. Taste: small bitter, mild. Palate: not long lasting. Overall: ok.

33 cl bottle @ Gastropub Tuulensuu. Rated on 22.01.2011 Aroma is somewhat sweet with dark, ripe fruits and hints of licorice. Flavour is sweetish and rich on malt with some caramel and licorice. Too sweet stuff for me.
Copper, light brown to red color. Thick vast foamy white head. Smell spices or herbs, I think coriander, little musty, lightly sour. Taste coriander, lightly sour as wel. Carbo and body medium.
Trockener, leicht s��er Malzantrunk. Dezente Fruchtnoten, alkoholische S��e. Schnell wird das Bier milder, zum Ende r�stmalzig, die S��e ist nun angenehm. 6/7/8/7/6/7

330 ml bottle. Finland. Reddish brown colour with tiny off-white head. Red berries, malt, dark fruits, bread and caramel in aroma. Flavour is sweet caramel malt, dark fruits and bread. Very pleasant strong malty dark ale.
Bottled. Cloudy nut brown. Aroma of marzipan covered chocolate. Sweet and yeasty with medium body and rounded spritzy mouthfeel, Flavour statrs drifting over old oranges into cellar, finishes dusty.

330 ml bottle @ Gastropub Tuulensuu. Pours a dark reddish brown colour without a head. Aroma of strong sweetish fruits, raisin and bread. Flavour of bread, dried fruits, yeast and syrup. Medium bodied, thick and slick mouthfeel. Quite decent and the alcohol is very well hidden here.
Draft - light yellow / orange - large white frothy head. Strong coriander aroma - pleasant. Good mouthfeel. Strong tasting, banana with tang lemon.

Bottled, from Biershop Baden-W�rttemberg. Cloudy pale golden, creamy head. Aroma of mashed banana and bicarbonate. Sweetish with medium body and rounded, spritzy mouthfeel. Mashed banana dominates, notes of cloves, mouldy autumn leafs and spun sugar. Low bitterness.

Die schlesische Knoblauchwurst schl�gt zu ! McTapps hat mir nicht viele Nasen voraus, doch hier hat es zuerst bei mir ordentlich geklingelt. K�mmel, Wurst und Knoblauch. Eine Misliwska, Krakowska oder Slaska - fl�ssig und deutsch. Krass, aber trinkbar.

Bottle from local REWE in Bad Urach. The beer has got a hazy light golden colour with an steady head and medium to thin body. Aroma of garlic sausage, yeast. Taste of light smoked garlic sausage (no, it was included in one of my meals these days), yeast, bananas. Drinkable, yet nothing good.
Tr�bes goldgelbes Weizen mit sch�ner Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, fruchtig bananig. Geschmack hefig, bananig, minimal w�rzig.

Im Antrunk sehr sch�n hefig-frisch, im Hauptteil etwas herb mit feiner Zitronennote. Der Nachgeschmack ist mir aber einen Tick zu muffig.... --> nicht so mein Ding! Test vom 29.11.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 12,9,11,10,12,10 - 10,30

It�s unclear golden with a creamy, white head. The aroma has notes of slightly sour yeast, citrus, light banana and wheat. The sweet flavor has notes of citrus, pineapple, banana, yeast, wheat and the finish is slightly spicy.
A blonde beer with a small head. Weak aroma. Light hoppy taste. Slightly bitter finish. A simple beer but easy to drink and quite well balanced.

Bottle: Medium and pretty vast white head on top of a hazy yellow to orange colored beer. Smell yeast, fruit, wheat, corn, malts, some sweets and a hint of something dusty. Taste has a lot in common with smell but is more grainy like wheat and malts, more fruity and more bitter. Ok beer.

Sorry for the german rating, but this is a lousy rating from my "newbie" time (2007-2009), and it�s not worth of being translated. I just added it for the statistics, and to complete my backlog! Ins Glas ergie�t sich ein herrlich orangebraunes Weizen mit pr�chtiger, feiner, langlebiger Cremekrone. Das Weizen duftet hefig s��lich, mit leichten Fruchtnuancen. Der Antrunk erfolgt relativ s��malzig, dominant hefig, viel weniger fruchtig als erwartet. Eine leichte Getreidigkeit kommt im Nachhall zum Vorschein. Die Mitte bleibt angenehm hefig s��, allerdings kommt eine gewisse Muffigkeit hinzu. Ganz ok, aber kein �berreisser!

Bottle 500ml. @ [ Scooper Tasting ], Ulfborg, Denmark. [ As Hochdorfer Dunle Weizen ]. ABV: 5.0%. Unclear medium amber colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, wheat, sweet malt, light caramel, moderate yeasty, weizen yeast, banana. Flavor is moderate sweet with a average duration, weizen yeast, banana, sweey yeast, sweet malt. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20170304] 7-3-6-3-12

Bottle, 5%. Hazy amber/brown with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, caramel, yeast, banana, spices and a little dark fruit. Flavour is malt, caramel, yeast, banana, medium sweet, spices, hop and a little bitter.
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Nice head with good duration. Color is hazy brown. Aroma and taste are yeast, banana, fruits, malt, caramel and hops. Sweet finish.
@Ulfborg Scooper. Cloudy amber, offwhite froth. Yeasty aroma, baking yeast. Sweet yeasty flavour, some caramely malt and sweet banana.
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Hazy amber with a white head. Aroma is sweet, wheaty, caramel, yeasty and heavy banana. Flavor is medium sweet. Sweet finish. 040317

Bottled, from Biershop Baden-W�rttemberg. Cloudy deep orange colour, creamy head. Fruity nose with plenty of banana. Mid sweet with doughy malt forming a mid sized body with rounded mouthfeel and prickly carbonation. Ripe banana, notes of cloves. Low bitterness. Pretty good, traditional dunkelweizen.
Tr�be braune Farbe mit sch�ner Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, w�rzig, fruchtig. Geschmack leicht hefig, w�rzig, minimal fruchtig.

Antrunk leicht s�uerlich-hefig. Das Bier ist insgesamt muffig-herb - vor allem im Nachgeschmack. Im Hauptteil kommen noch sch�ne R�stmalzaromen auf - mit einer leichten S��e. Eine interessante Kombination, mir aber f�r ein Weizen doch einen Tick zu herb. Aber noch durchaus gut trinkbar! Test vom 11.4.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 12,10,12,12,12,12 - 11,70
Pours unclear amber with a creamy head, which disappears fast. Wheaty aroma and fresh yeasts. Taste is more dominated by dark rich caramel, moderate sweet.

Bottle: Medium vast creamy light tan head on top of a hazy darker orange amber colored beer. Smell some wheat with toasted malts, hint of something like darker fruit and a stingy grainy plant kind of smell. Taste is a decent mix of some toasted grains, light sweet, light bitter, some caramel, wheat and hint of datker fruits. Not my kid of beer, but this one is quite ok.
Bottle. Poured a hazy golden color with a larger sized head. Yeast, some sweetness in the middle and a spicy finish.
De color dorado, con una buena cabeza espumosa. Cuerpo y carbonataci�n media. Aroma a pan y malta. En boca es agradable, frutal con un final levemente picante sintiendo la presencia del cilantro.
Pours brown chestnut with a light beige head. Aroma is malty nut flavors and aged yeast. Flavors mirror the same, with some toasted malts.

25th January 2009 Cloudy amber beer with a cream white head that quickly dies away. Soft beer. Hops dominate but they are very civilised and not bitter. Flavour tends towards a marmaladey orange. Some creamy malt as well. Low carbonation. Very easy drinking and satisfying beer.

Clean orange pour with no head. Aroma is orange marmalade, vanilla, golden raisins and grain. Flavor is sweet malt complexity with light orange notes, some zest. Light bitterness with some alcohol spice balances the sweet malts. very round and full flavored. Enamel ripper but not in a bad way. It has this soft and dry character with a mix of bitterness that clings to the decaying malt sweetness to balance pretty well. This smells intense and a bit winey but really comes together in the flavor. Ends a bit too dry and causes the finish to be chalky.
Bottle sample. Pours opaque orange with a medium beige head. Fruity aroma of raisin and strawberry with a bit of funk and cereal malt. Creamy and grainy malt flavor with a bit of fruit.

Pours opaque copper with gold edges and thin white head. The aroma is rich chewy aged malt sweetness, solid pine hop notes and a thick layer of yum. The taste is the same with rich smooth sweet chewy malts and pine hops. It runs smoothly into the finish with thick malts, muted pine hops and caramel. This has held up perfectly. I could drink plenty more of this.

bottle shared by Ibrew2or3. Pours a deep orange. Caramel, brown sugar, slight oxidation, sweet malts, hop presence. Flavor is carboard, slight floral and earth hops, musty, caramel sweetness and warming booze. Very very nice beer. Held up well.

�03 bottle thanks to Ibrew2or3. Poured a clear amber color with a dense white head. Aroma is caramel with a big hop presence, slightly vinous and alcohol notes. Medium creamy body. Flavor is sweet with lots of caramel, malt, some citrus, and a touch of honey. Finishes dry and slightly bitter.

thanks to ibrew2or3 for bringing this gem.�03 bottle pours hazy orange, white head. Surprisingly, the beer had retained plenty of carbonation and some light head retention. aroma and taste, lots of caramel, grainy mouthfeel. some chocolate also noticeable, finish keeps some light hops and overall a big caramel, fruity profile with some warming abv. Hops seemed a little more attenuated, nevertheless, a fine complex beer.

Vintage 6 years. Pours semi-clear dark amber color almost burn orange. There is a large off white that quickly disappears. Immediate strong aroma of hay and orange. The first thing I notice is how smooth this beer is for how big it is. Very complex things going on in it, not sure if I like some of them but some are very good. I get a feel for the once astringent hop bite that has now mellowed to a quarter of its old self. The malts are quite nice and some fruity esters and a good amount of sweetness. Overall it seems this beer has become more complex but lost some of the punch I like in beer.
Poured amber with white head. Past it�s prime. Some fruit and sweet malt malt but mostly booze. Still drinkable.

Draft and cask at Brewer�s Alley. Clear golden brown with off-white head. Aromas of caramel, citrus, malt, biscuit. Tastes of big malt, biscuit. Medium body with a dry finish. Cask was a bit too thin for my liking.
Cask and draft at the source. Clear amber color, thick beige head with good retention. Nice floral herbal aroma. Taste is earthy and bitter. Tasty.
Loved this beer. Big floral hops, sugary sweet maltiness, creamy and thick mouth feel.

Tap at the brewery. Pours clear amber with a medium, frothy off-white head, medium retention with good lacing. Aroma is citrus, earthy, and herbal hops, biscuit and cookie malt with apple and pear esters. Flavor is moderate hops and bitterness, light malt and fruity esters with a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.
nice beer. hazy amber pour. Very earthy profile, a bit of hop spice in the finish. This is probably the one I�d go back to with this brewer.

Cask at brewpub. Apparently this was brewed 10 months ago, so this is the 10 month edition of this brew. Poured a cloudy yellow/orange color with an off-white head. Aroma was sweet malty notes, touch of hop character. Aroma was hop, sweet malts, touch of booze. Pretty good.

Got this one on cask, served in tulip glass. Hazy caramel color with creamy off-white head. Aroma of caramel, light fruits, bread and some spices. Taste is sweet, thick and spicy ending with some hop bitterness. Full body with a nice warm finish. Nice!

10 oz tap - pours dark caramel orange and cloudy with small creamy white head, pretty finishing. Caramel aromas dominate with malted undertones. Medium bodied with tastes of orange, vanilla and malty sweetness. Good but not a cult beer.

On tap 4 oz. sample at Maryland Craft Beer Festival 2012. This is the 2011 version of New Moon. Pours very hazy and gradually clears, albeit never entirely. Nice, fine, white head and very good lacing. Aroma is spicy with floral hops rounded out by a solid dose of sweet caramel and bready malts. Taste is sweet and spicy with a solid sweet caramel and bready malt base and ample floral hops by the finish. Very nicely balanced. A tad below medium body and carbonation. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Served cask at the brewpub... very nice beer. Strong aroma, solid hops. 7.2% so served in the fluted glass vs. a pint... marginal decision to do this, but that�s okay. Good temp... not cold, but room temp. Very cloudy, foamy head that lasts, but doesn�t hold in aroma. Very nice Ale, strong but balanced. A Keeper.

column2: New York, New York, United States
column5: Sampled at the New York brewpub 16th Dec 2005, is this the one with blueberries in? if it is then this is the one that I had. Refreshing beer that tastes fine but is hardly exciting.

column2: New York, New York, United States
column5: Draught in New York. Cloudy charneol colour. Wheaty mouthfeel flavour with notes of blueberry and cherry. Boring beer but drinkable.

column2: New York, New York, United States
column5: purple and very soda-like. as with the other greenwich beers i thought this tasted a bit stale. very generic berry taste

column2: New York, New York, United States
column5: I'm such a sucker for a fruit beer. A bit heavily carbonated, but otherwise a basic brewpub fruit beer nicely done.

Always excited to see any beer that's labeled "Grand Cru"; some of my favorite beers bear this august appelation (Allagash, Rodenbach, Southampton). Alas, this will not be an addition to the pantheon. Muddy/dirty light brown/orange color, virtually no head (on tap). Slight spiciness in the nose, yeasty, and a bit of apricot/banana. Very sweet & fruity (bananas in syrup), a little weak overall flavor-wise. Just not a lot of character. I'm certain the beer would be helped out by not being served in PINT glasses at REFRIGERATOR temperatures! Idiots.

Opaque dark brown with a quickly dissolving thin tan head. Aroma of chocolate, roasted malt, oatmeal, mild coffee and a kiss of the hops. Taste of chocolate, oatmeal, dark chocolate, roasted malt and light coffee. Creamy texture and some chocolate bitterness on the back end. Overall I was impressed and will seek this one out again.

Dark brown pour with a thick, but fast-fading tan head. The nose is quite chocolatey. Nice sweet milk-chocolately initially with a little bit of light earthy undertones. The palate is quite nice. It has a slightly silky feel without being overly rich. A bit of herbal earthiness toward the back. It�s pretty simple, but it works for what it is.
Bottle. Darkest brown pour with a medium tan head. Malty aroma with lots of chocolate. Malty flavor up front with a bit of alcohol, some chocolate and a semi-roasty finish.

This Stout pours black with brown around the edges and has a medium tan head that recedes quickly. Small patches of lacing on the glass. Chocolate malt aroma with hints of burnt coffee. Medium, dry body with flavors of malt and dark chocolate plus hints of coffee and oatmeal. The finish is roasty with a dark chocolate aftertaste. Above average overall.

Her pour is clean and not very thick. Dark brown with black highlights, light peaks through rather easily while a small head is reduced to a spattering of bubbles. Coasting on up to my nose are sweet and bitter chocolate esters followed by caf� latte cream and fresh espresso. Her chocolate is enjoyably prominent, though I detect none of the standard American milk chocolate notes. Instead, I smell richer, harder, bitterer Belgian or Swiss chocolate notes which could be attributed to the chocolate being organic and not a product of mass production. Will her palate hold up to her nose? My first quaff is unexpectedly rather thin and very clean. Crunchy dark chocolates are backed up by espresso in the finish. A faint citric bite tingles on top of my tongue while an overall dry, roasted presence clears the moisture from my palate. The thin body is a bit of a distraction from her continuous chocolate parade, but overall she is highly enjoyable. Near the end, crunchy chocolate covered espresso beans join the mix, while more citric esters clean my palate for my final few quaffs. Overall, I rather enjoyed the Upland Chocolate Stout. Her only downfall would be the unusually thin body. As a chocolate stout, I expect more depth and weight to give her a full body to match her full palate. That aside, an excellent desert beer or after-dinner aperitif.

12oz. bottle thanks to 17thfloor. Opaque black with frothy, burnt brown head. Aroma is roast, heavy chocolate, some smoke and coffee. Flavor is chocolate, roast, slight cold coffee, smoke, some bakers chocolate, medium sweet, tasty but sweet and weird alc finish as it warms. Medium and light carbonation. Tasty but sweet and smoke is a little overpowering in this beer in particular.

12oz bottle. Pours a very dark glassy brown with a large foamy tan froth. Strong gritty roasted malt aroma, dark chocolate pieces, some coffee, quite nice. Really strange flavor, very different, dry coffee beans, espresso for sure, gritty dark chocolate, moderate acidity, nice bitterness, the sweetness is actually kind of off-putting, would be much better as a dry stout, lovely depth. Interesting palate, creamy but thin, crunchy carbonation.

Dark brown pour with tan head that ends up just a ring around the glass. Chocolate, roasty aroma with some coffee. Flavor is dry, dark chocolate, tobacco. Nicely dry and roasty. Smooth, smokey. Bitter finish. Pretty tasty.

Bottle received via trade with StFun. Pour was dark brown (almost black) with a little cookie colored carbonation. Aroma was malty and a little noticeable chocolate. Flavor was immediately of roasted dark malts, then a little chocolate and then finished smooth and smoky sweet. A very solid beer!

Bottle... Pours black with a small, creamy, beige head. Decent retention. Big time espresso and dark chocolate aroma outshines, but doesn�t wipe out, less significant notes of molasses and tobacco. Medium-bodied with middle-of-the-road carbonation. Bitter dark chocolate and espresso grounds flavor. Lengthy, acrid, bitter finish. Kudos to StFun for providing the bottle!

column1: Southampton Golden Valley Trappist Pale Ale
column5: Poured golden with a medium white head. Aromas of barnyard, leather, and sourness. Flavors are complex citrusy, sour, spicy, and bitter. Medium bodied, fizzy carbonation and a crisp finish.

column1: Southampton Golden Valley Trappist Pale Ale
column5: Pours a mild cloudy golden with a thick lacy white head. Aroma is loaded with dry Belgian malts. Dry, semi-sweet body has a powerful lingering floral hop quality, but could use more Belgian malty balance. An interesting style to say the least and fairly well done, but I�m not sure if it couldn�t use some tweaking.

column1: Southampton Golden Valley Trappist Pale Ale
column5: Bold horseblanket aroma, with a layer of sour on top. Flavor strikes hard with some sour lambic and some biting witbier characteristics. The finish is amazingly crisp, dry and short (just like Orval). This is an excellent (albeit rare) potable.

column1: Southampton Golden Valley Trappist Pale Ale
column5: gabf'03 Cloudy pour with spicy aroma. An evolving, tannin taste that is sour and woody. Evolves and finishes better when it warms.

column1: Southampton Golden Valley Trappist Pale Ale
column5: Excellent, almost creamy mouthfeel. Almost a translucent light orange appearance. Excellent beer overall, tastes very similar to Brewer's Art Pale Ale.

column1: Southampton Golden Valley Trappist Pale Ale
column5: excellent beer. dusty, lemony, yeast and citrus undercurrents, spicy. A lot going on and all of it good. Good length.

column1: Southampton Golden Valley Trappist Pale Ale
column5: GABF 2003: Dark amber color with a good white head. Spicy malt aroma, gets less sweet as you swallow and ends dry with a touch of sweetness.

column1: Southampton Golden Valley Trappist Pale Ale
column5: GABF '03 Excellent beer overall.It did lack head retention,but it fruity and malty in the nose.Mouthfeel was very smooth and silky,finishing dry in flavor.

column1: Southampton Golden Valley Trappist Pale Ale
column5: Pale cloudy orange. Little head, not stable. Very fruity nose, citrus, passionfruit, obviously very fruity yeast - a tad too exotic for a Belgian trappist... Taste is meaty, fruity, yeasty. A bit phenolic. Mouthfeel - its strength. Very dry, giving a perfect counterbalance for the fruitiness of the flavour. I pick up very little Brett, if any at all. Yet it is used. If Orval is the target - long way to go still. Problem is Orval is a very mixed batch of yeaststrains. This beer is complex, but not yet in the Orval way.

column1: Southampton Golden Valley Trappist Pale Ale
column5: This beer rocks! Cloudy, golden ale with a large, rocky, off-white head. The nose is fruity and tart. Spicy and earthy. Very complex and Geueze-like. Citrus fruit, yeast, banana, green apple and oak. Just an awesome aroma! Nicely balanced and full of flavors. Very yeasty with citrus undertones. Medium-bodied with a creamy mouthfeel and soft carbonation. Short, desert-dry finish. Damn fine beer!

Date: 10/11/1996 Source: Brewfest, Newport, OR cloudy yellow, strong rhy aroma and rich rye flavor lasting through the finish, brewed with 40pct flaked rye Aroma: 8/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 8/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 17/20 Rating: 3.9/5.0 Score: ***+/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.
Big rye and cake in the nose. Creamy mouthfeel with tobbacco and toffee, carmel and a touch of hops. Finishes with caramel.

Definitely not the most exciting beer Ive ever sampled at a fest or from Craftsman. To be honest, this one disappointed me. It poured an amber color with a thin sheet of pearlish head. The aroma was full of rye, bread, hops, citrusy orange, and something of a stir fry smell..very funky and hard to describe. The taste was super peppery, and I didnt dig that all too much. Very spicy and dry with bready qualities and souring citrus. Some peaches, salts and grapefruit skins in the aftertaste. This has so much going on, that the combination of tastes made this a disaster in the finish. I didnt understand this beer at all...not very impressive.

Sampled @ Pizza Port Real Ale Festival 2003.Beautiful copper brew with a full head that sticks around till the end of the glass. Nice hoppy nose. Has a sharpness almost tangy aspect to the flavor that I find fascinating. Slightly sweet front with a good bitter finish.
A very simple amberish brew with a small head on it. Nice floral aroma with some sugarishness to it, actually this tastes like a combination of a glazed jelly donut and tapioca pudding.
(cask) Orangish amber with a thin covering..Spicy sweet with lots of carmel flavors..pretty spicy throughout with bananas in brandy coming through in both aroma and flavor

column1: Rock Bottom Long Beach Buckin Ass IPA
column5: Almost brownish with a big ass head and had a combo of orange and cotton candy aroma and in the taste with average bitterness to add.

column1: Rock Bottom Long Beach Buckin Ass IPA
column5: (cask) Huge head atop dirty orange..subtle grapefruit hop aroma..balanced citrus hop flavors. Solid IPA yet nothing out of the ordinary.

column1: Pizza Port Red Square Imperial Stout
column5: Pretty solid. Reminded me of Santa�s Little Helper. Coffee and chocolate notes in a medium body. Just a little unbalanced. Pretty sweet without a lot of hop balance.

column1: Pizza Port Red Square Imperial Stout
column5: [At GABF 2004] A pitch black beer with a small ligth brown head. The aroma is sweet malty and slightly nutty. The flavor is sweet roasted with notes of chocolate and coffee. Great, but I�d like more complexity in the aroma.

column1: Pizza Port Red Square Imperial Stout
column5: Oil can black with an everlasting cream tan head. Major lacing. Aroma of must, raisen, dark chocolate, roasted beans and some ABV. The palate is creamy delicious. The body is well rounded and extremely smooth. One of the best Impy�s I�ve had.

column1: Pizza Port Red Square Imperial Stout
column5: On tap at Pizza Port Carlsbad. This is an excellent Imperial Stout. Pitch black like an Imp should be, moderate brown head. Aroma/flavor is rich,sweet, and slight burnt. Flavors of prune, molasses, coffee and chocolate come to mind - especially chocolate. Full bodied with a sweet, lingering finish.

column1: Pizza Port Red Square Imperial Stout
column5: Black Coloring with No Head. Thin Body. Main Flavors are Chocolate and Coffee Roasts. Drinkable and Smooth. Good Gateway Stout.

column1: Pizza Port Red Square Imperial Stout
column5: Bottle courtesy of TAR. Black color with no head. A little barley in the aroma. Some chocolate and coffee flavors, but watery overall.

column1: Pizza Port Red Square Imperial Stout
column5: On tap at Pizza Port in carlsbad. Appearance is what you�d expect and the aroma is about the same, malty with a hint of chocolate and coffee aromas. One person said that the overall aroma isn�t as pronouced as it should be, and I agree with that. The flavor is a bit lacking, not much but a little. It�s mostly a malty flavor. It�s not bad, but I feel that this could be a better beer if there was a little more intensity in the flavor. Overall a good beer, but could use a little more.

column1: Pizza Port Red Square Imperial Stout
column5: Bottled from growler from TAR: Poured pitch black with a slight wisp of a head. Aroma is mostly of cherries, slightly sour milk. Cherries took over midway through. Full bodied mouthfeel. Taste is cherry, roasted malt, with a hint of coffee. Good.

column1: Pizza Port Red Square Imperial Stout
column5: GABF 2004: Opaque blackness with a dense dark tan head. Aroma is roasty sweet and chocolatey, but didn�t seem to be as pronounced as most imperial�s aromas. Rich, roasty and sweet caramel malty flavor that is somewhat cloying and doesn�t hide the alcohol as well as it could. Finishes with some dark chocolate and roasted coffee beans. A nice imperial that could just use a little touching up.

column1: Pizza Port Red Square Imperial Stout
column5: Draught at Pizza Port (Carlsbad), California. Pitch black beer with a fine tan head. Sweet aroma with a nice roasted malt tone. Fruit also. Nice but rather mild. Full and heavy flavor. Dark roasted malt, chocolate and hops in the background. Some alcohol in the finish. An excellent stout enjoyed at a cool bar!

Tap @ brewpub. Golden orange color. Minimal flavors, smooth, slightly dry. So boring that it hurt. Do you ever feel guilty when you smile at the bartender and tell them you are enjoying the sampler when you wish they had something better to offer.

A nice sherbert orange color to it with medium head. Boring aroma of basically nothing more than the air around it. Some hops and some faint malts that are so faint that you can barely tell just what the hell they are, but they seem to be like 7 grain bread. Boring beer.
(cask) Amber color with a nice head..spicy hop aroma hints of must and brown sugar..soft floral flavors touch at caramel and peanut skins..

Sampled Pizza Port Real Ale Festival 2003. Pours a pale gold brew with a big densely packed white head. Yeasty, biscuity, orange peel nose. Had the first pour of this one and it was very bitter. Re-sampled later that night and found it much more enjoyable with hints of clove and coriander.
A bright glass of sunshine with a strong cherryish aroma that also sporting some yeast. Tastes like soap, rubber and yeast

(cask) Very brightly yellow with pineapples, strawberries, bananas and yeast in the aroma with lots of yeasty flavors..However it turns extremely astringent..but pear notes peak through the astringencies at times
I am so hooked on this beer. My husband likes it too. Please do not discontinue.
Very light color. Nice lemon taste, but unfortunatelly very watery, too. Not necessarily recommend.

pours watery light yellow, smallish quickly dissipating head, some lacing. 1st sip in an ice chilled glass, very crisp (due to the temp). 4th sip after 3 minutes, tastes a bit metallic (copper), minor grains (wheat, bread) and a very very faint lemony aroma with a bit of sour citrus. Light-bodied, low complexity, low depth. Too plain, too boring.

Lemon is strong in the floral and lightly grainy aroma. Brilliantly clear golden body is topped by a thin white head that lasts wetland laces nicely. Refreshing lemon blends well with biscuity cereal malt character and moderate crisp bitterness that keeps the sweetness in check. Light body with pleasant strong carbonation. Sampled on tap at the Black Frog in Gastown.
Lemon coloured, lemon aroma, lemon taste... who knew? Too malty with the lemon flavour, kind of an odd taste, methinks this would work better as a lager.
GCBF 2010. Pale yellow gold. No mistaking the lemon aroma and flavour here! Very lemony! Missing the tartness I had expected, and came off as artificial. Not my thing.
Draught at Amberjack Tap House, Surrey, BC Blond color; creamy head. Surprisingly... Lemon aroma. Dry Lager, poor flavor, with a disturbing lemon presence. Strong bitterness. Bah.

Can shared with mabel & jerc. Clear yellow-gold with a small white head. Strong artificial lemon aroma, with dirty yeast notes in the background. Thin bodied. Flavour has a lot of lemon, much less artificial than the aroma suggests (yeah, I thought just the opposite of jerc...). Not amazing, but relatively refreshing.

[1782-20081015] 355 can. Artificial lemon-lime aroma has a hint of lemon Pledge cleaner fluid. Clear, yellow orange body with quick white bubbles. Flavour is lemon slices and a little yeast. Light body has some bubbles and acidity. Interesting to try but not in a repeatable way.
(c/o GregClow, w/ him, jerc)

2008-10-15. Golden body with a small white ehad. Big lemony aroma, lemon juice notes. (6+) Flavour is very lemony, but seems a touch more artificial than did the aroma, not much of a base beer. (6+) Average to light body. Actually not bad, shandy like, but has not much depth to it. Could see this being a summery cocktail?
NIce foam and off-yellow body, aroma of some unique grains it seems. Flavour is a nice mix of grain and a bit of citrus, unique and well balanced. A very good drinker.
At the source: super mild golden pilsner. Super mellow bready lager. Low hoppage.
Very lush and creamy white head. Almost floral aroma. Crisp texture. Solid.
Some tangy barley malt. Light saaz hops. Hazy golden pour with ok head. Light tangy finish. Tap at brewery.

Draft - Nice sweet citrus and peel. Clear pale gold with a rich white head. Lots of leafy notes and leafy bitterness.. Earlier Rating: 11/1/2013 Total Score: 3 Draft - Sour lemon and white grape. Pale yellow and fizzy with a decent white head. Grains and white grape, slight bitterness and clean finish.

On June 21, 2015. At Storm Brewing, in Vancouver, British Columbia. Hazy golden color, white head. Sweet, light banana scent. Malty, cream taste. Bitter aftertaste. Medium mouthfeel, medium bitterness.

Sampled on tap at Storm, pours a clear pale golden with a small white head. Nose is fairly light, with notes of grass and crackery malt. Flavour brings out grassiness and some crispness. Thirst-quenching pils that is well-balanced. Very nice.

Nice deep brown hue and the aroma was like smelling rum nut iced cream. Had some carbonation problems and the alcohol kept butting into the flavor as it warmed. Better served cold where you can pick out a nice raisin/plum taste and an even malt finish.

Another strong example of Empires committment to producing fresh, well imitated German Beers. Pale Orangish yellow, with a grainy/malt aroma. This one opens up with a dry, sour malty taste that prepares you for the full body. When I say sour, I dont mean it in a bad way. This beer is excellent. Could stand some more hop flavor in the body, but I think I say that about all German Beers. This beer ends with a very meaty, warm alcohol flavor and leaves a sharp, tangy taste in your mouth. Has a few problems with carbonation but evens out as it warms. Overall the beer is very flavorful and a very unique beer.

From 2002: I drank this beer quite a lot over that summer. At first I didn�t appreciate this beer (certainly not knowing as much about beer as I do now), but I came to really enjoy it. Pours a golden yellow, with a small head. Has some earthy notes, plant/leaf maybe, and a bit of floral taste. Light body, easy on the palate and easy to drink.

Yellow-gold with some tinges of orange/copper. Fairly pungent aroma, with some grassy, sharp tones. Somewhat lighter in body than the Dortmunder, with more of an earthy/grassy appeal, maybe some hints of a light floral-lemon appeal. The body is medium to light and the beer is not too carbonated and quite even. A good rendition, but I prefer more malt.

A dark clear brown ale with a thin lacing moka head. A sweet lightly molassey bock with fruity bananas, and treacle. In mouth, a nice chocolaty banana, cloves and a bit of oranges. Very nice. On tap at brewpub, August 15 2008.

Sampled at the brewpub. AU15/08. App.: Deep ruby, remnants of a tan head. Aroma: Really vinous, tangy and woody, sour cherries and other sour fruits, currants, alcohol, quite assertive. Palate: Medium+ body and very soft carbonation. Flav.: More towards caramel and toffee, less vinous, a trace buttery, brown sugar and molasses blueberries and black currants. A fairly big beer.

A mix between orange gold and brown, with even some red flecks. Moderately small white head. Has a fresh almost citrusy smell. Empire�s classic example, called the Instigator. Smooth and tending towards a lighter malt taste up front, with some hops character. Grows sweeter and blossoms into a medium/full body with hints of what I would call a sweet orange flavor. Finishes with that traditional german yeasty/malt taste that is a little bit too sugary in my opinion. This one was lighter overall and less a challenge to drink than other dopplebocks. Prone to being a bit lacking of flavor overall. I liked the lighter take on a dopplebock, not really caring much for them, but a true dopplebock fan probably wouldnt.

Nov 2000 - the one we had was labeled Rauchbier, I assume this is the same. Nobody in my group but Matt liked this one. It It's very strongly, and artificially, smokey... if you like that. The guy said it used liquid smoke added to it rather than smoked malt. That may have changed since then.

December 2002 release. Smells like hops and burnt malt. Burnt gray/brownish appearance, with some deep tan tinges. Small dissipating head. Began very bitter but then blossomed into a sweeter caramel malt. Smokey flavor was present initially and at the finish. Had only a medium body and was a bit too fizzy for my taste, but the body was complex and certainly provided the smoked barley malt I was looking for. The great thing was that it did not overpower with smoked flavor. The brewer had some extra smoked malt lying around and on a whim decided to make this. A great beer.

Session beer made at Palm, but I�m not sure it is still produced now. Warm golden blonde colour and light fruitiness, malt sweetishness, bit metallic, thinnish mouthfeel, insufficient hops in the finish. Rather bland actually, I had many better golden ales from the Anglo-Saxon world, where they were invented. Forgettable.
Oro buona schiuma non molto persistente naso leggermente speziato maltata abbastanza dolce poco luppolo
From backlog Head: creamy, large , white Colour: yellow Smell: mostly yeasty and sweet , bit of hops Taste: starts is citric , then comes sweet malts, some sweetcorn , end is yeasty and a bit dry

On tap. Dark golden with white head, creamy, that quickly diminishes in a fine layer. Aroma is sweet and fruity. Flavour is fruity, bready, spicy, sweet at the beginning with a final moderate bittery in the final, dense on palate. Body is full. Carbonation is soft. Texture is oily.

Das Bier riecht und schmeckt feuchtig, dabei aber nicht wie bei vielen anderen s��. Die leicht alkoholische Note, die sp�ter ins Herbe umschl�gt, st�rt mich kaum. Das Bier ist insgesamt nur im Mittelteil w�rzig, besonders im Nachgeschmack h�tte dies aber nicht geschadet, da dort nur ab und an ein malziges Aroma vorbeischaut. Ein sehr ausgewogenes, leider auch teils w�ssriges Bier... Test vom 15.9.2006, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 7,10,10,9,8,11 - 9,85
gold blond coloured little sparkling body with a white head a sweet fruity aroma a sweet fruity herby taste with a alcholic bitter finish

Clear amber coloured beer with small white head and lots of carbonation. Alcoholic sweet and bit spicy aroma. Full palate. Finish is sweet herby with some nice spices. Good one, only the aroma is perfumed with too much alcohol, a pitty.
Number 500! Golden/yellow colored brew. Sweet, malty aroma. Fruity and creamy flavor. A bit dull, but enjoyable.
alot of citrus on this nose, and some yeast as well, red amber colour, some head, laces well, very bready taste, some citrus, decnt balance. good mouth feel decent beer
Clear yellow colour, sparkling, creamy white head. Fresh and fruity aroma, some malts. nice taste, sharp and creamy, herby. Bitter finish with some sweet hints. A Very nice ALe.
750 ml bottle. Vintage: 1999. Thank you Adamchandler on this share. Flavor has sour grain, lemon juice, mild vinegar, oak. Maybe tart berries and a mild vinaigrette finish. The carbonation is flat.
75cl Bottle @ Mikkeller Webshop, Copenhagen, Denmark. Hazy amber colour with no head. Aroma is tart, citrus, hints of vinegar. Taste follows the aroma. Medium body, soft carbonation.

Rami Rami is drinking a S�lection Lambic (1999) by Belle-Vue at Mikkeller Bar Warsaw Troszke ucieklo w ocet i korek, ale tez fsjne piwnicznosianowate klimaty., sa tez owocki... za agesywne octowo? Ale i tak najs zlozonoscia

Bottle, courtesy of Mats, thanks! Vintage 1999. Pours unclear amber. Aroma is pure horse blanket, hay, soft berries, oxidized but not too much. Body is medium, strongly sour but not tart, low carbonation but not lacking. Complex, but not overdone, maybe a tad too old. Not dead, though. Good!

1999 bottle, many thanks Mats! Clear deep orange color with no head. Aroma is berries, vineous, parmeggiano, horseblanket. Taste is horseblanket, a bit of everything, vinegary, but not too much yet. Oily mouthfeel with medium carbonation. Held up well!

(750ml 1999 bottle from Mikkeller Webshop) Pours a clear bright copper with a tiny white head that fades without lace. Aroma is quite tart, lactic acid, crabapple, musty basement, old wood, oxidized slightly nutty sherry notes, slightly spicy hops, citrus, light acetic notes. Flavour is quite sour, fruity notes of lemon, gooseberry, tart red berries, fruit vinegar, unripe pit fruit, sharp lactic acid, wet wood, Brett horseblanket. Finish dries lightly with wood and some oxidation but generally persists as very sour, lactic and acetic long into the aftertaste. Medium bodied with quite low carbonation remaining. Interesting and a bit challenging as this is clearly on the decline but still has some redeeming qualities. I suspect this was always on the sour side (a bit Hanssens-like?) but age and a little oxidation has thrown the balance off. That being said, it also still tastes good beyond the bracing nature. Very fun to try.

Dark brown color, small head. Aroma of roasted malts. Bit yeasty taste and malty. Not as sour as the Burg Dubbel, and that's exactly why this beer is more like a belgian double. I thought it was quite nice, one of the better Burg brews actually.
Strong coffee and milk chocolate aroma, like Wiener Melange. Also Wiener Melange flavor. Yeasty, very thin and water. Far from perfect beer, but drinkable.

Das Borsodi P�l� ist das alkoholfreie Bier der Brauerei. In manchen Quellen wird es auch als alkoholreduziert beschrieben, aber mit einem Alkoholgehalt von 0,5% ist es schon sehr alkoholreduziert. Es ist ein Vertreter der grauslichen osteurop�ischen alkoholfreien Biere, die eigentlich nur von trockenen Alkoholikern getrunken werden, deren Geschmacksnerven schon abget�tet wurden. Ein s��liches Gebr�u mit leichten Malz- und keinerlei Hopfennoten.
Bottle. Frothy White fair mostly deminishing head. Yellow colour. Light malty and hoppy aroma. Light bitter flavor. Short lioght bitter finish. Watery palate. Deasent Non-alc.
Can at home. Pours golden color, white head. Aroma and taste are malty, bit sweet, bit corny.
Hellgelbe Farbe, wenig Schaum. Geruch extrem d�nn malzig, s��lich. Geschmack w�ssrig malzig s��.
toast, caramel, earthy, cooked vegetables, pale, clear, rocky head, light sweetness, medium bitterness, thin feel, light body,
Bottle. Another non-alcoholic on the hungarian market. Plae golden colour, weak head. Sweet aroma and taste. Light bitter. Not so bad.

500 ml can. From Hungary. Clear pale golden colour with almost no head. Some fruit juice notes and malt in aroma. Flavour is not bad. It�s not good either. It�s almost drinkable. Corn, notes of vegetables and some fruitiness in flavour. I could drink another one if I really have to.

Smells of that typical low-alc mixture of lemon and bread; looks like lemon water, too, though lemonade is probably more attractive. Taste is bitter and sour corn, like fermented vegetables, without the alcohol. It would be a good drink to offer to kids to put them off drinking beer. All in all, another worthless non-alcohol.

No 793 Rated: 20.07.2009 Bottle brown, 500 ml, rated in Bogacs, Hungary. Appearance: Pours beautiful golden, very clear and lively carbonated body, head is initially medium, rather white, foamy to frothy in texture, initially medium but unstable and quite quickly decreasing to almost non-existant, there is a gentle lacing. Aroma: Crystalized honey, graphite, dryness being typical of a Low Alcohol beer, gentle notes of corn, corny syroup, weak barley grains, notes of caramel, toffee, burned sugar, slightly toasty,quite pleasant and again what is very positive, it is characteristic for its style. Flavour: Very refreshing, soft, light bodied beer with dominating sweetish flavour, especially notes of corn and corny syroup, some kind of gentle dryness in the aftertaste, it is very good as a Low Alcohol ans very easy going, some crystalized honey, watered down metalic, mineral impression, very clean in general, the bright malt is felt too. Finish duration is short. Palate: Body is light, texture is slightly dry, carbonation on palate is moderate. Finish feel is mineral, metalic, very clean, sweetish.
Bottle. Golden colour with a small white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops and very watery.

Dieses Bier wid seit 2016 nicht mehr abgef�llt. Es handelt sich um ein halbdunkles BIer, das man entfernt als Wiener Lager beschreiben k�nnte. Im Vergleich zu den tschechischen Halbdunklen war es aber ziemlich langweilig, was vielleicht auch zu seiner Einstellung f�hrte.
bottle @ supermarket. pale colour, light body, high carbonated, taste like between an average pilsener and lager beer
0,5l Flasche. Bernsteinfarbenes Bier, heller Schaum. Karamellduft. Geschmack Getreide und Karamel.

Can, enjoying the sun, random park, Budapest. Pours amber with a light tan head. Aroma of malt, caramel, sweetness, light chocolate, light fruit. Flavor is sweet, malt, caramel, weak chocolate notes, light fruity. Medium body, average carbonation. 290315

K�ls� megjelen�s�nek le�r�s�ra elnevez�se szolg�l: kellemes, borosty�n �rnyalat� sz�nben ker�l a poh�rba, melyhez egy eg�szen hat�rozott, piszkosfeh�r habkorona csatlakozik. Illata meglehet�sen semleges �s kezdetben �z�t sem nevezn�m �t�t� erej�nek. Igaz�b�l k�s�bb sem v�lik azz�, viszont id�vel mindkett�t �thatja egy enyhe mal�t�s aroma, id�vel pedig megcsillant n�mi karamelles �dess�get is, azonban igaz�n telt karakterrel egyik �zjegy sem p�rosul.

The content pours a dark amber color coverd with a decent geige coloured frothy head. There is a sweet and roasted aroma complemented by some chocolate smell in the background. The taste starts pleasantly sweet, slight roasty feel included, followed by some bitterness in the body, finishing with a slightly neutral feel. Easy to drink, smooth. Very decent.
500ml Dose. Bernsteinfarbenes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig, leicht fruchtig, hopfig, Karamell. Gesschmack leicht malzig, Karamell, hopfig fruchtig.
bottle Amber color, beige head. Better beer than the Borsodi stuffs. Medium body, caramel malt, light roasted and hints of hops flavor, with a light carbonation, aftertase a pleasant mild bitterness.
0,5l can. Color is amber. Aroma is caramel and taste is also pretty much caramel. Overall this is great beer, very tasty and drinkable, i would like to drink it again.
500ml can at Budapest. Clear amber colour with small head. Aroma is sweet malt. Flavour is caramel, bit hoppy finish.
HAd it years ago, I remember it was a decent one from P�csi S�rf�zde. It was a well-bodied, very good one, sadly, it has been retired.
Bottled, brewed by Pecsi S�rgyar. Pale yellow. Offputting aroma of raisin & garbage. Sweet with loads of DMS and eggfart, as well as cardboard. Revolting!

Bottled(500ml). -for that little alcohol content this is a very good beer, specially if we know that this is hungaryan beer, golden coloured, light yeasty aroma, medium head, quite drinkable and refreshing lager

12oz bottle, generic looking label with the small tip of a pointed leaf as the on eye catcher. Pours hazy pale color. Aroma of grassy hops, some grapefruit. Flavor of some pale malts, very bitter. Overly hopped. Too much bitterness compared to the watery malt presence. Not my bag.

Frothy white head, orange hazy color. Hoppy aroma--soap and grapefruit like. Interesting change from the standard APA with overdone Cascade. Flavor is hop crazy. Only complaint is that the incredible hop blending is wasted on a lighter malt presence. The same hops would be better in a beer that has a bit more alcohol--Imperial IPA or IPA.
Mmmm.... A flavorful and refreshing pale ale fron NC. Has a nice and spicy body with lemon and orange notes. A bit simple, but good.

Pretty Good. Dark Gold to light Copper, White head. Grainy aroma with some citrus hops. Hops dominate but are not to aggressive. Like most beers that play up the "organic" label, it is solid but not great.

Draught at Papa Joe�s, Cologne, 200ml, Filtered. Toffee brown colour, little carbonation. Sweet malts dominate the body, almost sticky, which is then pleasingly followed by a hint of hoppy bitterness. Biscuit sweet finish, not bad at all, made a change from Kolsch�s.
From tap. Roastmalty aroma with harsh hoppy notes. Tastes bitter, quite dry with a harsh hoppy bitterness in the finish. A bit hinbodied, maybe. QUite okay.
What can I say? THE beer for me from 84-87, Traben-Trarbach, W. Germany. I thought it was delicious then. These days I think it�s a very serviceable alt bier. Prosit!

Clear brown coloured, medium, mostly disappearing head. Malty, sweet and bit hoppy aroma and flavour. It was served in a very small (0,2 l) glass, which made me feel like i was drinking a regular cola. But apart from that it was ok.
Clear light brown color, medium head. Hoppy muffy, quite malty aroma. Light malty taste. Sticky palate.
Can. Pale yellow colour with a white head. Light malty in both aroma and taste, a bit sourish. Slightly better than the 2.8% version.
Can. A light yellow beer with a white head. The aroma is sweet with light notes of hops. The flavor is malty with a dry bitter and hoppy end, and the body is thin. Boring.
Very pale. Surprisingliy much taste for a 3,5% lager. I find it nicely hoppy.
Can. Aroma very much of hay. Pale yellow colour. Thin and boring............
(Thanks to Johnny) Can. Golden clear colour with a nice white head. Light hoppy aroma, also in the flavour, but ends up light and watery.
Can. Pale golden colour with a medium white head. Hay, grassy aroma and a sweet malty, hay, straw light skunky taste. Light body with a sweet finish.
(Can 50 cl) Pours clear and very pale with a very white head. Lightly malty nose. Thin-bodied with cardboard being the only flavour. Nothing else. Real ugly. 130806
Can. Clear pale yellow coloured with a white head. Aroma of boiled vegetables. Flavour of malts, cardboard and hops.
I was very thirsty when I tried this, so I thought it was quite refreshing.
Very pale golden. Fine, big rocky, white head. As otften with 3,5% Swedish lager this has a sour aroma and flavor. Apart from the sourness, there is no aroma to be found. No bitterness.

Pint on tap at Messrs on multiple occasions. Going back a bit to remember it but it was creamy with a good white head, quite hoppy with some caramel sweetness. A little chemically which was a slight drawback and would prevent you having a 2nd on a night out.
On tap at Messrs Maguire pub in Dublin. Orangey-amber colour. Sweet aroma with caramel and some earthy tones. Fruity taste, with caramel and some honey.

Light berry .. great creamy head .. pretty fruity .. whipped cream lacing .. really nice for an irish ale, good beer .. . . . Just read that 48 cans of Red Bull were stolen from a garage down the road during a late night heist. I don�t know how these people sleep at night.
On tap at Messrs Maguire pub in Dublin. Orangey-amber colour. Caramelly, earthy sweet aroma with light mushroomy notes. Herbal, fruity, with light caramel and even a hint of acidity. Overall Ok

Sample at the brewpub. Clear reddish-amber color with a medium off-white head that recedes quickly. Spotty lacing. Aroma of malt and slight hops. Light body with flavors of caramel malt and resiny hops. The finish is short with sweet malty aftertaste. Slightly above average overall.
La migliore Irish Ale assaggiata...anche se continua a non convincere fino in fondo

Thhis was the second ale tasted at the brewpub on the Liffy. I was able to get a tour of the brewery. It is a very compact brewery with limited space. They do a great job. This ale was a reddish brown in color with a creamy head. The cabonation was soft for this medium body beer. The ale could take more hops, but otherwise a very balanced ale. Smooth finish with no aftertaste.

Draught at the brewpub. Clear orange-red coloured with a creamy off-white head. Fruity aaroma of caramel, liquorice, tobacc, hops and ashtray. Fruity flavour of caramel, liquorice powder and hops. Fruit finish
Draught at the brewpub in Dublin. Red body, thick off-white head. Almost no aroma, meek taste, almost on finish. Of course, this is compares to the other excellent beers at the brewpub...

Strong sweet caramel aroma. Perfectly clear with a nice amount of head. Good caramel flavors as well but the hop bitterness is little stronger than it should be for an Irish red covering any malt flavors at the end.
V�gleg bez�rt sajnos, pedig ez a vil�gos egy j� �tlagos iv�s�r volt. Rest in peace.
tap @ beerfestival (budapest) pale colour, light body, normal carbonated, average lager, nothing special

clear golden colour, around 1.5 inches of foamy, long lasting white head - excellent appearance! aroma of grains, floral hops and some caramel (?), or something sweet - ok so far (not perfect, but ok); taste of malty sweetness, some bitterness, cardboard and a very intensive artificial taste....uhhhh this almost completely ruins the experience...

Draught, 0.30l. Clear golden color with small creamy white head, decent lacing and sparkling appearance. Aroma of herbal spicy hops, mild malt and honey. Taste starts light sweet malty with honey notes, followed sour herbal and grainy, with no noteworthy bitterness in finish. Medium body, slick texture and lively carbonation in palate. It seems not as good as dunkel, but I can�t prove it with my rate. Anyway, I liked this one a lot, too...

On tap at the brewpub. Nice golden body with a white foamy head. Sweet grainy, a bit nutty and bready malty aroma. Flavor is grainy and bready with a decent floral hoppy finish. Very easy to drink. Decent beer.

F�zdefeszt, Budapest, v�gtelenedik s�r Marko-val v�llvetve. Op�los, vil�g�t� arany sz�n �s k�zepes m�ret�, laza feh�r hab. Mal�t�s, el�gg� jellegtelen illata van, de �zben m�r jobb, kellemes mal�ta�z �s vir�gos, k�zepesen keser� koml�, illetve halv�nyan mal�t�s ut��z jellemzi. K�nny� test�, friss�t�en sz�nsavas �s nagyon j�l ihat� vil�gos.
F�zdefeszt, Budapest. Poured an orange-ochre body. No aroma, very vague grain maybe. Quite nice bready taste though, dry, light, no off flavors, pleasant and refreshing. Nice!

On tap at Blonder S�rgyar. Well, after Barna this one was letdown. Pale golden coloured, small white head, strong butterscotc nose. Buttery again, moderate malty, pleasant hoppy and touch of lemon. Rather bitter finish. Drinkable and refreshing but Barna is still my first choice.

Clear golden body with a nice and stable white head. Buttery yeast and sweet pale malt aroma. Some typcal hungarian micro-brew character in the flavor with a sweet malt taste, moderated bitterness, low carbonation. Not bad, some bittery finish whit a minimal young beer character.
A perfume-smelling very pale beer. An oily palate, but the environment, as mentioned above, is important! A good beer at a lovely place!
Bottled. Pale yellow. Grassy nose. Medium dry with clean, hardmouthfeel some grassy bitterness. Half-decent, but not very complex, and a bit bleak.
Cask at Moon Under the Water. Mild fruity and floral aroma. Clear golden color with medium sized creamy white head. Bittersweet, floral and fruity taste. Thin body, soft and silky carbonation.

Cask-conditioned, on gravity, at the Commercial Rooms (JDW), Bristol 11/10/2018. Amber in colour, with a slight, white, head. Citrus hops, tangerine fruits, sweetish malts and a pleasantly bitter finish. Good.
Cask at the Old Manor (JDW), Bracknell. A pale amber pour with a grainy aroma; creamy in the mouth with a smooth grainy body, some citrus and a spicy bitterness with a lingeing finish. Pretty good.
Cask at the standing order. Pours clear golden, nose is light fruit, musty toffee, taste is zesty, floral, cloying.
very pale with foamy head and high carbonation for cask. weak citrus aroma. taste is strong malt backbone with grassy hop and decent bitterness. not bad
Cask at the strugglers inn. Pale golden colour with a white head. Aroma lime and malty. Taste light bittersweet to sweet. Medium body.

From cask at Moon Under Water, Manchester, with JFE and BG 21.01.18. Clear golden. White head and lacing. Refreshing aroma of meadows, citrus, succade and bitter marmalade. Hop bitterness is lingering on.
Cask at Wetherspoons 2007. (Brief tasting notes and rating from old records) - Spicy peppery hop and bitter fruit. Crisp. Tart. Long bitter hoppy finish. (Backlog)

Pint at the Stick or Twist, Leeds for 2.69. Appearance is light yellow. Smell is of citrus. Taste is of almost a bit of straw, citrus/that kind of grapefruit bitterness. Not a bad pint but quite over powering, not sure I'll rush back to it but still decent.

Pint at the Hop in York. Bright gold with a dense white head. Fruity citric aroma, Rose�s lime marmalade flavour, juicy sauvignon, crisp finish. Wife, who started with a pint of Osset Blonde, switched to this after a sip. Mal and I agreed that this was a deceptive, seductive brew that could ensnare you all too easily.

Color negro con capa de espuma marr�n de tres dedos de grosor y retenci�n decente. Carbonataci�n suave. Textura acuosa. Aroma tostado, con reminiscencias de malta torrefacta y regaliz. En boca sigue al aroma. Bastante tostada y con mucha presencia de regaliz. Ni caf�, ni chocolate, ni, sorprendentemente, metal. Ni dulce ni amarga, se queda en terreno incierto. Al menos no sabe abiertamente mal.
caramel, toast, cereal, black, cloudy, rocky head, brown foam, very bitter, medium body, sticky, soft carbonation, bitter, long finish, Botella: 33cl, lata: 33cl 2016 2�/l

From Carrefour. In Teku glass. Playing Blackwell Epiphany. Decent. No torrefact nor coffee notes. Dull, with some metallic notes. Wont displease but dont provide much flavor or aroma either. A bit sweet
Negra, espuma de corta duraci�n. Muy maltosa. No est� mal. Aroma muy tenue, un toque de cereza. Perfectamente aceptable, bebible, pero carece de clase.

Botella 33cl tomada en varias ocasiones �ltima en Carrizo de la Ribera verano 2010. (r309). Color negro con bastante espuma beige. Aromas y sabores maltosos y cereales algo tostados toscos. Sin mucho que decir. Corriente.
Bottle from World Market in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is prunes, baby food purees, molasses. Taste is prunes, vegetal and goes thin quickly. Overall, this has liquid adult baby food vibes.
0.33 l can. Black color with quickly disappearing head. Sweet, malty aroma and some yeast maybe. Bittersweet, kinda well balanced taste. Short finishing, medium body, soft carbonation. Not bad.
Tap at leupold. Pours amber. Aroma is sweet, grainy, malty. Flavor is sweet and malty, grains, some hops, caramel. Overall: drinkable.
T�p @ schwechaterhof, steyr. Meg egy hopfenperle, �geszen �zlik nekem ez a sor t�pus.

Klare, gelbe Farbe mit wei�er Schaumkrone. Angenehm malziger und floral hopfiger Geruch. Geschmacklich floral hopfig und leicht fruchtig mit einer unterschwelligen Malznote. Mittlere Bitterkeit mit leichter S��e, mittlerer K�rper mit sp�rbarer Kohlens�ure. Erfrischend und s�ffig.
Draught at Restaurant Ochsenkopf/Wien 14. Bitter-refreshing beer. O.k. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours clear blonde, good fluffy white head. Smell is malty, tad bitter. Taste is bit bitter, very refreshing , mild fruity undertone. Bit malty, not so intense yeast. Very Nice !

Draught, small stable head, a little hazy deepish gold colour, aroma of herbs and vanila, fruity flavour with herbal and grassy hops, medium strong and mellow herbal bitterness, pleasant bittersweet aftertaste. Good balanced pilsener.

From tap on a nice terrace in Vienna, filtered beer with golden colour and unstable white head. Smell: yeasty, nice perfumed with malts. refreshing taste, hoppy, yeasty, citrus, very nice malty aftertaste.
On tap in Melk. Golden color, small white head. Aroma, fruity, hops. Taste hops, citrus, bitter. KMedium bitter finish. Drinkable beer in hot days.

@ a bar in Vienna. A clear yelow/golden colored beer, with a foamed white head. The aroma of hops, citrus, fresh and malty. The taste is hop bitter and fruity like citrus. It has a nice bitter aftertaste.
Pours very pale yellow/golden with a creamy head with laces. Aroma is very flowery hops and citric. Flavour is flowery hops aswell and it is a bit dry with a nice palate.

Draft at Maulwurf courtesy of Sebastian, thanks! Clear deep ruby amber color, fluffy tan head with good retention and solid lacing. Roasty aroma, slightly metallic. Taste is herbal, lightly bitter and roasty, dry finish. Nice.

Im Antrunk ist es ziemlich laff, aber im Hauptteil ist es sch�n frisch-malzig mit angenehmer S��e. Leicht herb im Abgang und dazu aber sch�n weich-vollmundig. Im Nachgeschmack ist auch eine sch�ne malzige Schwarzbiernote wahrnehmbar --> sehr zu empfehlen! Test vom 7.1.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 12,12,11,12,12,11 - 11,45

bottle, bought at the brewery. Clear deep brown colour, large off-white head. Malty nose. Medium-bodied, malty background with flavours of roasted malts, caramel and rather intensive cocoa powder with woody-sourish touch in the cocoa part. Interesting and quite nice.

(bottle) Clear, dark brown colour with a medium-sized off-white foamy head. Sweetish, quite soapy nose with light notes of toasted malt and caramel; sweet and slightly bitter flavour; slightly roasted and a bit perfumed malt-character with a touch of caramel; light sweet and bitter, papery malty finish with faint hoppy notes. Not very pleasant.

Bottle: Deep amber coloured, slowly diminishing tanned head; caramelly and soapy nose, moderate sweetish (perfumed)-bitter flavour, light bodied; roast-malty, sweetish, perfumed finish with a touch of vegetables. Almost a drainpour..............
Bottle, 5.1%. Almost black colour. Very small head. The flavour is OK sweet, slightly fruity for the style, seems to have a little apple? Medium carbonation.

(Bottle 50 cl) Comes as "Scwarzer Ritter" credited to "Kronenbrauerei G. Haizmann" in Nagold. Very dark beer with a red tint. Practically no head. Dark - also in the flavor - from the roasted malt, quite dry with some bitterness. Especially in the palate. Strange sediment at the bottom; almost like tobacco. 130304
Some malt and roast notes. Brown colour, o.k. head. Some acid, malt, but hop is dominating.
Bitterhop nose, a bit dusty. Dark brown, nice head. Malt and bitterhops present but not exciting. Light caramel aftertaste. Weakish body. Not as interresting as I had hoped.

Draft: Charred caramel. Minimal ashen ring of foam. Rich malt nose with notes of cinnamon bread, prune, caramel, baker�s chocolate, fig, and walnut. Northern Brewer battles the Fuggles for supremacy, and easily wins. Hints of black cherries and rumlike alcohol. Extremely mellow, full-bodied, and quite silky. Tangy hop notes with flashes of coffee, dried plum, dark grape, metal, and brown sugar. Big Fuggle earthiness and leafiness to follow. Long raisiny, toffeeish finish. Nothing short of stunning.

Rich, strong -- a perfect representation of the style. Fruity hops with potent malts. Caramel flavors with notes of bready tang. Dark, wet brown sugar shades in a sticky lacing-coated glass. An amazing celebratory brew that exemplifies the success of a great local brewery.

Malty, sweet and vinous aroma, with a distinct grainy spiciness, light but varied fruitiness, faint brown sugar and perhaps a slight hint of yeast. Medium garnet in color, tightly clinging head. Flavor is likewise sweet and malty with hints of banana, spicy, lightly fruity rye, bread, toffee and a slight roastiness. Very faint spicy hop flavors here but very low bitterness, befitting the style. Grainy, malty finish, some lingering toast/biscuit. Medium-full bodied and has a smooth consistency overall. Sort of a modified Wee Heavy style strong Scotch. Pretty tasty. Congrats, Free State.

Bottled, from Biershop Baden-W�rttemberg. Almost clear golden, rich creamy head. Fruity nose with some dough and minerals. Mid sweet with medium body and rounded mouthfeel. Fruity and bready, some cantaloupe and vanilla. Fairly low bitterness. Decent helles.

Wenn ich bedenke, welche grossen oesterreichischen Piwos ich bisher getrunken habe und wie sehr diese gegen dieses, durchaus recht simple, deutsche abfallen - nun das ist erstaunlich. Denn dieses hier bietet ausser Sueffigkeit nicht wirklich viel mehr. Etwas Malz, ein wenig an Nuessen, vielleicht Butter und einen Schuss Vanille. Es punktet jedoch auch mit einem milden, ausgewogenen Ende.

Bottle from Getr�nke Beck in Reutlingen. The beer pours out in a clear golden colour with airy steady head and medium body. Aroma of hops and malt with some strawy hints. Taste of mild hops, light fruits, mild malt, bread and barley. Easy drinkable and not that bad.
Drunk from 50cl bottle bought in Pforzheim, Germany. Enjoyable hoppy dry pils. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Goldgelbes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig, getreidig. Geschmack malzig, leicht s��, minimale Herbe im Abgang.

Ein Bier, das nicht nach wirklich viel schmeckt! Ziemlich w�ssrig, dabei leicht s��lich - ansonsten ist da nicht viel! --> F�r mich sehr langweilig! Test vom 10.2.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 12,6,11,4,12,5 - 6,95
bottle from the brewery. Clear golden colour, intensive malt aroma. Full-bodied, solid and intensive malt flavours with pleasantly aromatic hops. Very good, much better than the name suggested.
Hazy golden amber colour, not much head. Aroma soapy resin malt with hint of citrus fruit. Dry biscuit, resin & citrus fruit flavour.

Leicht w�rziger Antruk, schwach hopfig, sehr w�ssrig. Nur schwach aromatisch, hierbei sticht eine w�rzig-bittere Note heraus. Spritzig, im Mittelteil etwas malziger, ebenso im Abgang. Das Bier wird etwas hopfig, so wie es bei der vorhandenen W�ssrigkeit nun mal geht. Wenig herb. Danke an den Doppelbock f�r das Bier. Test vom 19.5.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 9,7,7,8,6,7 - 7,30
Bottle. Golden colour with a white head. Aroma is malt, grain, hay. Flavour is malt, grain, hay, hint of hop. OK beer.

Date: 10/07/2003 Mode: Bottle hazy dark yellow, sweet aroma - blueberry, malt, corn, yeasty bread - mild sweet flavor, good dose of blueberry without being too sweet, essence of doughy bagel, Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 13/20 Rating: 3/5.0 Score: **+/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

Last remnant of the BIF 13 from hell package from BeerAdvocate drewbage, this one was a 22 oz. bomber promising extra pain. Blueberry Bagels are not my favorite anyway, and making a beer with that flavor seems like a particularly horrid idea. When poured into a pint glass, this one looked average, with a pale macro yellow color and fizzy carbonation feeding a foamy small head. Lacing was much better than macro swill. The aroma was totally nonexistent. No hops, malt, blueberries, nothing at all. Only smell was a bit of grainy alcohol and water. The taste was not objectionable, but that�s about it. It had a macro like sweetness with a hint of blueberries. The beer felt thin and unsubstantial on the palette. I understand the need for micro brewer�s to experiment a bit, but making a Bagel Beer line was not a good idea. No wonder they closed down.

Brewtopia�04. Figured I�d go ahead and sample their beer since they were good enought to sponsor the tasting glasses - I�m usually not into gimicky such beers. Smelled and tasted bready and doughy, some blueberry. I guess they hit their mark, although it�s not a very appealing beer to me.

Tasted in NYC. Tasted at Brewtopia 04. Aroma is of bread and yeast. Very little blueberry present in the scent. Appearance is thin and clear with alight straw yellow colour with a small white head. Taste has a very strong bread flavour with an ending that is subtle blueberry.

Light gold, sticky white head. Nose is less than promising. Bit of blueberry, but has an unpleasant skunkiness, off and a bit sour. Starts sweet, then comes the blueberry. To steal a line from BierBauch's rating, it tastes quite a bit like a blueberry Pop Tart, definite fruit but tastes pretty artificial. Brewed with blueberry bagels, and I can't imagine who thought that sort of thing would be a good idea. Does improve somewhat as it warms, artificial sweetness fades away and develops at least a decent malty character.

A vigorous pour resulted in only a modest white head that shrank considerably in a short time. Color is a clear medium gold. The aroma was light at first but soon after it had warmed, I could begin to smell the blueberry in what otherwise seemed like a pale ale to me. Funny, I kept smelling the blueberry as if it had some rosemary in there too. Weird. The blueberry was actually a bit like the aroma of a blueberry poptart also. Anyway, the texture of this beer was almost like a cream ale. Quite smooth and creamy. The overall flavor was interesting yet kind of uneventful. Like a pale ale with the blueberry in the background somewhere. I really like the Pumpernickel Porter from this brewery, but this one misses the mark a bit. Not a bad ale, just not a great one.
Wow!This was a good brew.Poured a golden color and was very fruity on the nose.Had a strong blueberry taste with very little after taste.The finish was clean.I reccomend this to others.

Sort of a gassy, wort-like aroma - bit of a fruity undertone to it though - not unpleasant. Little to no head - light golden, cloudy appearance. Sweet, somewhat artificial flavor - not a bad mouthfeel though - slightly velvety. Would be very refeshing outdoors on a hot day. Stays strong throughout the whole 22 oz bottle. Not a bad effort for a novelty beer - 3rd of the "Bagel" beers that I have had and all in all they are not bad.

Kind of stinky Kolsch aroma. Lame label. The flavor is segmented: sugary sweet, then a little tart followed by the fruity flavor. The blueberry isn't easily identifiable, as with Sweetwater Blue (which if you're looking for a blueberry beer, and you have a choice, that's the one to get...) Golden beer. The palate is starchy and sweet, like froot loops milk sorta. The finish is short and sweet. A novelty beer, certainly not worth the $4 that I paid for a bomber.
Tried back in 2010 on my first visit to Durham with Dave. Just now transferring the rating. Light and mild. A little grassy, some musty fruit finish. Really nice.

A hazy light orange beer with a fine dense head. The aroma is sweet spicy with coriander and grass standing out. The flavor is very hoppy, grassy, and oily. A surprisingly good beer, that I'd categorize as an IPA.
Golden coloured. Nicely hopped aroma of peaches, apricots and some grass. Hoppy flavour with plenty of bitterness. A very pleasant and hoppy brew.
Reallay dry, dry malts, dry hoppy finish, earthy slightly metallic finish, real dry grainyness, lemon and banana.

Light yellow color, hazy when you pour the generous yeast from the bottle, little carbonation in body but a big fluffy, white head. Hoppy, floral, if a bit one-dimensional aroma. Very very dry, bit of an astringent, metallic edge that fades a bit, leaving wheat but a longing for something other than bitterness.

Bottle conditioned. Hazy thin amber. Tendrils of orange vines shoot up the nose, nestling warm and spicy under the eyes, pulsating like an Alien larva ready to feed. Soft, juicy and natural mouthfeel as the waters of Pishon and Gihon must have tasted. A hop, skip and dance of young, throbbingly naked yet obscenely chaste, citric sprites leads to an initially watery then briefly bitter finish. Spent on the early desire. [3.4] Re-rate. Bottle Conditioned, with Nuffield & Duff. Extremely dry. Citric hops and wheat in an English Pale style - a Golden Summer Ale. [3.2] The Durham Brewery was founded in 1994 by ex-music teachers Steve & Christine Gibbs.

Bottle conditioned. Straw gold, good white head and moderate condition. Chunky thick dark yeast sediment. Hops mingled with fruity yeast in the nose, Grapefruit and yeast in the mouth along with a slight phenolic taint. Quite sweet in the finish but with a good hop bitterness.

A very nice session IPA. It is not a blonde at all. Sweet citrus perfect session ipa. For abv this is simply amazing. Nice lasting head. good flavors overall. Very nice. This drinks like a 6.8 percent beer. Amazing!

06Jul2019 Sour citrus fruits, orange and lemon peel, lemon pith. Slightly hazy gold, small, frothy, white head. Light bitter. More zesty, pithy citrus fruits, orange and lemon peel, wet straw, soft carbonation, light bodied. Alright. Cask at Black Isle Bar and Rooms, Inverness.

Bottle in Edinburgh, pouring near-clear pale golden, with white head. Aroma mild citric, grapefruit, not specifically very hoppy. Taste same: citrus, grapefruit, bit tangerine indeed. OK carbo, slightly watery feel This is presented as IPA nowadays, but I wouldn't say that, although it's surely a nice bitter.

Aromas- Sweet of elderflowers, lemon zest, sweet grasses and light hops. Appearance- Clear golden colour with medium white foam. Palate- medium to light body and slick texture leaving bitter finish. Taste- Initially sweet of lemon and sweet grasses but then develops this hoppy bitterness with herbal and grapefruit characteristics. Overall- It is not mind blowing, it is not complex, it is simple. But boy it is refreshing and tasty!

33cl bottle, enjoyed in a snifter on 12-Apr-2019. Hazy golden colour with a medium sized white head. Arima of citrus and malt. Light to medium body and lively carbonation. Taste of grain, grapefruit and bread. Sweet with light bitterness. Light fruity finish.
Botella 33 cl. Colecci�n. (r94). Tomada en junio 2009. Fcpref 30..01..2010. 7.9 vol que se dejan notar. No estaba mal en su momento. Normal.
330 ml bottle. Dark copper color with beige head. Malty aroma, caramel, bread, some fruity notes. Sweet and light biter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.
Clear ruby, faint head. Metalic and fruity, sweet and sugary. Shallow character with slight sloppy caramel. Low bitterness. A pitiful ale with truly industrial flavour.

La Douglas Celtic Brown sorprende en primer lugar por su color marr�n con reflejo rojo malva, la espuma es m�s bien abundante y buenas burbujas.
