La nariz, de intensidad media a fuerte siente las frutas rojas y m�s precisamente el zumo de uvas prensado. Tanbien descubrimos olores de malta muy torrefacta. En boca es medianamente densa y el final de intensidad fuerte. Bien equilibrada, bello vestido y aromas ricos la hacen una cerveza que merece el rodeo a falta de ser profundamente original.
---- personal review, no claim to be representative or neutral ---- repost undesired --- ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
33cl Bottle @ Cerveceria Internacional, Seville, Spain. Dark amber colour with a thin white head. Aroma is malt, caramel, toffee. Taste follows the aroma. Medium body, average carbonation.

Riqu�sima scotch con un sabor delicioso, de los que llegan. No tiene un aroma ni un cuerpo especial, pero me gusta mucho y repetir�a sin dudar. Cada paladar es un mundo, pero creo que las cr�ticas anteriores han sido muy duras, casi no me la pido y me la pierdo bas�ndome en lo le�do.
bottle 330ml. dark amber color with lasting head. aroma of roasted malts and fruits. flavor is sweet, malty with hints of caramel and fruits. hoppy finish.
Amber pour with a white head. The aroma has a lot of toffee and light grass notes. The flavor is similar with the addition of some cocoa to the toffee. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

33cl bottle from Terre de Boissons, Calais. Deep ruby, amber, brown lasting beige head. Dry malty aroma. more dry malt on flavour. Some spicy dryness on the finish. Went ok with the pasta dish I was eating. Some walnut flavour. OK. Just

(Bottle 75 cl) Hazy, pale yellowish with a rather small head. Heavily carbonated though. Belgian inspired spiciness, but it doesn�t really come out with much of a pow or refinement. Bit weak in the flavours actually with a surprise bitter finish. Decent as a quencher and gains a bit when it warms. 240802
Plae beer with a slightly frothy head. Slightly citric aroma with hints of bitterness and nutmeg. Overall tyhough a watery wheat beer effort, a bit basic.
No aroma. Clear amber, thin head, good lace. Grass. Medium body, easy carbonation.
Tap at brewery poured clear copper with a thin off-white head and dissipating lacing. Aromas of citrus, caramel malt, English hops, with hints of rye. Flavor is medium bitter. Tasty.

Draft sample at the source. The beer is a clear amber color with a white head of foam. The aroma has very moderate bitterness notes of grass and some light herbal notes. Lower to medium bitterness in the taste. Medium body and medium carbonation.

4oz on tap at the brewpub. Clear orange color. Thin off-white head, leaving good thicker lace. Medium-plus body. Smooth, kind of soft light carbonation. Light dry finish. Decent sort of spicy kind mildly piney hop, hint of citrus. Mostly sweet caramel malt, though. Moderate sweet taste, lighter bitter. Decent brewpub IPA.
Draft at the source. Crystal clear golden color. Light floral aroma. Taste is fruity and bready.
Pours lightly cloudy amber with low white head. Aroma of pine, citrus, light tropical fruit. Taste is hop intense and bitter up front with very little balancing sweetness. Body is a touch too light.
Clear amber color with ivory head. Mild caramel, earthy hop aromas. medium body, average carbonation. Caramel, pale malt flavors with some hop bitterness to finish
Tap. Amber in color with a good head. Taste is citrus, bitter. Aroma is spruce, citrus.

Draft sample at the brewpub on July 14, 2012. Medium amber hue, somewhat subdued bittersweet nose, somewhat creamy texture, good bittersweet flavor with the hops front and center and the malt in an important supporting role. The recipe for this beer seems to have been tweaked for the better since the last time I had it a few years back. Very good brew.
Draft, sampler: amber color with an off white head. Strong citrus aroma and a massive hoppy bitter flavor. A bit much in my opinion.
Mild pecan nose, maybe coffee. Clear brown, thin head. Tree bark. Light body, moderate carbonation.

Draft sample at the source. The beer is a clear brown color with a beige head of foam. Fair retention. The aroma has mild caramel and a bit of toffee sweetness. Some roast. Medium sweetness throughout. Lighter in body and moderate carbonation.

4oz on tap at the brewpub. Good toasty malt, kind of spicy. Some nuttiness, mild caramel malt. Definitely drinks like an English-style brown. Moderate sweet, light to moderate bitter taste. Mildly astringent. Clear red, slight camber color. Thin off-white head, leaving great thicker lace. Medium-plus body. Kind of slick texture. Kind of crisp lighter carbonation. A pretty reasonably solid english-style brown ale. Classically styled.
Draft at the source. AKA Downtown Brown. Clear amber color. Light toast aroma. Taste is burnt brownies. Light body.

Draft: Very nice...nutty and roasty. This has a great earthy quality to it. Goes great with some of the great food they offered at the brewery. Lot�s of caramel sweetness. This is a great brew that I would recommend you try.
Pours clear brown with low white head. Aroma of caramel, chocolate malt, citrus. Taste is lightly sweet with mellow hop kick in the finish. Body is light and smooth with soft carbonation.
Clear dark amber color with ivory sheen. Nutty, dry caramel aromas. medium body, average carbonation. Nutty, dry caramel flavors with a lightly bitter finish
Draft sample at brewpub on July 14, 2012. Medium amber/brown color, nice firm malty nose, good malty flavor with more backbone than a lot of brown ales. Good for style.
Draft sampler pours amber with a beige head. Aroma is basically malt. Taste is much the same with a sweet finish. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft at brewer. Pours a dark red/brown with a thin off white head. Scent is sweet caramel malts. Taste is caramel malt, nuts with some earthy notes.

Clear yellow in appearance, with a noticably weak aroma of lemons and yeast. Very pale feel on the tongue, and overly watery with little carbonation. I guess I could describe this one having pale lemon flavors, with close to no other noticable flavors at all. Only slightly better than the Boyd Street Wheat.

Canned. Thimsfors used to be a small regional brewery that went out of business some years ago. The brewer founded a new brewery and has relaunched the brand, initially (2001) the beer was rumoured to be made under license in Germany, and if this has stopped I do not know. Golden colour. Neutral aroma. Sweetish, clean and light bodied with rounded mouthfeel and low bitterness. Decent, but highly unremarakable.

Draught, 5.8% at the brewpub. Hazy yellow colour. Stable white head. The flavour has a mild sweetness with some honey to it. The honey can be tasted but is not exaggerated. A little citrus in the finish. High carbonation.
cloudy pale orange colour, nice head and lace, honey and grassy aroma with light diacetyl notes, tart and astringent, light oily, short dry honeyish finish
Head disappears quickly. Mouldy malty aroma. Slightly bitter. Some malts. Slightly sweet.
05-08-18 // 500ml bottle. Clear golden, solid white head. Nose is slightly yeasty. Moderate mild fruity hints of hefeweizen fruityness. Sparkling crisp in mouthfeel. Solid.
Sampled @ my one and only THT 2018. Clear orange golden color, average sized white to off-white head. Smell and taste wheat, lightly hay, light sweet and light bitter. Interesting.
July THT. Clear golden, white head. Grainy cardboard, melted plastic, banana.
The Hague Tasting - 13 July 2018 Perfectly drinkable. Narrow head, light carbonation
THT July at Kwartje. Bottle. Clear golden with white head. Sweet malts, massive cardboard. Light sweet and moderate bitter. Under medium body and soft carbonation. Buttery
Bottled, pasteurised. Pale straw with flatish head. Lightly flavoured lager, little impact, rather like wet paper. Short impact.
Bottled(500ml). -just another bad and boring hungaryan beer, pale golden coloured, light hoppy aroma, medium quick-disappearing head

Cask Conditioned, at the Wenlock Arms, London. Had it with the lads from the Mighty Oak Brewery themselves, just before the GBBF. Lovely stuff this but it really did set the tone for a larger then possible day. Fruity blonde ale that, slightly hazy, crisp clean and well balanced. Good bitter structure without being a bitter. Many thanks to John Boyce Mighty Oak Director for the lift from the Wenlock to GBBF.

Cask, Rose's, Woolwich. Juicy burst on first gulp, refreshing the parts other beers don't reach. Pleasant musty fruit aroma. Slightly hazy polished tangerine colour. Fruity flavour is slightly sweetened with Brown sugar notes, but retains a citric freshness. Short dull finish with minimal hop awareness. Pleasant but average - the initial fruit burst is the key to this one. Mighty Oak started up in 1996 in Essex, and now have a 15 barrel brewplant.
Cask @ Masons Arms, Todmorden. Almost black with a very poor thin head. It has a medium roasted aroma but a slightly fuller taste.

Cask @ Market Porter, Borough, London. Pours a clear copper color with a small white head. Fruity malty and slightly hoppy aroma. Sweet malty and bitter flavor with some hoppy hints. Long malty finish with a bitter aftertaste.

Half pint on cask at The Market Porter, London Bridge. The pour reveals an amber coloured body with great clarity under a low level layer. Hoppy aroma. Nice citrusy hop flavours with notes of bitter oranges and orange marmelade. Medium mouthfeel (01.02.2007).

Hand pulled at the Wellington, Birmingham. Dark yellow colour, with a cream slim head, and lacing. Malty on finish, quite bready. A little gentle spring-time hop to start. Not too flavoursome, a bit drudgey. OK session beer, no more.

Cask Conditioned at Banbury Beer Festival 06 as E&S Lock Keeper. Amber to gold colour with bubbly white head. Light fruity citrusy Golden bitter, dry on the tongue with a bitter finish, its a nice little mouth cleanser. Good for warm spring days lying on the lawn watching the world go by. Re Rate 14/11/09 as Elland Lock Keeper in The Lamp, Birmingham, copper with white head, hoppy bittersweet, easy drinking.
Cask Stillage at the Memorial Hall, Northwich 21/09/2002 Amber golden coloured and fruity. Lasting hop finish.
Cask Fresh, Rose's, Woolwich. Hazy golden amber. Citric hops. Loose body - a bit ragged with a patchy mouthfeel. Dry, slightly mouth puckering finish. Stale leather and yeast aroma.
Veyr interesting, never heard about something like this. But it was nice, and green. I like the combination.
Draught Fierce green. Peculiar aroma of sweet menthe. Softly malty, but the odd eucalyptus flavour takes over and leaves me completely puzzled: is this really beer?
Bottle from Cajsa Warg. Dark brown with no head. Sweet with dark bread, saccharine, brown sugar and some light notes of dried fruit. Thin mouthfeel and with no bitterness.
@ Gyllenbock 14-12-13: doften �r fruktansv�rd men smaken �r hyfsat ok. Mycket s�tt, mycket maltig och socker. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone ---- Soberness not garanteed!
Sampled at the RBESP 2004 Cardboard, somewhat shitty nose. Dark brown, foamy low brown head. Quite sweet - brown sugar. Light body of course.
Big 1 litre bottle stolen from the Christmas exhibition at the Technical Museum of Stockholm. Dark ruby colour, vinous nose, sweet sugary palate. Brewed for children.
An opaque amber beer with a fine light brown head. The aroma is sour with notes of caramel and licorice - and so is the flavor, while the body (no surprise) is thin.
Bottled. Salty nose, somewhat chemical and artificial. Saccharine notes in the flavour, also artificial. Hmmm...

Bottled: Well, these keeps coming my way, dosn�t they. Amber coloured. Cocoabrown coloured head. Well I won�t repeat Mac�s words for the aroma, but they were very much to the point. Aroma is faul. Some old sweetness and too old fruit comes to mind. Flavour is not faul, but very watery and sweet. Is cloying in the end.
Smells like the sweet dust at the bottom of a box of Fruity Pebbles. Cloudy brown with small head. Watery thin with light carbonation. Tastes like watery lemony iced tea. Horrible.
Bottled. Dark brown with no head. Sweet and slightly roasty with a touch of saccarine. Rounded and fresh with near no bitterness. Pretty good svagdricka.
Draft at BWI - pours copper-amber, messy beige head. Nose is cardboard, earth, stale malts. Straightforward but a bit boring on the tongue, some caramel and earthy spice.

Sampled on draft this beer poured a red-brown color with a large foamy orange-tan head that left decent lacing. The aroma was toasty malts, caramel and a light mix of golden and dark fruits. The flavor was bitter and buttery with caramel, dark fruits and some astringency. Long finish. Medium body. ok.

On tap in CLT in the Phillips crab house crap crotch in terminal C. Pours golden amber, medium foam head that disappears but leaves some lacing in the process. Nose is wet grains. Taste follows, mostly wet grains, some bread, it�s balanced. Medium body with an abrupt finish.
Tap. Medium amber with fine carbonation. Grainy, mild hops, white grapes and minerals. Taste is mildly sweet and bitter, but more dry than anything. Watery, bubbly feel.
A dull clear golden color with a weak quick diminishing head white fine foam. Creamy feel. Tangy hops. Some English hop expression. Plain light caramels touch of cardboard. Peach sweetness.
Draft at Phillips in Baltimore. Pale ale color . Not sure if its really an am ee but its ok and drinkable with food ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Phillips, Charlotte airport. Layover ticks can be demoralizing but this amber was less groan-inducing than many I�ve had. Lively copper body, prickly carbonation bringing out a bit of pale malt and hops in the nose. Consistent with this impression, taste was a bit more dry and bitter than anticipated, and thank fuck for that. Still not much going on, but appreciably greater than expectations.
Ehhh, not terrible. Nice color and poured with a good head. Just not much there flavor besides the malt.
Pours brownish amber color with ample foamy head. On tap at the Harrisburg airport. Taste is toasted malt with a cleansing hop offset at the finish. Average.

Got to sample this at a rather random and slightly unexpected stop in DC on the bus ride back from DFH. Medium amber. Aroma lightly of caramel and slight citric hops. Flavor matched. Unremarkable, but not bad at least.

Bottle from BevMo-Santa Rosa. Brewed & bottled by Dukes in Diamond Springs, CA. Contract? Likely.Medium golden with soft skin of head, kind of flat. Faint malty, grainy aroma, light fruit, plums. Taste is even more subdued, almost watery. Weak. Kind of sweet, and then nothing. Very disappointing.
"here�s one that really wasn�t worth trying. nothing stands out. the flavors are standard for the style, as was the aroma, but were all a little muted and/or stale."

Cerveza Benevolo Estilo Weizen bock. Muy rica cerveza mexicana. De color oscuro intenso y cremosa. Sabor muy fuerte al principio, pero a las siguientes sorbos se vuelve una delicia en el paladar. Define perfectamente lo que es una cerveza artesanal www.cervezabenevolo.com.mx
Bottled. A hazy golden beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of malt as well as a bit of vinegar. The flavor is sour with notes of malt and wheat, leading to a dry wheat finish. Off.
Poured hazy golden yellow, sweet, peach, apricot, citrus, wheat, little yeasty, little spice.

Bottle 33fl.oz. Clear medium orange color with virtually none head. Aroma is light malty, light to moderate yeasty, fruity, tart citrus notes. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet, light fruit acidic and light bitter with a long duration. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20090821]

33oz grolsch bottle. Hazy, vigorously-sparkling honey body topped with a moderately sized fluffy white head that left a single blob of lace before turning into a small ring. The aroma is musky like skunky beer, BO, and many bottled lagers, and a touch wheaty. Mouth is medium with coarse, unpleasantly foamy carbonation and a balanced and eventually dry finish. On the malty side with generic sugar sweet, corn, musk, decently hopped, some wheat characteristics--refreshing, lemon, touch of clove. Mild aftertaste of hops. Not too excited about drinking 33oz of it, but I�m not going to pour it out or finish it tomorrow either.

Bottle, 33oz. An unclear, golden-orange beer with some off-white bubbles on top. Milky-sour, citrusy nose that isn�t all bad. The flavor is very much the same, citrusy-fruity and milky sour, leading to a milky, lemony finish. Medium body, a bit more astringent than I should wish for. As faroeviking says, the name is better than the beer. 090821
This clear blonde beer poured with a massive off-white head that bubbled away quickly. There is a sour aroma and thin wheat flavor with a slightly bitter dry finish. Not too good.
Botella. Hazy orange. Fruity wheat bit sour aroma. The flavour is has fruit and wheat and a should-not-be-there sourness. Great name though.

Canned from Vine Ripe. Golden/straw in color. Sweet apple cider nose with some strong yeast. Yeasty and somewhat sweet. Yeast actually dominates this brew. Some fusel malt liquor flavor, but not terrible.
Can - pours gold white head - nose and taste of corn, skunk metal - light body

Bottle from Stadium Liquors in Burbank, Illinois: This pours a clear amber body and, for a few seconds, a really tall fizzy head. It has an aroma of candy corn that was melted by the posterior heat of a fat lady on a CTA (Chicago Transit Authority) bus in mid-August. (If it was a fat fellow, I would�ve rated the aroma lower.) The flavor is really-really-really sweet corn syrup and some grainy malt, dirty, with a bored alcohol hiccup at the end. The finish was sticky sweet, spoiled, and cried out for a good tooth-brushing and aniseptic mouthwash.

Gryb�w seems to have changed their label from Red to Gold to Green... possibly for the export version of this beer. I hope to have a new photo up soon. Hazy amber, sediment late, mostly flat, with a whitish head that fades to scum... then completely disappears. Cooked vegetable aroma with sweet pale malts and dog kibble beneath. Malted flavor is both sweet and sour with a hint of alcohol that dries but does not overwhelm. Not a drain pour, but definitely not worth the premium cost I paid for a 3 year old bottle (BB 10.01.2003). In retrospect I should have shared... didn�t realize it was so "rare". From a small liquor store in Burbank that carries a few micros and imports but isn�t worth adding to the RB database.
Bottled. Pale amber. Neutral aroma. Full bodied with clean, firm maltiness and a grassy bitter finish. Well balanced.

Best By 10.01.2003 Thick golden liquid with a small lid of small off white bubbles that diminishes into just a few ugly big bubbles. Heavy sweet (near sickening) malt aroma. Heavy malt sweetness with flavors of lemon grass and light corn syrup. Some floral hops flavors seem to add to the sweetness. Light syrupy finish. At least it was fresher sample.
very smooth beer with a nice calming hint of lemon. very refeshing unlike some of the other polish beers out there i really enjoyed it

[Butelka 14.05.2019] Barwa jasno br�zowa, klarowne. Piana niska, �rednio p�cherzykowa, szybko redukuj�ca si�. W aromacie karmel i ciemne owoce. W smaku bardzo wodniste, s�odowe, troch� jako rozwodniona cola. Goryczki brak, nasycenie �rednie, cia�o bardzo niskie.
0,5 l bottle, not real beer in my mind, more similar to kvass which not for children :).

17-09-2018; bottle; at home (bought somewhere in Sweden). The looks of the beer are nice. It looks a bit like a heavily foaming cola. The colour is reddish brown with a nice coppery glow. The beer is pretty clear and loads of gas bubbles can be seen rising towards the top. There they form that very thick layer of soft, frothy light brown foam, that seems to stay on top for quite some time. The beer is aromatically seen not to interesting. It is mainly malty. The malt aromas are sweet, a bit sticky, with a decent amount of toast. The toasted aromas give some chocolate touches and quite some caramel. The malts are a bit plain and bready in general though. Hops aren't really clearly present, neither are yeast aromas. There might be some earthy hops, but mainly it is just sweet malts. This is also the case with the flavour. Sweet, very sweet. Thera are some bitter flavours, mainly some toast and a minimal hoppy thing. But mainly it's an unbalanced sweetness. The palate of the beer is below average. It lacks carbonation, has a rather light body and feels quite thin and watery. The finish is mainly sweet watery malts, with a bitter touch in the finish. The beer lacks strength, body and power. It is more a sweet malt lemonade than a beer now.

Fles @ Idre Fj�ll, VIII 2018. Ziet er uit als cola, proeft een beetje als oud bruin van Heineken maar dan wel minder zoet. Weinig koolzuur die een minimaal schuimkraagje produceert. Hele lichte bitter, proef beetje de malt en klein zoetje maar niet zo zoet als van Heineken. De geur is beetje zoet en verbazingwekkend nog redelijk goed dorstlessend voor een biertje. Waarbinnen beetje een bruine suiker smaak even in je mond blijft hangen. Een ideaal biertje om mee te koken

500ml bottle. Dark brown with one finger fizzy but quickly fading brown head. Aroma is sweet malts, brown bread, wort, gingerbread dough and light dried spices. Taste is sweet malts, brown bread, gingerbread dough, sweet syrup, light dried spices and Christmas soda. Light mouthfeel, light carbonation and sweet, slightly spiced aftertaste.

Deep brown body with a small, fizzy, beige head that ends up as a very thin layer. Sweet and quite strong aroma of malt extract, dark dried fruits and wort, and chocolate in the back. Moderate flavour of malt extract, sweet caramel, wort, white sugar and brown sugar, and fainter notes of dark dried fruits. Heavy sweet taste with just a light bitterness. Full body, syrupy texture, soft carbonation. Too sweet and malty, but an interesting historical beer style, I guess. [50 cl bottle, enjoyed 7 days before BB date, from ICA Bovallstrand, Sweden]
zapach lekki, kolor rozwodnionej coli, piany brak, w smaku wodniste, jako piwo kiepsko, ale jako nap�j niez�e

zapach lekki, kawa zbo�owa i karmel, mo�e odrobina s�od�w i chyba nic poza tym, kolor rozwodnionej coli, przejrzysty, piany absolutnie brak, ju� na coli jest lepsza, w smaku bardzo wodniste, wyra�ne posmaki karmelowe, troch� cienkiej kawy zbo�owej, odrobina ciemnego cukru i troch� kwaskowo�ci, goryczki brak, nasycenie wysokie, do picia w kategorii piwa mo�e nie do ko�ca, ale jako nap�j ca�kiem przyjemne, orze�wiaj�ce, mo�e daleki kuzyn kwasu chlebowego
How : bottle Appearance : black with a minimal off-white head Aroma : caramel and gingerbread. Palate : light body, average to low carbonation.

column4: Monte Carlo Brewpub at the Monte Carlo Casino
column5: Date: 04/21/2002 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub Opaque liqht orange, whispy white head, flecks of lace down the glass, tart raspberry aroma, slightly sweet raspberry flavor but not overdone, cots of raspy american wheat character, quick dry finish Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 2.8/5.0 Score: **/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

column4: Monte Carlo Brewpub at the Monte Carlo Casino
column5: Draught at the brewpub Dark amber color; thin creamy head. The aroma is lightly fruity. Tastes like a normal dunkel, with caramel and too much bitterness, with a light fruitness. Unbalanced.

column4: Monte Carlo Brewpub at the Monte Carlo Casino
column5: Colour is just slightly darker than their regular wheat. Aroma is raspberry jam. Flavour is all raspberry. Not overpowering but does nothing for me.

column4: Monte Carlo Brewpub at the Monte Carlo Casino
column5: Winners Wheat with some raspberry flavorings. Put the beers side by side and it�s almost like they poured raspberry syrup into the bottom of the glass before pouring the beer. The aroma was weak, and the flavor disappointing. The palate was unoffensive.

column4: Monte Carlo Brewpub at the Monte Carlo Casino
column5: load of raspberry aroma, and nothing else, coming off a cloudy lite yellow body with a thin white head. unlike the marin bluebeery i had a night before this, this flavor was huge with fruit, in fact, the raspberry was pretty much all there was, not alot of the wheat flavor made it through at all. the aftertaste was abit tangy and metallic, even though this was a tap beer.

column4: Monte Carlo Brewpub at the Monte Carlo Casino
column5: Tasted just like the Winner's Wheat, except with an infusion of raspberry extract. Sugary-sweet raspberry flavors. Dry, somewhat parching bitterness in the finish -- most likely from the raspberry, as there isn't a large hop profile to speak of. Overall, maybe too sweet for my blood.

Clear and medium golden. Bleached-white, frothy head with thick lace. Not the most inviting aroma. Texture was on the watery side, but had times of creaminess. Malts were light, grainy and cracker-like; hardly any sweetness. Hops were somewhat strong: flowery, grassy and herbal. Slightly acidic. Seemed a bit unbalanced, with the hops overwhelming the light malts. Very dry and somewhat crisp finish. Would've liked to see a bigger malt backbone and more hop aromatics (i.e., finishing hops and/or dry hops).
0.473l can. Clear amber color with relatively fast disappearing white head. Aroma of raspberry, bread and malt. Taste is sour and little sweet and bitter.

473ml can. Pours a clear amber with pink hue and a medium, frothy, long lasting, off-white head that laces nicely. Mild aroma of raspberry and bready wheat malt. Sweet flavour of raspberry and bready wheat malt with a dry, slightly tart finish. Light body with a thin, watery texture and soft carbonation. Pretty plain and simple, but easy to put back on a hot summer day.

Soft clear red brownish body and minimal foam. Sugary raspberry juice on the nose. Flavour is a mediocre mix of sweet raspberry and malt. Full on the mouth though still sweet and syrupy. A candy-ish beer, there is very little to recommend here.
pretty good. nice red hazy pour. smell is raspberry all the way. taste is wheaty, raspberry and enjoyable. can at jam cafe in victoria.

Visual: (cellared for 6 years). Pours blush red with a dissipating 1cm head, fine ringed retention with an island, raspberry sediment, slow and steady micro streams. Nose: clean fruity raspberry juice, inviting. (lvl-5)-pungency Attack: crisp Mid-palate: thin mouthfeel, off-dry, (lvl-2-sweetness), fruity raspberry jam Finish: dry wheat malt, raspberry exhale, mild artificial sweetener-like roughness Summary: A very basic and straightforward lightly flavoured raspberry wheat ale, not much body or depth to speak of. It's just an easy-drinking brew, barely above average, hardly recommendable nor memorable. The best aspect is the nose.

Appearance: clear ruby-tinged pale amber with one finger of fizzy off-white head settling rapidly to a thin ring, spotty lacing. (3/5) Aroma: tart sweet raspberry, wheat, light funk. (6/10) Taste: moderate tart, moderate-low sweet, minimal bitter. (6/10) Medium-light body, moderate carbonation, off-dry lightly tart finish. (3/5) Starts off with a pleasant raspberry balanced between sweet and tart, but as it warms a little, the fruit aromas diminish a bit and a wheat undertone becomes a not entirely pleasant funk. Not terrible, and not unbalanced, but less than impressive. (12/20)
Tap at Phillips. Pinkish pour. Nice rich raspberry aroma. Fruity taste. Pretty good - I dug it.

Draught at 12 Kings, Vancouver Red color, bright, hazy, with generous compact head. The aroma is not offensive, the flavor makes up for it: artificial strawberry syrup, moderately sweet, some aspartame, with no bitterness. Not a beer. I drink sodas, but I couldn�t drink this.

Draft - Certainly has a red or pink color to it. Not much of a smell. Great raspberry flavor but not a lot of tartness which I was hoping for. The fruit flavor is not very pronounced but well balanced with the hops bitterness.
Nice aroma of fresh raspberries. Clear pink pour with a fizzy white head - no lacing. Nice flavours of wheat, cereal grains, and raspberries. Not overly sweet which is nice. A great beer for summer!
Overly sweet. I couldn't handle the molasses-like sweetness as soon as it hits the lips. Alcohol was up front as well. Needs re-working, or maybe just an off keg? Burning sugar water.

BIG Oktoberfest: Dark red/brown color, almost no head. Sweet is the best way for me to describe this one. Almost too sweet at first, but after mulling over it a while, it grew on me. Finished with a strong alcohol kick, just to let you know it could mess you up if no care was taken.

Incredibly malty with almost no carbonation. Dark plum color. Flavors of brown sugar, prune and almost burnt apples. Somewhat champagny, sticky palate. Would be extremely sweet, almost to the point of cloying for those unfamiliar with quadrupels. I had to have it twice to truly appreciate it. Lovely.

At Indiana BG Fest: Brown/copper hue with some lacing, good head for a strong ale. Aroma is fruity, malty, barnyard, pine and bubblegum tones. Twangy fruit topped by a sweet caramel taste. Hint of pine undertone. Alcoholic feel and finish. Medium-bodied with a chewy and warming mouthfeel. Not overly sweet, good balance, very quaffable. Nice surprise.

Draft Only: aroma is very sweet. Beautifully clear copper in color with a thick head of tiny bubbles. It is quite sweet, so I couldn't have very many of these - especially at the well hidden 10%, but makes an excellent finishing beer.

Draft: Light maple. Dense, sticky foam. Heavily figged aroma. Underlying pine, nuts, apple, toffee, and spicy alcohol. Trace of white grape. Tiny bubbled carbonation sits on the palate beautifully. Leafy, apple flavors. Sweet leathery malts followed by hints of perfume. Long apple finish with a touch of yeast, big juicy caramel notes, and bitter hop leaf. I was expecting this to be overly sweet, as are most American examples. But this displays lovely leaf and yeast flavors, which offset the slight candy sugar sweetness and malt richness with perfection. A truly impressive Quadruple.
A big Belgian Strong Ale that is awfully sweet for the style IMHO. Notes of honey, light hops and maltiness. Fizzy head. Amber in color. Has a strong alcohol finish.
Cask at the white lion Bristol... Copper.. Thin tan lacing.. Soft sweet woody toffee malts nose.. Soft metalic woody toffee malts
Bottle. Deep Amber in colour. Malty; sweet toasty malts, caramel. Fruity; apple. Hoppy; slight hops. Sweet malty throughout. Easy drinking. (2011-11-03)

From a half litre bottle, pours a nutty brown colour with a thin head. Has a nice soft grainy, malty aroma with a bitter hint of hops. A grainy taste with raisins and subtle grapefruit notes. It�s lightly carbonated and easy to drink. If you�re after a chestnut beer you can do better than that but as a 4.2% ale it�s an agreeable drink.

Cask at The Green Dragon, Leek (JDW) A clear amber colour with a thin white head. Aroma of red berries, cherry lozenges, some watermelon, slight caramel and subtle biscuit. Taste is sweet of red berries, caramel, slight watermelon, a little biscuit and subtle sour cherry. Light bodied and a slightly oily texture. A quite sickly sweet, red berry finish. Not a lot to say really, sweet and only a half will do. Nice but not sessionable.

Cask. Aroma berry and toffee but mildly so. Pour chestnut with tan lacing. Taste is balanced to the point of oblivion and I waited for the hoppy finish, promised in the commercial deScription and I could still be waiting. Brewers beware what you promise. A session bitter that will do no one harm but needs a Cotswold view to do more than that.
Cask at JDWs on Whitehall. Malty, slight sweetness, not too much hop character. Nice enough session beer.

Cask at JDW WIQ, London. It pours a clean amber color with a small tan head. Aroma is sweet and malty, light red berries and caramel. Taste has biscuit melon and a light red berry tangy finish. Light bodied with okn carbonation. Overall, ok
Cask, hand-pulled, Hengler�s Circus, Glasgow, weak fruity aroma, amber, brown with a thin bubbly off-white head, negligible lacing, malty, berry fruits, oily, slightly sour finish.
Cask at Crown Rivers, pleasant dark brown and malty bitter. Lightly toasty nose, hints of toffee and lemon.
Deep amber/copper colour with foamy off white head. Caramel, malt aroma, some coffee. Malty, caramel taste, not too sweet mild bitter finish. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

on tap at the Elevator Draught Haus; hazy gold color; mild clove aroma with just hints of fruity banana; clean, spicy, hefe yeast flavor; leans more towards the spicy clove end of the hefe spectrum; some mild banana note
Draft - Cardamom and lots of sweet banana. Cloudy gold with a decent white head. Sweet banana and a long sweet finish.
Draft - pours yellow white head - nose/taste of banana, clove and coriander - med body
Draft sampler pours a hazy bright yellow color with a thin white head. The aroma was of wheat with touches of banana, citrus, and clove present. The taste had a nice wheat backbone with spicey yeast.

From a bottle plenty of rolling co2 makes for a nice show. Big head that hangs. Smell is not bubble gum and its a little off from banana. Taste is perhaps a little aged, 4/42/15 but still comes across quite refreshing after a long day. Finish is not bad. Lots of powdery sediment on the bot�s bottom.
A fruity flavored wheat beer. Light body. Pours light Amber. Tastes yeast, banana, fruity flavor. Ok wheat beer. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle thanks to IP trade. Poure clear yellow with white head. Aroma very sweet and fruity. Light carb med bod. Taste similar to aroma apple pear banana.

12 oz bottle courtesy of shrubber85. As I popped the cap it was a mini gusher with massive fizzy head. Slow canted pour shows the large fizzy head that retained the whole glass. Aroma is wheat, hints of lemon and dusty yeast. Flavor is sweet grain, lemon, weak banana and faint clove. The flavor overall is an American interpretation of the style because I don�t get authentic German yeast by-products. Still pretty nice. If they can tune down the carbonation it would score a bit higher.

12 ounce bottle from Kroger Athens, OH, opened 7/23/14. Pours a hazy yellow color with a thin head that quickly fades. Aroma of banana, wheat, citrus. The taste is wheat, yeast, citrus, apples, slightly tart. Thin bodied, high carbonation.

Bottle. Tart lemon-orange aroma. Hazy straw gold with a large fizzy loose head with poor retention. excessive carbonation. Tart lemon-orange and clove flavor. Medium body, very highly carbonation. This beer was far too carbonated and ended up reminding me of Alka-Seltzer.

Received in a trade with RBald42. Thanks Ryan! The beer appears hazy and rusty orange hued. Effervescence emanating from the depths of the liquid create an audible fizz. Bonus points for sound quality. The head is a dense white inch, but fades to a thin, wispy layer after only a couple minutes, leaving minimal lacing. The scent brings a lot of fruit character, similar in some regards to a Flanders ale. A healthy malt presence, subtle citrus, mild funk, a touch of sweetness, and a general earthy quality round out the aromas. Well, now I�ve tried a roggenbier. Rye malt is quite present. The beer is fruity and a bit sweet. In contrast, flavors of rye and sourdough breads, as well as an understated funky quality balance out the sweetness. This brew is quite earthy and malty. This is my first experience drinking a roggenbier, and I�m intrigued. I�d definitely like to try some other examples of the style to compare / contrast. The feel is a bit chewy, with the carbonation much less active on the palate than it appeared in the glass. Overall, I must say that this beer is quite different than anything I have had. Unique and tasty. I appreciate the new experience this brew offers and it�s been fun sampling all 104 beer styles. Serving type: bottle Reviewed on: 04-05-2011

Pretty good. The nose has a lot of citrus and caramel and a faint touch of bananas. The beer by itself is deep amber with a off white foam. If you pour the yeast like a hefe, the beer becomes a brown milk hue. The taste has a rye snap with big citrus notes along with caramel. The beer is crisp and displays a nice refreshing tartness.
Orange pour with no head or lace. Orange peel and paper aroma. Orange peel and sour malt flavor. Medium bodied and fizzy.

Sample at the Hawai�i Admission Day tasting from a bottle thanks to grownfool. Thin white head, orange-red body. Aroma is banana, fusel, caramel, light sour twinge. Taste is spicy, rye, banana, more caramel, light fusel or sour tang. Maybe that is how it was fresher or maybe it is turning a bit.

Sampled at the Hawai�i Admission Day tasting. I�ll admit up front that this beer was not fresh. But here goes anyway: Pours hazy orange with very small white head. The aroma is banana, onion, lighter fluid, and overripe fruit. The flavor is an odd sourness with banana, lemon, and wheat. It�s interesting but on the weird side.

Based on many revisits of this gem of a beer. Pours amber with some protein globules and a diminishing white head. Smells of lemons, wheat, oranges, lots of tangy qualities, some underlying tarte like hints found in many Jolly Pumpkin beers. Tastes of creamy sweet malt, lots of tangy hints, lemons, some underlying sourness, some wild qualities (accidental?). The palate on this reminds me of a melted milk shake. It is extremely velvety and enjoyable. The finish on this is a nice balance of tarte and full bodied grain. One of the best German beers I have tasted and easily one of my top 20.

Date: 11/26/2003 Mode: Bottle Conditioned Source: Beverage Resort opaque orange, big white head, tart malt aroma, light malt flavor, slight fruity character, nice but mild -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Date: 05/18/2005 Source: tasting all shook up, good flavor but still too mild Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 2.7/5.0 Score: **/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

What frankenkitty said! Mine was obviously VERY long out of date (I can�t believe these aren�t flying off the shelves) Huge globules of brown sliminess and massive flocculated yeasties gumming up the works. But I STILL tasted it. Very intense rye spiciness predominates and herbal hopping. Carefull about old stock, eh?

Pours a muddy amber color with lots of floaties and a thick, frothy, offwhite head. Good aroma and flavor of malt, fruits, rye and spices. The body is light to medium with an oily texture and soft carbonation. Interesting.

Extremely chunky, flocculent body makes me think I got the last bottle off the fermenter... a bottle that shouldn�t have gotten filled. Murky sepia with a fluffy-yet-fading off-white head (photos soon.) Sharp rye notes above what I perceive as English hop varieties and touches of earth and ginger. Whiffs of alcohol late. Flavor greets me with a tart spiciness and lingers with a herbal bitterness. Palate is thick yet lively. In a word, this beer is "disturbing". (My god I wish I could find a code on this bottle.) Pint bottle from United Liquors, Frankfort, IL 60423
Botella de 33 cl, en Cerveceria Internacional. Color ambar claro. Sabor a malta, caramelo, ligeramente a levadura, afrutado.
oro buona schiuma media persitenza nso maltato dolce leggero fruttatoin bocca dolce amro a bilanciare leggermente ma senza aroma
Clear amber with medium white head. Sweet fruity aroma with notes of caramel and yeast. Sweet flavor with notes of malt, caramel and ripe fruits. Ends sweet. Alcohol well hidden.

33 cL bottle. Pours clear and golden yellow with a dense lacing white head. Light spiced and mild oxidised aroma. Flavour is oxidised and mild yeasty. Light fruity note. Ends light oxidised and light spiced.

Botella. Bit pale amber colour. Sweet grainy, fruity and malty aroma. Ok mouthfeel. Sweet caramel and malty flavour with some fruitiness and a bit of yeast. Sweet malty finish. Rather too sweet a brew for me. The alc. is well hidden. Hvala Kim.

Bottle. [thank you, BelJohansen] [at Yeprs tuesday tasting] Pours deep, golden amber with a small, creamy, off-white head. Aroma is softly fruity - pineapple - and yeast. Fine mouthfeel. Flavour has biscuits, quite malty, hides its alcohol very well. A bit too sweet.

Bottle. [Courtesy of thewolf, thanks buddy] Average fizzy white head that mostly diminished. Fair display of lacework. Clear flat looking body with a golden colour. Aroma of yeast, grain, fruit, dusty feel. Over the palate came mild spice and toffee. Medium bodied with an average carbonation. Moderated sweet flavour. Sweet fruity finish.

Golden amber with a nice and lasting head. The flavour is sweet and a bit like candy sugar. The same goes for the flavour where the alcohol also is present. It has notes of fruit, mostly apple. The overall impression is a bit too sweet with too little complexity.

Bottle at home. Orange with a large white ehad, some lacings. Aroma heavy malty (citrus), light bitter. Flavor heavy sweet, light bitter, well balanced. Medium/full body, the alcohol is felt. It has it�s own taste.
yeast and citrus on the nose, amber coloured, head is big and lingers, sweet with lotsa malt , decent hop bitterness and dry finish, decent but not amazing

Bottle, 5.4%. Good banana aroma. Clear golden colour. Big semi-stable white head. The flavour has a lot of banana, especially for a Kristallweizen. Also a little sweet, but in good balance. Very flavourful for the style.

Bottle. Pours clear light straw with barely any head at all. Clear aroma of yeast and malt, with mild fruity touches. Sweetish flavour of yeast, banana and malt, with bitter touches of hops and hints of herbs. Estery and malty aftertaste with acidic hints. Quite fresh. Reasonable for the style.
Stabiler Schaum, sch�ne Perlung. In der Nase leichte Nelke. Im Trunk ebenso, aber deutlich zur�ckgenommener als im hellen Hefe. S�ffig s��er Abgang.

I bought this bottle in the Edenka supermarket in Freiburg. I drank it yesterday in the flat, in Freiburg. In my point of view, it is an average kristallbier, nothing exciting but it makes the job to be refresh. The taste is with wheat, some malt, bready, banana, some hop, if I compare with a hefe-weizen, the taste is a bit more crispy and not so sweet, I observe this small point. Second taste and I have found this bottle, at one Getr�nkmarkt, at Kirchzarten. Again, I can write the same and this Kristalweiss is pleasant at the palate, not so subtle but the taste is round and generous with the cereals, littpe side of honey.
On tap at Hingham. Cola color with modest head and some lacing. Plenty of malts and a little smoke. fair amount of carbonation adds nicely to the drinkability.Overall light but not thin for type.
deep amber with off white head, the aroma is nutty with a hint of caramel. the flavor is sweet chocolatey.

[Draft in Lowell] Poured a lightly hazy, red amber color with a small, off white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of dried fruits, floral hops, caramel, toasted malts, resiny pine, and a bit of alcohol. Taste of caramel malts, dark fruits, light roast, molasses, and a bitter finish with some alcohol in there as well.

(draught) Dark amber, nearly chestnut; amber head. Very malty notes in the nose, bread, wholegrain, fresh-smelling. Bitter taste, from both hops and malts, nearly coffee-like. Full mouthfeel, warming sensation, alcohol. Not bad, should get rid of too coffee notes for a real old ale - maybe 'American strong' is OK
(cask)dark brown, no head. malty bread aroma with a pungent hoppiness that hinted at big IBUs. very smooth, sweet and malty with a lot of hops in the finish. probably their best beer.

Pour very very light yellow. Almost no aroma, maybe a bit of pineapple. Taste light, some floral notes and grassy. Good bitter finish. A pilsner not full of dusty cardboard aroma, at least. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(Draught at Foersters Feine Biere, Berlin, 19 July 2018) Golden colour with frothy, white head. Malty nose with bread, grain, grass and hay. Malty taste with notes of bread, grain and a fresh, grassy bitterness. Medium body, quite dry. Fresh and tasty pilsner. Quite enjoyable.
Vom Fass. Goldgelbes Bier, heller fester und hoher Schaum. Getreideduft. Etwas stumpf. Herber Antrunk. Geas, Hopfen. Dann Getreide. Recht schnell weg.

On tap @ F�rsters Feine Biere (Berlin). Clear golden body with a tall, foamy, persistent white head. Aroma is bread, hay, fresh grass. Bitter taste, mild grassy.Low body, medium carbonation. Long dry grassy finish.

Birra dal colore giallo paglierino. Schiuma grossolana e non troppo persistente. Al naso lievito, malto, crosta di pane con un accenno resinoso. Corpo leggero, nel finale amara come deve essere una pils. Una buona birra.
Tap (oude aantekenigen). Helder en fris pilsener. Licht van kleur en licht sprankelend.
Giallo paglierino, velata, schiuma grossolana. Aroma erbaceo. Piacevole la bevuta, leggermente amara, malto, carbonazione non elevata.
Trocken herber, kaum hopfiger Beginn. Bitter, zum Ende voller, dennoch entt�uschend mild bleibend. Belanglos.9/8/7/7//7
Klares goldgelb mit ordentlicher Schaumkrone. Heuig, hopfig, w�rzig, eine leicht S��e, dennoch �berwiegt die Hopfenbittere, insgesamt ganz ok.

Bottled, from Biershop Bayern. Clear golden, mid sized head. Distinct grassy nose. Dry with light-medium body and firm, crisp mouthfeel. Grassy hops and salty bread. Pleasantly dry and crisp, yet with a fruity solid malt backbone. Long bitter finish. Refreshing and moreish.
Bottle courtesy of Lukas, thanks! Dark clear brown color. Aroma of caramel and brown sugar. Taste is sweet with subtle dark roast brown bread.

Aroma: Roasted malt and fruity sweetness. Flavour: Roasted malt and sweet malt with slight brown sugar. Colour: Dark reddish brown with a light brown head. From: Bottle @ EuroDeli Tilst Jan. 2018 as 3,8% alc. version.
Butelka 0,5 l. Wypita 07.12.2017. Barwa czarna z rubinowymi refleksami. W smaku delikatne, kremowe. �adna, g�sta piana.

Very dark amber with thin, coarse head. Full, hoppy aroma. Fat malty flavour, mildly bitter and subtly floral. Very fresh tasting malts, excellent, unpretentious well balanced. Well rounded palate, thick and smooth but not sweet. Damn good. Sadly, no longer produced.

Aromat zdecydowanie zbo�ony, s�odowy, jest karmel tak�e i jest nawet chmiel. Przyjemny, do�� czysty i ca�kiem z�o�ony. W smaku mocno s�odow-karmelowy, ale nie za s�odki, jest goryczka i nawet troch� chmielowej �wie�o�ci. Naprawd� przyzwoite, dobrze u�o�one i niejednowymiarowe piwo. Nie ma tam nic z nowej fali, ale bardzo fajne.

01Jul2019 Sweet grain and cereal malts, caramel, molasses, bread pudding. Clear, dark gold, medium, creamy, off-white head. Light bitter. More caramel, sweet grain malts, molasses, soft carbonation, medium bodied. Lacks intensity. Bottle from The Misty Bottle.

Bottled 500ml (Vasa) Ruby colour, medium-sized beige head, lace. Licorice, malts, caramel, spicey hops in the nose. Light-bodied. Licorice, toasted malts, light fruityness, hops in the finish. Nice brew.
Munros. Glasgow. Thin white head and a good dark beer. Not overpowering on any facet.
Cask at Glasgow Airport. Dry, hoppy, fair body, hint of licorice, and a long and dry finish. Easy drinking but lacking depth.
A sample at The George at Inveraray. Not much aroma, light brown color, taste is a bit flat. So different from the commercial description.
Cask @ NWAF 2017. Amber with a tiny off white head. Malty and fruity tones. Malt, caramel, fruit and hops. Medium to light body with a bitter / malty finish.

(cask) clear ruby-amber colour with a frothy light-beige head. aroma of buttered black toast with apricot jam, lots of raisins and vanilla icing. flavour is mostly roasted malts and burnt toffee, with some light grain and a light-bitter herbal-hoppy finish. medium-bodied with soft carbonation.

Cask @Blackfriars in Glasgow Clear dark brown with red highlights, minimal white head quickly disappearing Malty, caramel, a hint of sourness Sweet malts, hint of smocked bacon, roasted malts Light and pleasant sweet bitter ending/aftertaste

Dark brown body with orange highlights. Durable, well-proportioned and creamy bone-colored head. Sticky lacing covered about half of the glass by the end. . The aroma is more hoppy than malty but this is reversed in the flavor. The flavor is also a bit more mild but has plenty of medium and medium-dark malt flavor. O Excellent for style.

500ml bottle from Aldi. Sweet liquorice from the malt and a spicy hoppiness. A nice dark beer but definitely not the best that Scotland has too offer, in bottled variety anyway. Pretty one dimensional and a little watery on the palate.

500ml bottle. Pours dark brown, quite fizzy, meaning the head disappeared instantly. Sweet nose with hints of liquorice. Looks and feels a bit watery. Not much taste, maybe a hint of the liquorice I could smell. Slight metallic aftertaste. Ok
Bottle. Poured pale gold with an average sized white head. Aroma of grass, hop, fruit and yeast. Medium sweetness, moderate bitterness. light body, slight oily texture, average carbonation.
Bottle from Sainsburys. Golden colour with a slight white head and moderate carbonation. Sweet malt aroma with a touch of hay. Flavour was also sweet with a decent dry finish. Not bad for a lager.
Gold with a lasting white head. Faint malt aroma. Sweet roasted malt taste with some bitterness. Better than some of its kind, but not very wonderful.
Bottle. A fairly typical Belgian lager in the style of Stella Artois or Jupiler. Less hopping than I expected and it feels a little flat. Nothing wrong with it.
Not a strong lager but slightly better than I had expected. A bit tinny which was worrying as it was from a bottle. Some bitterness and not really that offensive-just not one to try again.

Bottled. A yellow gold coloured lager with a white head. The aroma is pretty nasty grassiness and notes of cabbage water and can be smelt from quite a distance. The taste is fairly bitter but there�s a bit of a sweet metal. Not the type of beer I think of when I think of Belgium.
A watery, immensely boring lager with nothing to distinguish it in any way.
Sniffs of grass and beeswax. Yellowish pale gold with a thinning white head. Cheap malt graininess and metal. Astringently bitter finish. Drinking rainwater from a rusty tuna tin.
500ml bottle from Sainsburys. Pale straw in colour, vaguely grassy aroma; a fluffy white head; a sweet flavour with a metallic edge; doen�t deserve the "premium" tag.
Bottle, Sainsburys Kidlington. Gold in colour, large white fluffy head, sweet, some hops and malt but ultimately very forgettable.
Vom Fass in Freiburg. Helles gelb, opalisierender Glanz. Sch�ner Schaum. Satte Bitterhopfung und gro�z�gige Aromahopfung. Hier wurde nicht gespart, sehr s�ffig.

Draft at the Martin's Br�u, Freiburg im Breisgau, Germany. Enjoyed on October 5 2018. Deep cloudy golden color with a medium size fluffy white head. Dry grassy hoppy pils with heavy bready malty body. Not a bad one.
Tap at the brewery. Bright, almost pastel yellow with a thick, low head. Malty, yeasty nose, pineapple, orange, lvoely fruit. Very fruity flavor, slightly sweet and malty, a bit heavy. Very tasty.

on tap at the brewery, 2.80�/.33l. pours a cloudy pale yellow with a medium head. aroma of honey, grass, bread. flavour of bread, grass, minerals, a hint of lemon. fizzy carbonation. a bit watery, but easily drinkable and refreshing. 20180317.

Very pale cloudy yellow color, with medium white head. Medium carbonation, medium body. Texture is watery to oily. Aroma is malt, pine and grass. Taste is bitterness, spicy, grass, hops and sweet malt. Aftertaste is dry, sweet and short.
Draught in Freiburg. Lemon gold with a medium head. Grassy malt aroma. Flavour is bread, lemon hop, gentle bitter citrus finish, dry palate.
draught@brewpub - hazy blond beer with a moderate foam left; lot of grains in the nose, grassy and light fruity hops; thin-bodied,astringent and aggressivly bitter; long grainy and flowery finish
Light Blond like a lemon, stable head. Aroma of citrus, herbs, spicy. High carbonation, light and long lasting bitterness.

- tr�bes Zitronengelb mit guter, anhaltender Schaumbildung - zarte Aromen nach Citrus, Hopfen und gut dosierter S�ure - etwas zu sprudelige Carbonisierung - genau diese Kohlens�ure st�rt zuerst etwas im Antrunk - der Vorteil ist, man gew�hnt sich relativ schnell daran - die feine und ausgewogene Herbe hat von Anfang an das Sagen - einzig die Citrusnote kann da bedingt, aber gezielt unterst�tzend mithalten - der K�rper bleibt �ber den ganzen Verlauf angenehm schlank, ohne je ins W�ssrige zu kippen - der Abgang prickelt schlussendlich noch etwas herb-zitronig nach
On tap. Pours a cloudy golden color with a small white head. Slightly buttery, pils malt, fairly crisp.

draught@brewpub - light hazy brown beer with a beige foam left; the aroma is buttery and shyly toasted malty with faint notes of biscuits; quite thin-bodied, poor ly tasty and with a low bitterness; short and shyly malty finish with more buttery tones

- kastanienbraun, mit guter, anhaltender Schaumbildung - leichte Aromen nach Malz und etwas Karamell - passende Carbonisierung - der Antrunk zeigt eine gute Balance von Malz und Hopfen auf - f�r ein Export ist genau diese Hopfenbitternis ungewohnt � aber angenehm - bestimmend - der gesamte Verlauf zeigt einen schlanken K�rper, aber auch eine gewisse Langweiligkeit Fazit: Ausgeglichenes Export ohne H�hen und Tiefen
On tap. Pours a chestnut color with nice head. Malty and bready with caramell notes.
ambrata velata buona schium buona persistenza ramato caramello toffee lieve cereale Lievi note tostastate amaro medio leggero erbaceo

Aroma is nutty roast, with a hint of toasted bread on top of sweet malt. Med reddish brown, clear with a small creamy head. Med carbonation Relatively thin in taste predominately roast malt character with a sprinkling of spicy hop hotes. It goes down easy and finishes dry with lingering carbonic bite and nutty aftertaste.

Draught@source. Palpably hq natural ingredients make this nutty, roasted Dunkel, that almost tastes more like a dark, hop-flower infused Keller, into another tasty option besides their hop-forward Pils. Bread crust malt aromatics meet lively enough hops: straightforward and as solid a Dunkel you can get this side of Franconia.
On tap at the Brewpub. Leicht tr�bes braunes Bier mit geringer aber sch�nen Schaumkrone. Geruch leicht r�stmalzig, Karamell, minimal w�rzig. Geschmack angenehm r�stmalzig, w�rzig, gering schokoladig.

Malziger, etwas r�stiger Antrunk, leicht hopfig. Die r�stigen Noten bleiben konstant, wenig bitter. Trockener Mittelteil mit steigenden R�stnoten, s�ffig, starke Karbonisierung. Herb-r�stiger Ausklang. 12/11/11/11//11

0.3 Litre, tall glass at the BrewPub on 11th Sep 2013. Good looking brew, golden brown with a deep beige head that produced some heavy lacing. Malty, semi-sweet nose: caramel and toffee notes with a slight yeast hint. The taste wasn�t as sweet as the aroma suggested, this was well balanced and a pleasant surprise. The dry finish had a mild nut feel. The best of the three beers I had while at the BrewPub.

(draught) pours a hazy ruby-amber colour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of toffee, lightly roasted malts, caramel and a hint of butter, with some notes of brown sugar and treebark. flavour is mostly the same, toasted malts, earth, dark fruit, caramel, light butter and a hint of dark chocolate. medium-bodied with average carbonation.

Germen "helles" is not intended to be complex. It is an easy beer for every day. But within this category it is the best I ever tasted. High attenuation but no water phase nor lactic acids yet tasteable. Minimum hops as usual for this style A real hidden treasure.

on tap at the brewery, bierwalk summer �11 with the boys. luscious amber with a lasting head; aroma of porridge and prune (always a good combination); clean and crisp with light rusty bitterness. perhaps a little underwhelming after 10kms walk to the brewery
Brewery tap. Only a hint of malt in the aroma. Firm hopbitterness and a good body. Clean palate. Good helles with a long bitter finish.

330ml bottle in 2016. Murky deep golden with a thin white head. Aroma of fresh hops, floral and grassy notes with herbal hints. Quite a nice, easy drinking beer with a surprising amount of hop bitterness and decent body for lower ABV.
I really rate this beer nice tasting strong and very enjoyable Nothing nothing nothing nothing nothing nothing filling lines and lines for lines ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Lahev. Kr�sn� sv�� v�n�, op�t zvl�tn� barva, ale u Harviestounu u� jsem si zvykl. Lep�� ne� Broken Dial. Good Beer..
Listed this as 5 %. Golden color with no head. Very floral, citric, perfume hop aroma. Tast is very long and hoppy.

Cask at a pub/hotel somewhere in Glen Devon. Had a couple of pints of this with fish and chips on a Friday lunchtime and instantly became one of my favourite Harviestoun beers. It has the typical Harviestoun american hops on the nose, but has more of a rounded malty flavour than Bitter and Twisted, but there is still the nice citrus flavours. Excellent

(sampled cask conditioned at Oliver Twist, Stockholm, Sweden) Amber with some haze. Small but very creamy white head. Hops, flowers and some tropical fruit in aroma. Smooth and quite fruity mouthfeel (citrus, guava). Hoppy and intense (but way to short) finish. Ok.
Gravity Cask, Kent Beer Festival. Nice balance. Fruity, yet with a sharp, refreshing tang. Sweet aroma - floral citric hops. Tasty. Sweet.
A modestly hopped IPA, some hop aromatics. Sweet start, with some lightly acidic, bittering hops at the end. Not bad. I had written that the finish was a bit short. (Cask KentBF03')

Festival booklet listed this at 4.1% but those have been known to have been wrong. Very floral, perfume hop aroma. Golden standard color. There is some edge to the flavor. Short, with lingering unpleasant effect. A sourness comes through to modify the palate a bit. (gravity pour at 2003 Kent Beer Festival)
Sampled cask conditioned at Akkurat, Stockholm, Sweden. Pale amber, lightly hazy. Orangey hoppy nose. Sweet and medium bodied, rather soft. Flowery finish with intense pine needle bitterness.
On tap at Franklins, Hyattsville on 14 July 2006. Hazy gold colour. Not much happening here. A little citrus in the flavour. Feather light mouthfeel. Nothing unpleasant but a bit anonymous.

Tap at Franklins. Pours a hazed light straw/wheat color with a pure white head. Aroma is doughy big wheaty maltiness, crackery bread, lemon zest, phenolic low ester profile- grassy. Flavor is phenolic spicy, lemonzest, earthy wheat toast, gummy doughy protiens, finishes mostly clean- nice.
Cloudy golden color with a fluffy head. Aroma is wheat, citrus, grain and chalk. Flavor is sweet and citrus with lots of wheat and a little dry finish. Not bad.
Draft at brewpub. Weak aroma of wheat and yeast. Mild flavor of wheat, yeast and lemon. Meh.

Draft at Franklins. Hazy pale body with a small white head. The aroma is bubblegum, banana, cloves and herbal hops. The flavor is mildly sweet, cotton candy and honey with banana, apricot and spice. Medium/light body is soft with light carbonation.

Had this as their "Beat the Heat Wheat". Transparent gold with a frothy white head. Aroma of yeast, grass and maybe a touch of smoke. Flavor was alot of the same. Average at best, I suspect a similar unfiltered recipe would make a good Hefe, but as is, it�s drinkable but not loveable.

An unclear light yellow beer with a thin white head - served with a slice of lemon - get that out of my beer. The aroma is sweet lemony - reminds me a bit of a Belgian Wit. The flavor is and very wheaty, with OK notes of bananas, which leads to a wheaty dry finish with notes of lemon. I suspect that the lemon note in the end could be due to the lemon slice it was served with - even though I pulled the slice from the glass as soon as I got it.
Draught @ Brewpub Hazy yellow, white head, light lacing. Nose of musky wheat, light lemon and a bit of hop. The flavor is mild, light wheat, brief, thin, average. Eh!?

On tap at the Brewpub. This current incantation was called "Hubbert�s Peak Summer Wheat." Unfiltered cloudy gold with a white head. Good orange and coriander flavors. Very wheaty. Medium body and carbonation.

St. Armand�s Summer Wheat pours to a hazy deep golden color with a thick and rocky white head, and a good bit of carbonation. The nose on this beer is just packed with funky estery aromas of banana, clove, bubble gum, and a touch of vanilla. The body is firm, with some really great tart wheat malt character and estery notes of ripe pear. St. Armand�s finishes refreshing with more wheaty and estery fruit flavors. I really enjoyed this beer. This is a draught only product, but Franklin�s has growlers to go, so you can take some of this beer home with you when you visit. It makes for a perfect summer refresher, and would work well with a number of dishes.

column1: Rock Bottom Chicago JBs Extra Special Bitter
column5: I kind of liked this brew. Not too many American breweries do a decent bitter, and this one was true to style. It poured a deep copper color with a respectable off-white head. The aroma was malty with a solid hop bitterness. Smooth-bodied, it haad a caramel malt taste with a piney hop bitterness. Nice dry finish. Rock Bottom Chicago, Chicago, IL

column1: Rock Bottom Chicago JBs Extra Special Bitter
column5: Draft, "Miracle" fundraiser edition. Hmm... very English, that�s for sure. A short, lact eggshell coloured head capable of giving you a moustache. Dark copper body with a malty smell. Hops are of the English bitter-and-that�s-that domain, which overmatches the toasty English malts. The list of brews showed this to have 50 IBU�s.The bitter aftertaste makes this work well as an example of the style.

column1: Rock Bottom Chicago JBs Extra Special Bitter
column5: Draft, "Miracle" version: slightly hazed orange brown, with a creamy head. Decent retention holds the pine needle, sap aroma right over the glass. Palate is grainy, but that is the only malt flavour I can find, mostly dominated by cascade like hops. Not quite as balanced I would have liked, but the quick hop bite in the finish was enjoyable no less...

column1: Rock Bottom Chicago JBs Extra Special Bitter
column5: Pours with an amber color. Hoppy citrus and pine aroma. Flavor starts with a bit of nice hop character then goes into nice malt flavors. Caramel, dry grain and a bit of nut, this was a very tasty ESB.

This was a half pint at the brewpub. It came in the glass brown with an near tan head. Nose of chocolate and banana. Medium in body with a rich mouth feel. Flavor is rich with lots of roasted malts and banana and cloves. Quite tasty and refreshing. Got better as it warmed.
It poured a murky light brown color with an off-white head. The aroma was caramelly with a touch of banana. The taste was of caramel, a touch of toast and banana with some chocolate as well.
Red color, mix of a dunkel and pale weizen. HAs a bubblegum characteristic and some specialty malts int eh flavor.
At the Clybourn location. I liked this one. Very banana clovey in the yeastiness. On the sweeter side. Nice reddish amber color. Serving: Tap

Draft in a sampler at the Clybourn brewpub. Pours a hazy red-tinted amber color with a small beige head. Notes of wheat, banana, clove, citrus, sweet bread, sugar, and nuts. Medium-bodied, with a wheaty, sweet mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Very sweet. On par with the other wheat beers at GI-C at the moment- decent but with something that put me off just a little bit.

Pours a cloudy orangish brown with a finger of off white head. Nose and taste is a bit bready, nice malts, banana, a touch of spice. Well balanced and very approachable. I had this beer with a burger which probably wasn�t my best decision. I think this would have been a better desert brew, a bit sweet for a meal beer.
draft at GI clybourn. Caramel color, clove & banana aroma, hefeweizen yeast. Floral & fruity. Dunkle flavor is just a tad watery/light. Very close to being a solid dunkle

Draft at Clybourn. Pours a slightly murky reddish brown with a sticky head. Nose is distincly candy and nutty. The wheat really screams in this one. A certain meaty quality as well. On taste, there is more of that meatiness and a chocolate type quality. I�m guessing there is roasted wheat in here based on the flavor profile. Finish is a bit tart. Clove and banana are very present as well. Pretty decent beer, if a bit anomalous.

This one was okay, but not my favorite. On draft at Clybourn brewpub. aroma of wheat and orange. Light orange/red color. Smells of banana, wheat, and orange. taste is wheat, banana, gumball, cloves, sligt sour, light astringent taste. Spicy and very complex. Reminds me of a belgian wit with much more spicey character with a hafeweizen yeast strain.

Half Pint draft on tap at the brewpub (Chicago, IL). Pours a rich almost copper pour, maybe a dark amber brownish pour with healthy haze, good fiery glow on the edges with big offwhite maybe almost beige head, laces well. Dies to a thicker film. Aromas are some touches of biscuits, faint toffee, with estery bananas, cloves and touches of spice. Some flaked wheat, bread dough, some touches of deeper sweetness. Spice. Initial is medium bodied with spice and touches of toffee, caramel, biscuits up front. Some banana, toffee, flaked wheat cloves, and spice. The darker bent (but not chocolate or full blown brown sugar) give it some more complexity and lessen the ester influence. Finish is fairly clean, faint spice and fruity ester. An easy drinker, most flavor is offered up front. Not bad, faint darker bent gives it some niceness. Solid wheat.

Draft: Cloudy lemon. Diminishing foam leaves behind a thin ring. Aroma of toasted husks, apple, lemon zest, and tropical fruits. Crispy, prickly carbonation. Rather brash sweep of salty herbs and dusty yeast triggers the onset of dryness. Benefits from a husky center, which helps to sustain the body. Pleasant fruitiness is next to nil, with the exception of some �off� apple notes. Finishes woodily dry and persistently husky, with a delayed toasted hay commencement that engulfs the earthy hop remnants. Fairly clean aroma, but the hints of butter and apple are tough to ignore. Carbonation is also a bit rough around the edges and the flavor is overly acidic. As Ordinary should be, this is meant to quaff, but that�s all this has to offer, really.
(Tap, Clark location) Pours a pale yellow body with a medium-sized white head. Aroma of grassy hops and malt. Flavor of mild hops. Basci bitter.

This was a cool beer. Pale straw yellow, clean nose and clean taste. Slight haze. Nose was a nice hop with minimal malt to it. On the tongue, it was complex in its simplicity, grassy, slightly bitter. The deceiving color resulted in substantial malt sugars to back up the hops. Very nice, very drinkable, very good.

Aroma apples, melons, flowers, grassiness. Taste a complex malt palate of fruit, sweetness, straw, cereal, followed midway with herbal bitterness and a bit of a chalky finish. Not so fond of the finish but I like it overall.

on tap at clybourn...Poured a crystal yellow with a small white head that didn�t last long. Aromas weren�t abundant here, but some bready, wheaty hints were present. Flavors were quite simple as well, with noticable bitter from start to finish. Just sems to be missing some complexity, but then again it�s ordinary...

Clear, light pale yellow in color with a fluffy snow white head. Numerous bubbles span the inside of the glass. Aroma is muted. Some citric, yeasty acidic hints. Not much excitement leading up to the next step of the rating, but nevertheless... Hits the palate as light and smooth. Thin. The bittering is there, but it�s really discreet. Lemony and some acidity. Sourdough with lemon butter. Like a macro pale lager with an experimental extra helping of hops. Bitter, twangy finish.

Rating for Goose Island Single Hop Ordinary Bitter I was surprised that this was served cold (maybe it just felt cold because it was so hot outside...) Golden-bodied with a creamy white head that laced well. Bitter aromas were flowery hops with a touch of pine atop a grainy background. Lightly bitter throughout with a breadiness in the flavor. Medium-bodied and creamy. On tap at Goose Island Beer Company (Clybourn), Chicago, IL

Not bad. Light on the sprucey-tasting hops, very fruity. Garden variety pale ale brewpub aroma and color. Went very well with the food, moderate to light sweetness in the pale malt character. Not a whole lot of complexity, but it's a very drinkable brew.
Not half bad. A bit fruitier and lighter than your average bitter. Approval.
A nice color starts off this one, but the aroma lacks any "umph." Flavor is pretty good, though could use some more depth. A decent bitter, but not a great one.

Location: Draft at the Wrigleyville location, 7/6/14 Aroma: It has a solid malty aroma, somewhat sweet, lots of caramel Appearance: The pour of this one is amber-orange with a sheet of off-white colored head Flavor: Flavor-wise, it is similar to the nose, leans sweet, lots of caramel, some mild bitterness Palate: The body is medium-plus, it has a sticky mouthfeel, and a decently long finish Overall Impression: This is a solid, malt-forward beer. Overall, it works pretty nicely. It gets a bit sticky, though it doesn�t get to the point of being cloying.
On tap at goose island wrigleyville. Oh this company makes nice beer. Pretzel and spice in the nose. Very dry and superb palate. Crisp. Clear dark orange with nice lacing pattern. A perfect bock.
Tried at Goose Island Wrigelyville on tap. Toasty and warm. Malty but with a strong bitter aftertaste. Medium color, clear. Would go well with a beef stew.
Draft at the goose island brewpub in clybourn. Bright orange Rex brown color with a malty Carmel aroma
Not what I woudl call a "super" traditional take on the style but this is supremely drinkable, a nice one.

Flight on tap at the brewpub (Chicago, IL). Pours a deeper golden amber hue, some orange pink glow with a frothy whitish head atop, decent sized dies to a thicker film and laces ok. Aromas are sweeter, bready malts pair with caramel, some sweet breads, a touch cakey with light florals, toast, touches of warming alcohol spirit. Sticky sweet with some green apple, pie. Initial is medium bodied, hiding the alcohol well with some sticky sweet malts, touches of honey and caramel, with biscuits, cakey bread, mellow sweetness. Sweeter but hidden well with green apple, sweet malts, yet not heavy, touches of honey. Warming ABV on the backend, but lighter, some dryness into the finish. A solid Maibock, but not a beer style I generally love. Ok.

Draft at Clybourn. Pours a very attractive deep gold with a nice white head on top. Nose is heavy on honey and toasty melanoidins. Fresh bread as well. No hop aromatics. On taste, full toast and bread notes with some strong roundness. A sweetness comes across and balanced by a good dose of hops. It�s never cloying at all. Very good Maibock. Finish has a nice hop flavor that ties this one together.

On draft at Clybourn goose island brewpub. aroma is light orange, heavy grain. taste is semi sweet, warm going down. Color is orange. This one isn�t the best maibock I have ever have, however I have to give it credit that it is very close to the maibock style. Not very hoppy and very malty in character.

Draft at Clybourn. Poured a clear medium orange color with a thin off white head. Smelled of hay, dark fruit, and a hint of chocolate. Medium bodied and slick with carbonation on the mild side. Tasted of light chocolate, spicy malt, and earthy root.

On tap at Wrigleyville Goose Island. Poured a dark amber with an off-white head. Aroma consisted of notes of malts, wood and some sweetness. Flavor is dominated by malts and a wooden flavor. There was a nice sweet undertone.
On tap at Franklins, Hyattsville on 14 July 2006 (at 8.0%). Black in colour. Quite roasty. Strong, sharp bitterness, tending towards astringent. Thinnish mouthfeel. Unusual but not unpalatable.

Black/dark brown body with a small tan head. The nose is roast, dark chocolate, oats and molasses. The flavor is very roasty and lightly sweet with coffee, milk chocolate and oats. Medium body is round with light carbonation and a bitter finish.

Draft, Franklin�s. Pours a murky brown color; medium brown head that quickly fades to nothing. Pleasant cocoa and dark chocolate in the aroma; minimal hop presence (if any); a hint of fennel / licorice. Fizzy carbonation. Medium mouthfeel: cocoa and bitter chocolate; slightly acidic citrus presence, but not really from any refined hop character; drinkable, with plenty of chocolate. Medium, cocoa and bitter chocolate finish.

Post MiBGF party, growler provided by Ryan, THANKS! Murky brown hue with a fading small beige head and minimal lace. The aroma has notes of chocolate, oat, biscuit, smoke, dusty yeast, aromatic light tobacco and a hint of coffee. The taste starts with heavy roasted malt overtones, bready and nutty with a lush chocolate background. I found a hint of prune and coffee in midsection and the brew finished slight oxidized and dry. The mouth feel is lively and sharp at first before the dusty finish. A workable brew that seemed a tad old for some reason.

Courtesy of artusory Growler: The aroma consists of chocolate, oatmeal, roasted coffee, and faint vanilla. It pours a muddy brown with almost no head. The flavor starts with faint chocolate.The finish with lots of bitter coffee with very faint vanilla.

A very black beer with no head. The aroma is quite light, but what is there is sweet roasted combined with notes of oatmeal. The flavor is sweet and very malty and with notes of oatmeal. I find it a bit boring, but definately the most malty beer from Franklin�s that I�ve sampled.

Draught @ Brewpub Black, light head and lacing. Nose of roast, astringency and some black burnt coffee. Light vanilla and soy, overpowering and nausiating chemical bond taste. The finish is chalky and astringent. Dry, blech.

On tap at the brewpub. Pours a dark, dark brown without very much head at all. Has a malty smoked taste. Big coffee aroma. After drinking Chaos, this seems a bit thin in body. Roasted coffee flavors as well. Medium carbonation. It is missing any oatmeal thickness. The finish is rather tart. OK, but not great.

Poured with almost no head from the growler. Very dark color with a distict coffee scent. Full bodied and dry. Best served cool to room temp. Not a bad attempt at a stout from a small local microbrew-pub.

On tap. Deep, dark and dull mahogany pour with no head. Aroma is strongly of roasty coffee and malts with hints of chocolate. Thin mouthfeel. Dark roasty malts and coffee/bitter chocolate dominate the flavor. A dry, black coffee bitter finish with some sourness. Seems more like a porter to me. Definitely lacks the smoothness and body of other oatmeal stouts I�ve had. Slightly above average carbonation and at 6% ABV a surprising warming presence of alcohol. If this is a leftover from the winter, it has aged harshly.
Medium body, moderate bitterness and hop aroma/flavor. At first I thought it was a rather strong example, but it falls in the weak end of the spectrum.
Sweet malt, deep chestnut, small toffe head. Sweet roasted malt taste, good bitterness too. Well balanced. Good effort, almost a Doppelbock.

I went up and expected this to live up to its name...what I got was something that barely rivaled a Guinness Draft. It pours a brownish mix with a nicely thinned out tannish head. First of all, call it weird, but I was getting yeasty aromas all over this one. Although it wasnt the predominant aroma, it was there for some reason or another. Coffee and vanilla malt were the common aromas with hints of chocolate, as is to be expected of a stout. This beer was absolutely nitroed...very creamy taste, SUPER light in taste...watery...somewhat of a cocoa bean taste with subtle hints of coffee. It ends very bitterly, and abruptly. This was far from Pissed Off...frankly it put me to sleep. Next....

Dark as night as can be expected with a decent head. Had on cask, Kind of a tweaked coffee aroma, subtle hints of some dried fruits. Had a real funky ass taste to it, rye was the strangest of the flavors and it also had a sourish belgian thing going on, but both these took back seat to the traditional deep coffee and choco flavs.

Keg at Muted Horn, Berlin, 11/07/19. Hazed golden orange with an off white head. Nose is nana, clove, straw, sweet malts. Taste comprises light breads, yeast tickle, banana, clove, orange peel. Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close. Solid classic hefe.
29-06-19 // tap at Muted Horn Slight unclear golden. White head. Banana, mild smoke, mild flowery. Lovely Weizen.

500ml bottle from Beers of Europe. Pours hazy gold, thick white head, good effervescence keeps it there. Aromas of banana bread, light clove. Taste is banana sweets, more clove bitterness, some chalk on the finish. Medium body, creamy texture. Not bad.
Bottle from Beers of Europe. Hazy amber with a fast diminishing head. Easy drinking wheat, some clove bit of banana, spices. Decent.
Tr�bes goldgelbes Weizen mit sch�ner Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, fruchtig bananig. Geschmack hefig, bananig, minimal w�rzig.

50 cl bottle @ Timo A. Pours hazy golden color with a medium head. Aroma of fruits, yeast, some grape fruits, mild wheat and spices. Flavor of fruits, yeast, wheat and some grass. Fruity and citric. Decent. 2345

On tap at Brauerei G�ller, 9.10.17. As G�ller Weizen. Cloudy yellow with a frothy white head. Sweet banana aroma, some bubblegum. Punch-banana ice cream in the mouth, a little tarty, spme spices. Medium body, fresh banana and some oranges finish. Very fizzy, medium body, long and juicy finish. Good for the style.
*Old rating. Best before 25.12.03. Fruchtiges Weizen. W�rzig und nicht so tief wie die "Steinhauer Weisse". S�ffiges, rundes Bier.

Tap@Taphouse, Copenhagen (17/07/2015) - yellow golden pour with white head. Sweet malty and wheaty aroma and taste, citrus fruity notes, some doughy yeasts, some grassy hop nuance, banana, into a sweet finish.
From tap at Taphouse. Hazy yellow colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of wheat, yeast, fruit, banana and spice.
Tap at Taphouse, Copenhagen. Originally rated 20150502. Colour is orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, banana, wheat and malts.
Tap. Unclear yellow with small white head. Aroma is malt, wheat, banana, hop, yeast and spices. Flavour is malt, fruit, wheat, banana, yeast, hop, medium sweet, spices and a little bitter.

Draught @ Taphouse, Copenhagen. Pours slightly hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of wheat, yeast, little sweet, banana, light dusty. Flavor is light sweet, wheat, yeast, banana. Medium body, soft carbonation. 020515
Tap @ Taphouse. Cloudy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, wheaty, banana and yeasty. Flavor is quite sweet. Sweet finish. 010515
