Faint spicy hops. Soft carbonation leaves a foamy residue on the palate. Severely grainy with husky malts underlain with caramel-heavy, cookielike malt. Concrete-tainted yeastiness strongly exacerbates the astringent malt. Salty mineral is pleasant but little else to salvage drinkability. Hops are spicy and oily and lightly floral, though things continually lean toward sloppy and muddled as the body is quite worty and underattenuated. Closes dully and limply with ongoing concrete notes wreaking havoc. Very difficult to stomach...sloppy and amateurish.
Draft. Poured into a ceramic mug with a thick off white head. Pale and sweetish malts, lighter earthy notes, and a sweet malty finish. Good, not great.
Below average for the style. Plain light and not very spicy. A bit soapy. Oh I wish for so much more from this style, especially when I see one from Germany.
Okay. Typically dark, muddy, pleasant with all the weissen virtues and vices. Pretty standard stuff.
On tap. Deep brown/black color and no head. Banana, yeast, some coffee notes in aroma and taste. Short finish, light body, soft carbonation.

1L ma�. Nice looking brown colored dunkelweizen, big frothy head bubbles down eventually. Fairly sweet aroma, appetizing. Taste is typical of the style , lots of banana, nuts, and a little yeasty. It fails to impress the palate, though - it�s a bit on the fizzy side, and it isn�t quite as smooth as it ought to be. Overall, not bad.

Brown coloured body with a thinnish tan head. Aroma of caramel malt, wheat, nuts and a little bit of spices. Medium-bodied; Strong malty flavours overtake the taste along with some nuts and raisiny-sweetness. Aftertaste has good malty characteristics, but not much else. Overall, a good import to try - nothing too special though. I sampled this beer from a 500 mL bottle purchased at RFD in Washington D.C. on 15 December 2006.
[Bottle from Bamberg.] An ordinary dunkelweiss with the usually notes as banana, some bread, but could have some more ingredients in the flavor. Some watery, but OK!
Bottled. Cloudy orange/brown, creamy head. Papery nose with a light touch of banana. Sweet and medium bodied, fairly soft. A bit of grass. The levels of banana esters is fairly light.

Murky, dark brown with a huge, nice and creamy head. The aroma has light notes of clove and wheat and the flavour has a light sweetness, notes of wheat, caramel and clove. It�s quite nice, but as most of the dunkel weiss biers, it�s not nearly as full of flavour as the light one.

Bottle 50cl. Pours a muddy dark brew with stable white head. Much floaties, just a little bit too much yeast. Smell bread, yeast, hops. Fizzy carbonation. A round and pleasant taste, but yeast is dominating. No bottle fermentation.

(bottle) Cloudy, dark amber colour with a big and lacey, off-white foamy head. Sweet and toasty, just a bit wheaty aroma with a distinctive lemon-citrus fruitiness and a whiff of banana. Light-sweet and sourish flavour, light to medium bodied, quite soft mouthfeel for a Weizen. Slim malty, slightly toasted and wheaty taste with mainly citrus, slightly lemony fruity notes; slightly toasted and minimal sourish tart finish. A bit slim but pleasant Dunkelweizen (27.05.08).
"i agree, not good enough to be labeled a "brewers reserve", but pretty good for the style...just not enough going on to be a good special release. ok, decent aroma and balance, but that�s about it."

Full Sail Brewing Company--Equinox ESB--Seasonal--1998 Release--12 oz. Bottle--5.50% ABV. (4.25 / 5.0) ESB--Excellent Brew. Sampled 5/1/1998. Equinox Extra Special Bitter--Seasonal--1999 Release--12 oz. Bottle. 5.50% ABV (4.25 / 5.0) ESB--Pretty clear copper red bronze color. Big hop front followed by rich earthy malty ESB body and strong bitter finish. Hoppier than most ESB�s with signature Full Sail harsh hop profile. Sampled 3/7/1999. Equinox Extra Special Bitter--Seasonal--Beer You Can Believe In 1999B Release--12 oz. Bottle--5.50% ABV. (4.0 / 5.0) ESB--Clear light copper amber color. Earthy hop aroma infuses crisp dry doughy body adding green pine hint to light burnt notes. Classic ESB flavor with dry light spice finish. Sampled 9/14/1999. Equinox Extra Special Bitter--Brewmaster Reserve 2006--2006 Release--22 oz. Bottle. 5.70% ABV--45 IBU�s? (4.5 / 5.0) ESB--Thick pour. Mild lace head. Cloudy bright rich amber orange color. Earthy mild hop front. Crisp dry sweet smooth earthy caramel bisquit mild fruit ester body. Clean bitter hop spice mild citrus ESB end.WOW! Sampled 3/27/2006.

Bottle listed as Equinox Brewmasters Reserve. Not sure what made it part of the Brewmasters Reserve, but I really didn�t think much of the beer overall.

An aroma dominated by a soapy character that was pretty overwhelming that it just stepped on anything else that the beer was trying to give. Oxidation in the flavor with some offset earthy hops and some old malt flavor. This just didn�t ring my bell at all, and usually Full Sail beers are pretty tasty.

A hazy amber ale with a thin off white head. A musty hops aroma, doughy, sowing signs of oxidation. In mouth, a good malt, with nuttyness, and sustained British hops bitterness, with grapefruit in final. Medium bodied. Brewmaster reserv 2006. Bought at Booze Bros, August 2007.

Decent and drinkable, but not what I was looking for. This has a lot more fruitiness than I was expecting, with a really light caramel malt body, I just don�t feel the hop profile really matches everything else in the beer. Light sweet fruits, mixed with a sharp citrus hop bitterness.
Hazy amber, moderate head with solid lacing and retention. Aroma is fairly fruity with some lesser caramel notes. Medium to light bodied, moderate to low bitterness. Very drinkable, solid flavors.

dark golden amber with small off white head. caramel sweet aroma with a light orange tanginess. medium body and crisp carbonation. rich caramel flavors with a good bitterness. the beer has a pine resin bitter finish. pretty good beer, nothing too complicated, but simple and balanced

Bomber. Something like a caramel aroma backed by citrus hop. Hard to get a good smell, as the foam exceeds the liquid. Hazy gold tinged amber color. The head is huge, but it�s not lacing much. (It did lace a lot after the foam reduced 2/3s) Medium body with sharpish carbonation. Mild caramel with a bit of harsh floral and/or citrus hop. Pretty tasty. Waters out a bit at the finish, but it�s even more bitter at that point. Probably a bit extreme for most UK residents.
Yeah! Tasted in 2000 and loved ever since! Poured a copper amber body with a thin white head. Good lacing. Sweet citrus presence. Malty as well with a sweet bite to it. Sessionable as sin.

Had this beer on 8/27/1999. Color is a bright golden brown with good carbonation and a thin head. Aroma is a nice fresh hop scent. Taste is malty sweet, hoppy and oh so bitter. It starts with a medium body that has a bitterness in it right from the start. The finish starts as the beer goes down with a strong bitterness coming on and a light hop flavor.
Keg at Zum Fransiskaner, Stockholm. Standard lager aroma. Beaut deep lager gold with great head. Nice grassy taste but awful vodkay ending. A mixed bag.

Draught. Pours lightly cloudy brown with a medium, rocky off-white head, medium-low retention with light lacing. Moderate yeast character, medium doughy bread malt, light earthy hops, medium-light hop bitterness, and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

F�r ein fr�nkisches Kellerbier meiner Meinung nach eindeutig zu herb und hopfenbetont und zu wenig s�ffig. Aus der Flasche noch bitterer und das nicht im positiven Sinne. Die hohe Platzierung ist f�r mich nicht nachvollziehbar.

Tap at Zl� �asy. Golden body leaning slightly towards amber with a lasting white head. Bready maltiness dominates the aroma, full, simple, effective. The taste is similarly under its sway, with some mild flowery and herbal notes being added along with a teeny tiny bitterness. A good lager by all means, but didn't thrill me as much as I hoped it would.

On tap at Ma Che Siete. Clear light amber colour, creamy off-white head. Aroma of crisp malts, light toffee, soft grassy notes, minerals. Flavour is soft, light sweet, some toffee, malty, just light bready, grass, light floral, firm bitterness. Light bodied, smooth. Really subtle and tasty.

Van 't vat. Helder goudblond met wit schuim. Geur: redelijk neutraal, mout, wat hooi, ietwat kledergeur, keller? ;-) Smaak: mout, licht strak bitter, wat grassig. Goede koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: droog, licht bitter.

(draught) presumably hazy golden colour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of haystacks and floral hops, with a touch of milky yeast, some gentle pale malts, subtle barnyard and fresh wort. flavour is mostly herbal hops and chewy pale malts, with lots of lip balm, yeast and dandelions in the rather bitter finish. medium-bodied with average carbonation. nice and hoppy, could be a little cleaner though.
Tap @ zum. Poured golden color with a thin white head. Grainy malty. Clean and refreshing. Crisp, dusty. Awesome.

Gezapft bei Brewdog in Berlin. Bernsteinfarben, tr�b, kaum Kohlens�ure, wenig Schaum. Aroma: W�rzig, Brot, etwas Honig Geschmack: Bitter (lang anhaltend), Stroh, Brot, Karamell, leichter fruchtiger Hintergrund. Gew�rz im Abgang.

From barrel at Moor. It pours with golden with a thick, white head. The aroma is soft, sweet, mellow bready, brioche, cakey, dull toasted almond, biscotti, doughy bread, grass and straw. The taste is dry, light bitterness, green, grassy, straw, herbal, peppery spice, cracker, doughy bread and tannin with a dry, straw finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Well rounded and flavourful. Punchy and grassy.

column2: Neuhaus an der Pegnitz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: 0,5l Flasche. Gelb und klarer hoher heller Schaum. Getreide. Etwas muffig. Naja

column2: Neuhaus an der Pegnitz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: Pour golden colour with a nice frothy white head that keeps a nice lacing that last longer. Aroma is malty and slightly hoppy, some grass notes. Flavor is pretty much the same as aroma. Medium carbonation and light body with a light bitterness and sweet finish.

column2: Neuhaus an der Pegnitz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: Klare goldgelbe Farbe, ordentliche wei�e Schaumkrone. Geruch getreidig malzig, kaum Herbe. Geschmack trocken malzig, mild hopfig, unangenehme Bitterkeit, naja!

column2: Neuhaus an der Pegnitz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: Bottle: aroma of malt and grassy hops. Pale golden color, white head. Flavor is malty and grainy with grassy hops. Nothing special.

column2: Neuhaus an der Pegnitz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: Pours golden, little head. The aroma has notes of straw. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt.

column2: Neuhaus an der Pegnitz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: bottle from an Autobahnrastst�tte on the A9. Clear yellow colour, mid-sized head. Malty, hoppy with a herbal character and a touch of cardboard.

column2: Neuhaus an der Pegnitz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: bottle from an Autobahnrastst�tte on the A9. Clear yellow colour, mid-sized head. Malty, hoppy with a herbal character and a touch of cardboard.

column2: Neuhaus an der Pegnitz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: Bottled. A golden beer with a white head. The aroma is sweet malty with notes of caramel and straw. The flavor is sweet malty with notes of bread and straw as well as light notes of citrus, leading to a dry bitter finish.

column2: Neuhaus an der Pegnitz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: Bottle. Golden, slowly diminishing loose lacy head. Strawy-malty nose with a light papery touch. Sweetish-bitter flavour, light to medium bodied. Straw, pale malt and a touch of bitterness in the finish. Disappointing..........

column2: Neuhaus an der Pegnitz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: (bottle) Clear, pale golden colour with a medium-sized foamy white head. Sweet pale malty and slightly grainy nose with notes of citrus and grassy hops. Sweet-bitter flavour, light to medium bodied with a crispy mouthfeel. Well-rounded pale malt-character with herbal and subtle grassy hoppy accents, leading into a dry and moderately bitter and slightly hoppy finish with a touch of grains and malty. Clean and balanced Helles (24.X.08).

vom fass. pours a large tan head. Dark, dark brown with scarlett highlights. Rich chocolate with a slight dark roast to aid in a drying finish. Medium bitterness. No hop flavor. Slight coffee notes. a bit of huskiness/tanin. slight tartness as it warms.
Bottle @ Kaiserdom. Pours dark brown with a creamy head and lacings. Vague roast, caramel and bread. Very smooth and grainy flavor with some ashy notes.Good!
Ceramic mug. Nice, thick caramel-coloured head. Some toasty nose but mostly buttery. Flavour only has a shade of butter with caramel and earthy character.

Draft @ brewery tap. Served in krug. Is a black beer with a thick luscious tan head. Butter on the nose sits on top of a dry schwartz malt aroma that has cola, nuts, and asphalt. The palate is fine, not slick. The diacetyl is hardly detectable in the mouthfeel. The flavors are nice roasted malts and a dry nutty toasty roast. The butter burns off in both the flavors and the aromas, only lingering slightly. If it weren�t for the butter this would be a great beer. It�s still a nice and dry schwarzbier with tasty malt flavors.

Draught. Pale brown colour, small beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, some hops and quite much caramel. Flavour is quite much the same. The barstaff claimed this beer is the same as the bottled beer called Altbairisch Dunkel, when I tried to ask if I can buy a bottle of the Dunkel...
On tap at Gasthaus Kaiserdom, Bamberg. Black with tan head. Sweet, fruity beer with a little smoked character. Some caramel, smooth, but a little short on flavour.
Tap near the Rathaus, Bamberg 0,5ltr: Almost black as an Irish stout. Its has roasted malts and some caramel taste.

Draught. High creamy and lasting white head. Hazy very dark red almost black body. Roasted dry barley malt aroma with caramel. Notes of berries and nuts. Relatively sweet caramel berries flavor with a fair amount of hops bitterness. Low carbonation. Short sweet aftertaste.

Draught at Akkurat, Stockholm. Dark brown, small beige head. Aroma of strawberries and roasty malt. Sweet and light bodied with clean, rounded mouthfeel. Estery notes of bubblegum and peach. Strongly medicinal finish.

(Draught at Akkurat, Stockholm, 4 Oct) Dark brown colour with ruby hints, pale brown frothy head. Malty nose with chocolate and dark fruit. Malty, roasted taste with chocolate, dark fruit, raisins and prunes. Slightly sweet, balanced fruity finish. Modest bitterness. Nice and tasty.
500ml bottle at home, Munich. Aroma is light malty, light nuts. Appearance is clear golden with a white foam. Taste is light bitter and very light sweet. Medium body, light wztery, subtile dry. OK.

getrunken im Sommer 2016 Die Braustadt Freistadt im M�hlviertel hat eine Besonderheit aufzuweisen, welche gerne im BWL-Unterricht durchgenommen wird: Eine Braucommune. Dies ist eine Art AG, an der jeder B�rger der Stadt automatisch einen Anteil hat, wenn er in einem gewissen Teil der Stadt wohnt. Wie das System genau funktioniert, wage ich nicht zu erkl�ren, nur soviel: Jeder Anteilseigner bekommt einen Teil Freibier. Das M�rzen ist das Standardbier der Brauerei, das auch in vielen Gasth�usern gezapft wird. Es ist ein typischer Vertreter des �sterreichischen M�rzens: Etwas herber und vollmundiger im Geschmack als das deutsche Pils, aber auch nicht so gehaltvoll wie viele Fest-M�rzen aus Bayern. Es l�sst sich gut trinken und stellt jeden zufrieden -man darf sich halt kein Spezialbier mit besonderen Aromen erwarten.

50cl bottle from a trade with sebilinz, thanks! A clear pale golden beer with a mid-sized most good lasting white head. Aroma of mild straw and pale malt. Taste of straw, pale malt, mild bitterness, easy to drink!
Probably my favourite beer. Very clear, crisp and fresh. Just the right strength and tastes as good out of the bottle as out of the tap.
From old notes. Bottle from the brewery. A light, Austrian Marzen, about 11 plato. Medium malt, reasonably nice hop aroma, fruity. Somewhat thin and light, but well balanced for a lower-abv beer.

500 ml bottle from Biertempel Graben, Linz, bb 02.05.16 Pale golden, clear body, with a big, frothy, lacing, white head. Aroma of grass, flowers, grains, bread, some biscuit. Tastes of cardboard, grass, flowers, some herbs, grains, some citrus, some honey. Medium, slick mouthfeel, with an average carbonation. Finishes bitter, medium dry, hoppy, floral, grassy, herbal. OK. The nose is good, with nice floral notes, taste is quite boring though, bitter hoppy, but pretty flat. Not the worst M�rzen I�ve had, but nothing special at all.
Bottle Golden body white head. Aroma is bread with grains and hints of herbs.Taste is bread with malts and some hints of honey. Aftertaste is malty with hints of hops.
Golden color with thick long lasting white head. Strong malty aroma with notes of bitter hops. sweet malty taste with grassy hops, hay, metallic notes.
fine aroma, rocky head, pale, clear, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, slick feel, average carbonation, long finish,

(bottle) Almost clear, golden coloured hue with a lacing, slightly off-white foamy head. Light-sweet pale malty aroma with shy woody hoppy notes. Delicately bitter flavour, light to medium bodied with a moderate carbonation. Malt accented, slightly chalky taste with herbal notes. Quite dry and moderately bitter finish with a herbal hoppy touch. Unspectacular but also quite rounded brew (26.XI.08).
Es ist ein sch�nes, vollmundiges Bier mit angenehm spritzigen Aromen -nicht fruchtig oder grasig, aber einfach irgendwie passend. Vom Einstieg bis zum Abgang ein toll komponiertes Bier.

Malty aroma, smells like grain and a bit metallic. Blank golden color with a medium white head, that sticks to the glass. Flavour is medium sweet, light bitter. It tastes malty like grain, bread. The finish is light bitter and short. Standard Helles, good. 0,33l bottle.

Golden yella with minimal head. Faint aroma. Basic lager aroma, wet bread and weak hops. Some sweet malt flavor and corn flakes, then finally that sliver of bitterness. Pretty unimposing. Not bad, but even for the style it's light on taste.

Klare, goldene Farbe mit wei�er, kleiner Schaumkrone. Leicht getreidiger, malziger und grasiger Geruch. Leicht malziger, s��er Geschmack mit ebenso dezent grasigem Hopfen. Etwas Bitterkeit im kurzen Abgang. Sehr s�ffig mit leichtem K�rper und dezenter Kohlens�ure. Unkompliziert, geradlining, einfach.
Bottle. Clear yellow gold with a small white head. Grains, citrus, light honey. Light sweetness with a soft bitter, hoppy finish. Light body, soft pearly carbonation. Surprisingly good.

(Bottle, 0.5 l, from a supermarket, 20170530) The beer poured golden and clear. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had grass and sweetness. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were grass, sweetness, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was bitter. A decent brew with crisp finish.
Tap. Clear golden color with white head. Aroma is cereal, sweet malts, straw, bread. Taste is sweetish malts, more cereal, Fruchtgummi. Medium carbonation. Solid Helles.
0,33 l Flasche. Optisch und aromatisch ein Standardbier ohne erw�hnenswerte Besonderheiten.
0,33l bottle out of Culturbrauer Box. Mild and easy drinkable, but not very tasty. Ok. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0.33 l bottle thanks to Sebelinz. Appearance: small head on top of a light yellow clear body. (Quite lively) Taste : malts, gras ,hops Taste: Some moderate sweet light malts, with an Above average bitternessis Light palate, lively carbonation, but not annoyingly too much. Decent beer, but a bit borring.

(keg) clear deep golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of caramelized malts and raisins, with a light touch of green apple, some pickled apricots and dandelions. flavour is mostly unripe pear and pale malts, quite chewy, with a hint of caramelized grain in the semi-dry finish. medium-bodied with average carbonation. solid stuff!

11th Sep 2018, half-litre sat outside the Alt-Ringlein Hotel in the afternoon sun. Pale golden body, bright, clean and clear; on top a white pillow of foam. Light malty aroma and taste with a mild caramel flavour, nice.

Appearance: Clear light golden, nice white head. Aroma: Standard hops and light malt. Taste: Light malt, good hops. Some sweetness? Fresh. Bought: Alt-Ringlein (Bamberg), 300 ml draft, �2.40 Info: 9/8-2018
Tap at Ringlein, Bamberg. Golden, clear with a min white head. Aroma of caramel and malt. Light bittersweet with a caramel end.
At Alte Ringlein, Golden, small head. Aroma is grain, sweet. Taste is the same, meh average.
Draft @ Alt-Ringlein, Bamberg. Pours a clear golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty grainy aroma. Fruity malty grainy grassy flavor. Has a fruity malty grainy grassy finish.

Look; sch�ne Schaumkrone and crystal clear deep straw golden body. Aroma; malts, lots of strawy hops, mild spices, herbs - very inviting aroma. Taste; fruity malts, strawy hops, candiced peels - moving along with a good fruitiness to a mild finish with malts and apple notes. Normal texture and fine soft carbonation. This is a good brew, very fresh and clean, and just what you need together with a tasty frankish dish. It went very well with my lunch served outdoors at Alt-Ringlein in beautiful Bamberg Old City. [50cl 4.9%abv vom Fa� @ Alt-Ringlein in front of hotel in Bamberg T@Ferie2015]
Draught at the beer garden. Light gold with a thin head, ok lacing. Grainy malt aroma, grainy malt flavour, a little musty.

On tap at Alt-Ringlein, Bamberg, Bavaria. Pale gold with gassed white head. This proved to be quite a thin, slightly musty, grainy Helles, there was a light lemony note, sweetish on warming. Pretty bland.
At the hotel. Golden with a lasting white head. Clean malty aroma with herbal hops. Sweetish malty flavour with just enough herbal hops. Pretty average helles

Bottle 500ml. Clear light to medium yellow color with a large, frothy to creamy, good lacing, mostly to fully lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, grain, hay, straw, toasted, vegetable, light hoppy, grass, herbal. Flavor is moderate sweet and light moderate bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20100917]
Bottle. Medium head with medium duration. Color is pale golden. Aroma and taste are malt, butter,grass and hops.
Bottle 50 cl. Courtesy of fonefan. Pours a clear yellow with a rough white head. The nose is dominated by dry flowery hops. Medium body, good maltiness balanced with very dry hops. 170910
Bright straw colour with a thick head. Ligthly apple with a hint of straw and herbal hop. Light bitterness. A little bit creamy with a faintly herbal character and light straw backdrop.

Draft. Pale, clear, straw gold. Nice head. Very mild, almost bland aroma. Light body. Sweet grain throughout is clean. In spite of a decent hop character, it is far too sweet for my taste. 5-3-6-3-12 Re-rate, clear gold with thick stable head. Fresh pils aroma is dry. The body is light, the flavors are mild, just dry without much bitterness. Nice and easy. 7-4-7-4-14
Bottle. Mild hoppy aroma. Clear golden colour. Good stable white head. The flavour has a little hop note. Medium bitterness, quite pleasant. A good, clean Pils.

Bottled (the bottle has a Werner cap, but according to the lady in Krug-Br�u Ebelsbach brewing has resumed in Ebelsbach). Bright pale golden, airy head. Medium dry with rounded slim mouthfeel. Light body covered in resiny grassy hops. Long bitterness. Simple, but correct.
Brewed by Werner in Poppenhausen. Bottle. Indifferent aroma. Hopbitter, slightly malty, herbal and grassy flavor. Medium bodied. Short bitter aftertaste.
Pours a clear straw yellow with a hugh pillowy head.Aroma of malts.Another typical Bavarian Pils.The finish was clean and crisp.

Sampled Nov 2003, Rothenburg. Head is initially average sized, frothy, white, mostly diminishing. Body is medium yellow. Aroma is lightly malty (bread, grain), moderately hoppy (flowers, herbs). Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, moderately bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation.

tap and nitro-pretty much the same, other than the nitro being a little more dry on the finish. pours a copper hue with good lacing and head retention. caramel malt and some nice irish like dryness/earthyness. some good apple notes in the finish, like a good irish dry red ale. body is fluffy and has a good body. probably their best beer.

Nitro-Tap rating This has a bit more head than the standard tap, but of course the same color. Again there is no real aroma to speak of. The taste is perhaps a bit smoother, and there is a bit of a caramel note here as well as a bit of currant. There is a hint of bitterness in the finish. I prefer this slightly to the draft version, but not by much. Regular Tap rating This beer is a full copper color and it is quite clear as well. The aroma is quite subtle and I can barely pick any components out. There are no real hop notes here. The beer is thin and crisp with subtle malt notes. I get some fruitiness with notes of strawberry and currants, a hint of apple as well. Again this is quite lame, though with no off flavors.
Sampler. Red amber with a good head. Aroma was sweet malt with a rather bland malty flavor.

Sweet malty aroma. Dark gold body. Sweet carmel flavor to it. Was and enjoyable beer just not bad not that you would want to just say hey you have to have this one. Also had the Nitro Red on the sampler. Had the same malty aroma. Flavor was bland.

This beer has 2 varieties: Regular draft or Nitro draft. There is a world of difference between the two. I'll rate the regular: It's a plain, bland red ale. The nitro on the other hand is a much smoother, drinkable beer.

column1: Eel River Certified Organic India Pale Ale
column5: I'd say this is towards the top of 2nd tier IPAs out there. Maybe they improved the recipe. Has that West Coast flavor, and smooth/crisp mouthfeel. Not super malty, with decent and clean hop finish. It's $1 off at Whole Foods @ $8.99 for another 4 months, so I will probably get a few more of these.

column1: Eel River Certified Organic India Pale Ale
column5: Bomber pours a cloudy pale gold with a two finger off-white head and puffy lacing. Aroma is citrus, malt, tree sap. Taste is fairly simple, lemon, medicine, hops, malt. Bitterness is fairly tame and the aftertaste is pleasant enough.

column1: Eel River Certified Organic India Pale Ale
column5: Very full with a dark caramel malt at first, a little sweet. Hops come on with some bitterness, but it's a dry and trashy finish. Not a standout.

column1: Eel River Certified Organic India Pale Ale
column5: Meh. Had this before years ago and still meh. But drinking upstairs at Flow restaurant overlooking Mendocino Headlands on a rainy Thursday 2018 spring Break. Masters are not on tv here. Another strike. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

column1: Eel River Certified Organic India Pale Ale
column5: Good fresh flavor with a hint of summer. Bottle and label a bit bland. Good taste for an organic beer ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

column1: Eel River Certified Organic India Pale Ale
column5: Aroma and flavor is malts, fruit/citrus, caramel and a sweetish/bitter hop finish.

column1: Eel River Certified Organic India Pale Ale
column5: An IPA that stands out...bold goes down smooth strong a bull. Fresh and finishes like a pro ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

column1: Eel River Certified Organic India Pale Ale
column5: Bottle from Total Wine. Medium amber with small foamy head. Malty aroma and taste, low key hops provide a small bitter bite, but nice caramel malts are what this brew us all about.

column1: Eel River Certified Organic India Pale Ale
column5: Bottle. Clear amber color With medium creamy White mostly lastning head. Malty and hoppy aroma. Sweet and bitter flavor.
On tap ambrata limpida buona schiuma leggera affumicatura amaro erbaceo finale

Tap @ Brewery. May 22, 2019. Sold as �Festbier Dunkel�. Pours deep amber with a creamy White head. Nutty and smokey. Dark malts and a whiff of bamberg smoke. Chewy. Smooth and soft. Rye-bread. Quite awesome! At 10 in the morning. More please!
Piwo wypite jaki� czas temu. Tylko og�lna ocena w celu uzupe�nienia profilu.
Yeasty sweet aroma, some malt, low on hops. Light and soft (that nice kind of softness)...
Clear, reddish color. Starts very nice, malty, with a silk palate, though it ends less satisfyingly with some unexpected flavors. Still, decent. (on tap, Pennsylvania Microbrewers Fest 2003)

Orange, with a thin ring of foam. Smells bready, toasty, with a whiff of caramel. Taste is pretty much standard amber - toast and caramel, plus a bit of hops. Slightly off or stale note in the finish.

Orange-amber, slightly off-white head, highly carbonated. Nice amber malt body with melanoidins apparent. Melanoidin amber flavors ooze through the palate. This one feels aged, or at least oxidized, and prematurely worn from the hot Arizonan atmosphere. Slight sour-sherry finish.
12 ounce can poured a golden yellow color with aromas of toffee, caramel, biscuit, and some light fruit. Flavor is slightly bitter with a some caramel, light fruit, and some biscuits.
Pours orange with an off white head. Nose is sweet malt, caramel, and toast. Flavor is grainy, caramel malt, light vanilla, and light bitterness.
(Draught) Pours a clear golden body with a medium white head. Aroma of pine, caramel, and resin. Flavor of dank, pine, caramel, citrus, and pineapple with a moderately bitter finish.

12oz can as extra. Pours fine, nice golden hue. Smell is rather bland minor citus, it worries me that there will be not taste to it. Sure enough, zero taste. nothing forward or mid palate but harsh hops and metalic off flavors. I can�t finsh my glass it�s too harsh and overbearing. I can�t say this is something i ever want again.

State week month, week 1 Oct 2nd - 8th. State: Arizona. My ratings this week have been brought to you by the letters d & c and the name schiller Thanks Dave! The beer pours an orange color with a semi loose head and some good lace. The aroma is very toffee forward with some light caramel and a good bit of toasty malt. This is a very rich smelling beer, plenty of sweet and bold pungency. The flavor is pretty much what I expected from the aroma, toasty malt, some biscuit, and a good bit of fruity hoppiness. The beer is mildly bitter, quite malty, and a little tart. The beer is far from dry but equally far from cloying.

12oz can pours copper with gold edges and smooth moon cratered tan head. The aroma offers up sweet malts, sweet wort notes, some biscuit malts and then loads of sugary sweetness at the end of the draw. The taste is . . . whoa, this is hugely sweet and only tempered by timid notes of various roasted malts. This is too sugary sweet to even finish. Meh!

Can from mom. Thanks mom! Gold/bronze in the glass, suspended sediment throughout, small flaky white head. Some orange peel, little dry leafy aroma, bit of molasses. Little metallic, nearly offensive. More orange peel, little grainy body, seems oxidized, little heat in the finish. Enjoying this less with each sip.

12oz can-thanks dak via jtclockwork-pours a disappearing off white head and slightly hazy amber color. Aroma is sweet medium malt-caramel, vegetal, musty. Tastes is sweet light/medium malt-bready/caramel/barn/horst blanket/musty.
Wypite przed kilkoma laty, nie jest ju� produkowane� Ocena przepisana z notatek.
500ml Flasche. Noch mit 6,6%. Goldgelbes Bier mit weissem Schaum. Malz und Alkohol in der Nase. Unrunder Geschmack.
Malt: cereal, Hops: grass, Yeast: basement aromas, Other: alcohol, bubblegum, butterscotch.

Well this is rare. A glorified malt liquor that I actually didn�t mind, contrary to the overwhelming opinions here. Sweet, corny, lightly toasty, with hints of apple. No metal. I honestly actually finished this and was satisfied. Maybe it�s been too long since I�ve had a beer?
Bottle. Golden colour with a white head. Aroma is fruit, malt, grass. Flavour is fruit, malt, apple, alcohol, hop, grass. Boring beer.

Bottle. Pours golden with an off-white head. Aroma of malt, sugar, caramel, candy apples and caramel. Flavor is sweet and malty with some herbal, floral and caramel notes. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle. A slow gusher producing a minimal-sized white head over a clear, golden body. The aroma is quite fruity, with pale malts, some hints of wet cardboard, and some freshly mown grass. Quite fruity flavor with some grass and wet cardboard. Medium to thin on the palate, soft carbonation. The finish if mostly on the fruity side. Not much bitterness going on here. Well, I won�t miss this one. 121102

Bottle 500ml @ Geokkjer Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, alcohol, grain and floral. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Somewhat sweet with hoppy nutes and malty palate. Not hidden alcohol. White foam, medium thickness. Dark-golden colour. Uninteresting beer.
Pours faintly cloudy pale gold with a collared white head. Aroma is a bit sour with a hint of spicy hops. Flavor is fairly balanced with subtle hops, alcohol and adjunct-laden malt.
Can from World Market. Clear brown with a small off-white head. Caramel, light chocolate candy nose. Flavor is candied caramel, light chocolate, brown leaf. Artificial flavoring like crazy.
Sugary malt with molasses backbone. Finish is a little flat, but it�s a decent brown ale.

Draft at the source. Pours lightly hazed amber-brown with a minimal beige. Chocolate malt nose. Mild roasted character, cocoa, sweet malt flavors. Some hops kicks in on the medium finish. Light style.
Pours dark brown with a finger of tan head. Aroma is smoky with prunes and milk chocolate. Flavor is nutty with smoky sweet malt. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Sent to me by Strykzone. Pours dark brown. Tan head. Nose of chocolate. Medium body. Flavor is fruit and chocolate. Finish is bitter. Nice beer.
Toasted and earthy malt aromas along with a herbal hops component. Caramel and toasted malt flavors. A touch acidic. A standard brown in my book. 10/11

12 ounce bottle. Dark brown and opaque. A nice fluffy beige head leaves inconsistent lacing. A lighter aroma of cocoa and grain. A dry beer to start. Grain is prominent along with something like oats. Some kind of dark fruit with currants (?). Different flavors here. Earth and very gentle bitterness. Chocolate is noted but it is under the grain and earth. This is easy drinking and generally sweet. Flavors are not big and it drinks easily.

Poured from bottle. Aroma of caramel, malt and a tiny bit of hops. Appearance is solid brown, lacing head. Tasting roasted malt, burnt caramel, hops, butterscotch, veggies. Slightly sour on back. Pretty easy drinking, Not too carbonated. Overall, a decent, inoffensive brew.

Shared 12 oz. bottle. Pours a cloudy amber with a minimal beige head. Aroma is mainly malty, with perhaps hints of dark fruits. Taste is sweet caramel malt and is also very nutty (maybe chestnuts) and bitter, to the point of being rather unpleasant. Disappointing.

Aroma: simply malty with no other notes; Appearance: chocolate brown with no head -- at all; Taste: strong chocolate and malt, but not in a good way; somewhat watery with an odd tasting finish; Palate: medium body with little carbonation; Overall: not very pleasant; would not buy again.

This is a backlog rating from�2011 from a bottle, from�notes.�When I had this beer it was average to below average for the style and not something I wanted to have again or I just didn't get back to my notes because of my technology at the time. Words to describe this beer are pale malts, forgettable.

Slightly hazed light golden color. small, but stable off-white head. Aromas of grain, pale malt, and hints of floral to minty hops. Flavors follow the scents. Very bitter in the finish, mostly because of the lack of a malt backbone. 10/11

12 ounce bottle poured into a brandy snifter. Pours a hazy copper color with a white head of foam that dissipates quickly. The aroma has stale cardboard papery character. It is overwhelmingly so. I can usually deal with some oxidation, but this is so bad I am tempted to pour it. The taste is sweet and herbal, but definitely stale. I don�t know how old this beer is, but it is definitely past its prime. Carbonation is moderate and the body is appropriate.

Yellow gold color with a large, foamy white head. A bit of a sour citrus nose. Some bready malts and lightly toasted white bread with a bit of lemon and bitter orange peel in the finish. There is an odd tartness to this that may be intentional. Okay beer.

Pours a dark golden hue with a very little white head. Aroma is rather malty with a hint of...vanilla? No, it�s caramel. I�m a huge caramel fan but this just odd. Very weird. Tastes very malty with a ton of caramel in the mouth with a bizarre Scottish vibe...which normally I would like. In this case, it kind of falls flat for me.

12oz Bottle opened on 13th July 2014 and poured into stemmed Corsendonk badged tulip glass at my daughters place in Newport Beach, California. My first beer from this State, up to 30 now. Clear light amber body with carbonation bubbles rising to replenish the already deep off white head. No sediment left the bottle. Uncomplicated but far from dull, this packs a good hop punch in both the nose and taste: the malts being slightly understated and just below the surface, coming into their own towards the finish of each sip and getting more prominent as the beer warmed a little. Overall a very nice easy drink brew and a great find for me to add South Carolina onto my little list of US States ticks.
Smooth normal beer average mix of malt and hops....slightly bitter...nothing special of note

This is reviewed from notes as this was consumed during some time I spent in Delaware visiting for my brother�s wedding. This was served in a pint glass. The appearance was a fairly light amber color with a decent transparency about it. There was a nice one finger white foamy head that dissipated at a nice even pace. There was some adequate light lacing sticking finely to the sides of the glass. The smell were some bitter hops but coming across somewhat burnt as I couldn�t really tell if they were citrus, piney or fruity. The hops just seemed burnt. The taste well, that was pretty much the same. Hmmm....ok, well, uh...there�s a really fine watery aftertaste and finish. On the palate, this one sits fairly light and sessionable. The carbonation - what carbonation there isn�t any. Overall, hmmmm...do I want to say this one missed the mark? Hmmm....normally, I don�t like to be that guy, but uh...to quote Bob Uecker in Major League, this one�s "just a bit outside."

Bottle pour of golden yellow with a fluffy off white head. Aroma of pine American hops and a big toasted caramel sweetness. Taste of huge bitter piney hops with the a slight sweetness. Med light body with bitter finish. Overall refreshing beer that is just too forward on the hops and out of balance to drink over and over. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz bottle served in pint glass from tasting notes in Feb. 2011. Production(?) date of 10/13/2010. Small amount of sediment added mid-tasting. A - hazy light amber/gold with limited and short-lived white head that leaves little lacing despite carbonation level (medium+). S - pleasant piney hops with citrus notes and detectable caramel malt. T - good hop hit for an APA. Malt provides significant sweet balance for hops� bitterness. Downgraded for feel and for the flavor of the aftertaste.
Poured light yellow with a grainy aroma. Taste was crisp and clean and lightly hoppy and fruity, but there was no hint of malt as I would expect from a kolsch. Drinkable, but not memorable.

RJ Rockers Light Rock Ale 12oz bottle. pours clear, light orange-yellow, thin white head. aroma of pale malt pretzels, and even with a hint of berry. nice presence of yeast in the nose. Bready flavor, pale malt, grassy hop flavor. Crisp bitterness. very light bodied. ultimately thirst quenching. 119 Calories, 9.8g Carbohydrates, 1g Protein, 0.0g Fat
Taste 9/8 Bottle (Date?) Looks: Pale gold, white top. Aroma: Very mild hop character and a little yeast. Taste: Very mild, a little bitter and creamy. Finish lasts. Bland.

Date: 04/12/2003 Mode: Draft Source: Brewfest, Hickory, NC yellow, light slightly sweet malt aroma, light sweet carmel malt flavor, just a touch of bitterness in the finish, too good for a kolsch, from the man with the corney backpack Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 2.6/5.0 Score: **/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Name: Light Rock Date: 04/12/2008 Mode: Draft Source: Brewfest, Hickory Hops Appearance: clear gold, huge creamy off white head, thick lace, Aroma: light malt aroma with light floral hops, Flavor: light malt flavor, just a touch of balancing floral hops, only a hint of bitterness in the finish, Aroma: 4/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 4/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 7/20 Rating: 2.1/5.0 Drinkability: 7/10 Score: *+/4
on tap @HopfestNC-pours a white head and yellow color. Aroma is somewhat sweet grain. Taste is somewhat sweet grain, faint hops.

Draught. Pours quite a light golden hue. Aroma? Is there one? There�s a weird candy sweetness in the watery flavor. This is thin even for a kolsch and not too clean. [November 6, 2010] Ordered a pint of this at Delaney�s Irish Pub in Spartanburg under the false impression that this was the "Light Rock" which is honestly probably the same beer anyway. Anyway, it�s not as bad as I recall. It�s not extra watery, but it is certainly tame. It pours a bit darker than macro lite beers would. The aroma is grainy with wimpy hops. Flavor is lightly tart with cereal and a gesture at papery hops. You just can�t win at the light beer game. This one has enough flavor for the style, but it�s not crisp or hoppy enough. It kind of reminds me of the corn flakes that fell out of the plastic bag and have been sitting at the bottom of the cereal box until you finally discover them after you thought you ate the whole bag.
Cask Handpump at Wilkie�s Tavern, Warrington 17/04/2003 Golden coloured with a fruity aroma. Sharp on the palate. Slightly bitter hop finish.

Cask Conditioned at The Last Drop Inn, York. A Pale Golden Bitter with whispy light head. Floral fruity aroma, which follows through to the drink. Tasting of lemon, elderflower the beer has a full hoppiness with loads of aftertaste.
Poorige Schaumkrone. Goldene Farbe. Sehr herber Geschmack f�r ein Export. Der Abgang ist eher w�ssrig.
Bottle, 50 cl, Weik, Ladenburg. Pleasant, refreshing, straw features. Nice, not too hoppy, hops.
From bottle. Transfer of an earlier rating without text recorded, rating only.
Bottle in Germany. refreshing, crispy, quite ok refreshing beer, really drinkable

Draught @ Camping Bella Italia, Lago de Garda. Pours yellow with a white head. Aroma of malt, grain, grassy hops. Flavor is light sweet, little bitter, malt, grain, little white bread, grass. Medium body, average carbonation. 290717

Maker: Privat-Brauerei Schmucker, Mossautal, Germany *** Beer: Schmucker Privat Export (bottled, 500ml) *** Style: Dortmunder Helles *** ALC.VOL.: 5.2% *** "A quaffable, malt-dominated beer with muted bitterness and a subtle hop flavour." [brewery note, my translation] *** Colour: Bright golden yellow, clear, with a big, frothy white head. *** Nose: Barley, a hint of vanilla, butter, straw. *** Texture: Medium body, not too watery, modest carbonation. *** Taste: Buttery opening, with clear barley malt, a hint of citrus, but surprisingly bitter considering the brewery�s own notes. Slightly increased bitterness even towards the middle, with hops and herbs over malted grain. Bitterness evaporates in the finish in favor of bready malts, some hops, and a wee bit of lemon. Aftertaste is grain, mild bitterness. *** Impressions: Refreshing and quaffable German lager in the "Export" style (i.e. maltier and with a slightly higher ABV than most Pilseners). Not bad for an "industry brew", a solid session beer.
Na, das kann man schon ganz gut trinken, aber eine Offenbarung wird es nat�rlich nicht sein k�nnen. Leicht an Vanille, etwas Getreide, ein bisschen Butter und Malz = ganz nett eben.

Bottle as "Schmucker Privat Export", bought at IxI Getr�nkemarkt in Frankfurt. The beer has got a clear deep golden colour with a low head and medium body. Aroma of hops and straw. Taste of hops, bread, straw, flowers and mild fruits. Hints of honey and herbs. Easy drinkable, refreshing.
Golden and nice looking beer, not too much aroma and white head. Taste is basic but good and the body is a bit heavier and maltier than expected and ends up being hearty and good.
Bottle from Maruhn. Clear golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and moderate hoppy - straw. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and light bitter finish. 101114

A great Saison with a dense, rocky white head and a faint scent of orange and coriander. Well preserved int he bottle with a very low hop presence but the beer is balanced nonetheless - probably due to a generous spicing regimen.

A great Saison with a dense, rocky white head and a faint scent of orange and coriander. Well preserved int he bottle with a very low hop presence but the beer is balanced nonetheless - probably due to the generous spicing regimen. Overall a great beer - a real surprise from an Ohio brewer!

25 oz bottle: Medium amberish with a frothy off white head that lasts. Etrange would be a very good description of how this beer smells! There is a decent malty base to the aroma, but the spices used seem all muddled together with none being distinct. The peppercorns come through as it warms. It doesn't really have the barnyard aroma as typical with saisons, but it is definitely unique! Maybe even a little grassy hop aroma. The flavor is well balanced, but a little to the hoppy bitter side with some of the pepper coming through in immediate palate. The finish is hop flavored as is the aftertaste. Oddly enough, there's not a whole lot of complexity to this one in the flavor. Medium bodied with higher level of carbonation and lightly dry m/f. I'm not sure it it's the age of this beer that has taken away it's complexity, or if it didn't really have any to begin with. Then again, I'm not that big a fan of saisons.

Thanks to Drew for tracking down a bottle of this for me. The bottle itself is beautiful with a yellow wax seal. It is also the first bottle of beer I have tried that employed both a bottle cap AND a cork. That is 3 layers of defense between me and a beer. The beer itself is a deep orange-amber color with a very thick and foamy bone white head. The lacing is very thick and sticky throughout. Lots of sweet fruit and allspice in the aroma. Medium-bodied, with an interesting fruit and spice flavor. Faint citrus throughout as well. There are also a lot of hops in the aftertaste. The finish is dry and tart. Although I am not all that familiar with the style, I enjoyed this one.

One of Quarryman's rare bottled beers, this is an interesting saison. Deep orange/red cloudy body, big fluffy tan head that settled into a ring floating on top and leaving nice lacing. Bottle conditioned. Bottle was corked, capped, and covered with a thick layer of bright yellow wax. A sweet fruity aroma. Flavors were much more earthy, full of spices (coriander, I think, along with who knows what else) and some malty sweetness at the back. Dry finish. Palate was nice, but grainy - Maybe this could be aged awhile. Unique

Some sweet malt evident in the nose. Dishwater also comes to mind. Dark red in appearance; almost non-existent head (just a whisp). Very good lace. Moderate malt flavor. Good, fairly rich. A quality brew.
2004 Autumn Brew Review: Dark Amber Coloring. Citrus, Spice, Hops..Makes For a Decent Brew.
Autumn Brew Review 2004. Nice dark amber coloring with a good head. Very nice hop aroma and flavor. A little spice in the flavor as well. Pretty tasty!
MABR-Golden color,small head,nice strong hop presence.Citrus spicey hoppy taste.Fruity mildly spicey after taste.Very nice brew.

My first visit to the new Bandana Brewing was a very positive one. From $1 Happy hour pints to the quality beer, this place is well worth the visit. Eagle Lake Pale Ale has an aroma of fresh hops and fruit...wonderful. Copper in appearance. Has a small, white, fine bubble head with excellent lace! Head is mostly eroding. Flavor is wonderfully hoppy. I will stop into Bandana for a few of these every time I'm down in Mankato for a MoonDogs game!

Draft at the OF. Not 100% that this isn�t MBC Hefeweizen. Cloudy and unfiltered to style, minimal non head. Clovy sugary aroma, mild banana. Lots of banana in the flavor, almost overbearingly so. Low CO2, could have benefited from higher levels. The yeast really makes this beer, dominating the flavor profile. Mellow and unimpressive.
Dark orange, whitish cover. Aroma of orange, light spice, coriander. Taste is solid spiciness, estery, orange, citrus, nice wheat.

On draft at MAH. From the sounds of things, this beer seems to be a bit different this year. It pours the traditional very hazy yellow-orange rather than the brownish color noted in previous reviews. Aroma is banana, cloves, some citrus, and a little grass. Flavor follows suit and is sweet and slightly spicy in the finish. Mouthfeel is smooth with solid body. This is the most enjoyable beer I�ve had from MAH to date and I would say an above average hefe.

I�m always on the search for a good American Hefe, this wasn�t it however. Pours a slightly clouded golden colour with a faint wheat aroma. Grainy on the palate, i was a little dissapointed in this brew.

Poured a very strange cloudy orangish brown. Smelled of ripe bananas (banana bread?) and some spices, particularly cloves. I also detected a hint of cinnamon in the nose. The flavor was really understated and didn�t have the chemical taste I always notice in hefes. This beer was smooth, fruity, and completely refreshing. Not a "big" beer by any means, but very good for its style.

Lovely hazed and dirty brown sugared banana colored with a white glacial oil lining the top. Aroma is just about perfect. Sweet cream, lactic sourness, buttery bananas on grahams getting soggier by the second. Sweet, aromatic vanilla almond wholesomeness abounds in the nose. Full flavored treat greets us with vanilla tootsie rolls plucked out of a sea of lemongrass roots. Distinctive grass stains hang on the end of each sip. Sweet cream and banana butter are livened by cackled white pepper and sugar crunched cloves. Lively flare pricks up the tongue top and sides while a chewy sorghum oat mentality plays out. Lively and nearly concrete as its tossed and sloshed around the mouth. Margarine crust of sourdough and a hint of blanched rye give a slight bite to the herbaceous herbal hop edge in the finish.

Draft. Hazy orange-amber body - no head. Fruity wheat malt, orange rind aroma. Similar flaovr (fruity wheat, orange rind) ut with the addition of bubblegum sweetness. Good mouthfeel - substantial w/o being unrefreshingly thick. A well-done, tasty weiss.

Sampled last night at the MAH as the Session Ale. This beer is VERY much a non-filtered beer. It was an opaque yellow. VERY thick looking. Nice white head. The aroma was lemongrass, banana, light bubblegum, lemon. The flavor is wheaty, banana, lemon, buttery, sweet. This was pretty good for a wheat. The palate is pretty thick and rich. Given this was opaque, it had tons of wheat and/or yeast remnants...

Sample at the brewpub. Opaque extremely bright yellow, thick head. Typical �nana nose, more subtle than most. Bit salty on the tongue, and somewhat berry-charged. Meaty; fairly hoppy and light, bit pils-like at the end, little yeast. Seems atypical to me, but interesting and quite drinkable.
A hazy light bodied weiss with recognizable banana notes and a soft smokey character in the finish. Clove is absent, but not missed. Bready and banana aftertaste lingers.

Cloudy limoncello body with creamy, perfect head, Feint coriander flitting in the nostrils and whisperings of wheat. Mild wheaty body, under-bodied even for a wit. Ok, but rather bland and underwhelming.

Draft at the brewpub. Pours a hazed gold with a dense white head. Aroma is lemon, spice, bubblegum, light toastiness. This is pretty light and spritzy on the palate. Tastes a little toasty, with more bubblegum and citrus notes, finishing with some coriander spiciness. Nothing special, but a solid little wit with no obvious flaws.

Name: Washington Wheat Date: September 07, 2009 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub Appearance: opaque yellow, fine white head, bits of lace Aroma: light sweet orange aroma, touch of spicyness Flavor: light wheat flavor, orange sweetness, spicy bitterness Overall: light and refreshing Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 13/20 Rating: 2.9/5.0 Drinkability: 8/10 Score: **+ /4
Hazy yellow with no head. The aroma has light coriander notes. Very light bodied wheat with hints of orange and corriander, a touch of wheat and a light citrus finish.

Taster � Skagit River Brewery � Mt. Vernon, WA Good color, clarity with good wheat aroma. The beer had some good flavors of wheat with the grapefruit and dried fruit flavors. This beer was light and refreshing as well and finished quite well.

On draught at the brewpub in Mt Vernon, Washington. Pours a clear golden pale amber brew with a creamy white head that has some nice retention and spotty lacing. Aroma has a light tropical fruit scent, golden grain malt with wheat, and some grassy hops. Taste is light to medium bodied, with additional tropical fruit flavors of mango, light pineapple, wheat malt and grassy hops. Finish is semi-sweet with a lingering mango and wheat aftertaste.
On tap at the brewpub in Mt. Vernon, WA--Poured a mildly hazy yellow pale body with a small white head. Wheaten earthy nose. Clean, sessionable, uneventful.

Draft at the brewpub. Ever so slightly hazy pale yellow body. Very little film and no lace. Nutty, toasty nose...with no shortage of diacetyl to boot. Light, slightly fizzy body. Bitter toast and stale butter mid-palate. Dry leaf finish.
on tap-pours a white head and cloudy yellow color. Aroma is faint wheat. Taste is crisp, funky wheat, secondary grassy hops.
(Draught) Sampled at the Great Canadian Beer Festival 2007 in Victoria on September 7th, 2007. Candied bananas. Poor ass shit.

column4: Malt Shovel Brewery (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: OLD NOTES JUL 7, 2004 Finally found it. Pours rusty amber colour with a little white head. The aroma is quite weak, mainly nutty malt flavours and a bit of alcohol present. Quite a roasted flavour; dark chocolate, nut, caramel, stone fruits and a fair bit of alcohol. A different beer at different temperatures really. Very different from the others in the James Squire range, much more of a sipper and one for the winter, but has the quality you expect from other beers in the range from MSB.

column4: Malt Shovel Brewery (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: Bootle- I�m just updating my beer tasting records- a very nice beer. a good version of english strong ale.

column4: Malt Shovel Brewery (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: Copper coloured body with a ruby tint and a thin off-white head. Aroma of caramel, malt, toffee, raisins and odd must. Medium-bodied; Sharp pungent maltiness with no sugars at all, fading fast to a musty & earthy finish. Aftertaste bitter, but remarkably clean! Overall, odd - hardly any character for what I�d normally expect, but great to try! Thanks so much to Phil (haddon90) for this one on his return trip down under. I sampled this 33 cL bottle purchased from a bottle shop in Leura (Sydney), New South Wales, Australia on 02-August-2005.

column4: Malt Shovel Brewery (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: Bottle at Chris_O bottlefest 2007. Amber colour with thin beige head. Grapefruity aroma. Sticky toffee in mouth. Not that great to be honest. Fine if unsubtle.

column4: Malt Shovel Brewery (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: A Mes rate: 345ml bottle (strange size) at Chris O�s extravaganza. Wheat, liquorice and malt in the aroma and a definite aged character to it. Dark blonde colour with only a slight white head. Flavour is similar to the nose, again with the aged feel but this time with some hops to add balance. Great creamy palate which again suggests some age. Interesting but not outstanding.

column4: Malt Shovel Brewery (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: Bottled at Chris_O Fest March 2007. A copper coloured beer. The aroma suggests a certain amount of age. Some buttery notes also. The taste is nice and hoppy with a good malt balance. Good alcohol flavours also. Nice but I wonder if it could be better younger.

column4: Malt Shovel Brewery (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: Got a 6pack for $10 as it was best before 5 months ago, bargain. Reddy brown colours with a light frothy head. Yeasty, sweet vanilla and some fruity aromas. Very smooth for what it is.

column4: Malt Shovel Brewery (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: An orange beer with a beige head. The aroma is quite sweet and malty, and the flavor is also sweet malty with a touch of metal from the alcohol.

column4: Malt Shovel Brewery (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: A deep rich amber color that looks and smells bloody brilliant in a sweet honey-malty kind of way, nice head too. Smells very fruity, and has a slight toffee kind of taste to it. I dont know if this would be considered an aggresive taste, but it kind of hits you hard. Though perhaps that is from teh high alcohol content (6.8%). Prefered the Porter from these guys, but Id buy again when Im in the mood for a drink that really registers.

column4: Malt Shovel Brewery (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: 34,5 cl bottle. Amber colour with a weak head. Light aroma of caramel and also flavour of caramel, toffee and hints of hops.

slightly hazy pale blond colour with little foam, very discreet hoppy nose, medium-bodied, sweet with lot of carbonation, light acidity, long and moderately dry malty finish - a good body with a poor aroma
Blond color. Nice hop and honey aroma. Smooth; dry in the front, but still with a residual sweetness. Palate just above the average, again with a honey touch, not too long.

This is a backlog rating from�2011 on draft at the source, from�notes.�When I had this beer it was average to below average for the style and not something I wanted to have again or I just didn't get back to my notes because of my technology at the time. Words to describe this beer are pale and sweet malts, light earthy, doesn't drink like an IPA.
Keg @ Dragonmead. Amber pour with a small head. Mellow caramel malt. A touch of brioche. Sugared biscuit. Earthy hop character. Drinks fairly well balanced. Slightly chewy. Soft carb.

Sampled from the tap at the brewery. Pours a clear gold with a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has grass and light earthy pine with some grains backing. Flavor has grass and grains with a bit of bread backing.
Very weak aroma for an IPA, somewhat floral. Everything else was generally OK, nothing stands out. This is probably Dragonmead�s weakest IPA. Barely an IPA.

This was our waiter�s favorite so he gave us a good "sample" of it. Subtle for an IPA, so if you like a hoppy flavor without being overwhelmed by hops, this is the IPA for you. With that said, an IPA that is not very hoppy isn�t much of an IPA. Not bad, though.

On tap at the brewery. Pours a clear orange with a white head. Aroma of citrus, sweaty hops, and buttery popcorn. Flavor is rather sugary with sweet malt and some citrus and diacetyl, caramel malt. Meh, weak palate and pretty bland for an IPA. 6/4/6/3/12 [3.1/5]

On tap at the Dragonmead Brew Pub. Poured a medium amber color with a smaller sized white head. Aromas of floral hops and citrus. Tastes of the same floralness with citrus. Lighter sweetness with a lighter to medium bitter finish.

2008 MiBGF: Golden hue with a small head. The aroma has notes of grassy and herbal hops with a biscuity vapour. The taste is twangy and bitter, nicely balanced with the malt, Slightly hop spiced towards the finish. The mouth feel is lively and refreshing. Not too shabby, would like to see on a hand pull real ale.

On tap at Reno�s West, Lansing. Pretty standard offering, similar to several of Dragonmead�s other hoppy beers, but with less malt emphasis, instead focusing on the grassy, medicinal hops. Light-bodied and smooth.

Draft at Ashleys. Poured clear copper color with an average frothy white head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Moderate sour citrus aroma. Medium body with a slick texture and soft carbonation. Medium sweet bitter flavor with a medium balanced bitter finish of long duration.

column1: Camo Silver Ice High Gravity Lager
column5: It smells like a homeless person, honestly it does. The taste is very strong but after you start sipping you ge get used to the taste. 40oz 3 bucks drop like 20 and you have a goodnight.

column1: Camo Silver Ice High Gravity Lager
column5: 24 ounce can into lager glass, no can dating. 0170 1459 can code. Pours slightly hazy/cloudy medium golden yellow color with a 1 finger dense/creamy head with great retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of lemon, cracker, corn, white bread dough, and lightly toasted biscuit; with lighter notes of wood, pepper, and herbal/floral/grassy earthiness. A bit too fruity corn aromas, but not overwhelming. Okay aromas with pale malt/corn and light-moderate earthy hop notes; with solid strength. Taste of lemon, cracker, corn, white bread dough, and lightly toasted biscuit; with lighter notes of wood, pepper, and herbal/floral/grassy earthiness. Light-moderate herbal, woody, floral, grassy, spicy bitterness on the finish. Lingering notes of lemon, cracker, corn, white bread dough, lightly toasted biscuit, wood, pepper, and herbal/floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Nice robustness and balance of pale malt/corn and light-moderate earthy hop flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance, and no cloying/astringent flavors after the finish. Nicely clean lager flavors; not overly fruity/yeasty. Light-moderate increasing dryness from lingering bitterness and spicy alcohol. Medium carbonation and medium-plus body; with a creamy/bready/grainy, and fairly crisp/sticky mouthfeel that is good. A tad rough, but smooth to sip on. Mild increasing warmth of 10.6%, with minimal lingering booze after the finish. Overall this is a solid high gravity malt liquor. All around good robustness and balance of pale malt/corn and light-moderate earthy hop flavors; smooth, easy, and fairly crisp to sip on slowly with the mellowly bitter/spicy/drying finish. Nicely clean/rich pils malt/grain showcase, with nice earthy hop presence/balance for the style. Not overwhelming on adjuncts. Not quite the jet fuel I expected, it is quite drinkable. A fairly enjoyable offering for what it was.

column1: Camo Silver Ice High Gravity Lager
column5: Okay, so I was in the Navy and I can DRINK. That being said, after I got out, the bars every night just aren�t an option anymore. Enter the Camo Silver Ice 40oz at 10.6 percent. This isn�t a staple where I�m from (Atlanta) but having moved to the Pacific Northwest it�s available at the closest corner store for a full 3.00 dollars with tax. As for how to drink this, I�ll tell you straight up I�m not sure if I�ve ever swigged this poison. That being said, if you own a funnel, want to get buzzed

column1: Camo Silver Ice High Gravity Lager
column5: Aroma - very old watered down sherry vinegar, cork, and spiced hops. Appearance - body is pale yellow, clean, and ok nucleation. The head starts at 2" and disappears very quickly. Taste - sweet malt with flavors that come off as apple, rice, other fruits cardboard. Some very old sherry vinegar that has sat in the back of the cabinet for years, and now has a greatly reduced, but unpleasant taste. There is some spiced hops. Palate - on the lighter side, carbonation is average, the finish is alcohol and has a nasal cavity passage burn similar to old vinegar.

column1: Camo Silver Ice High Gravity Lager
column5: Meh!...The first of the month is always a rough week...Car payment, Mortage, and a few misc bills are always due right off the damn bat. (Living the dream!!)..Anywho...The smell alone gives me those "i have the flu chills" I think im going to hang by the toilet for a few hours" feeling...The taste is of the handfull of change I used to buy this with in your mouth..yet after a few sips (for me anyway) it goes away...When its the first of the month pay week, my couch, the cupholder in my car, are defiantly alot cleaner...Itll kick your damn face in if your not careful, but at $1.09 a can...sometimes you have to take one for the team, especially if you had a shitty day ...I have one in my fridge right now ...I tell myself to down it and get some work done in the garage..but each time its the same hesitant, 5 min stare down ending with me shutting the fridge and walking away....should i do it? ...(no balls!)..whats that you say? No balls? ...im gonna do it.....

column1: Camo Silver Ice High Gravity Lager
column5: 40oz bottle, in my dining room, just now. This looks like a perfectly nice beer... enjoyable golden color, big fluffy white head... lots of lacing on the glass. The aroma of sweet corn absolutely wafts from my glass. Gettin� the nose in there really brings out some of the alcohol, some grain, and a little bit of fruitiness. The flavor is surpassingly less rough than the aroma. Yes, there is a considerable alcohol hotness but it doesn�t come off as horribly rough. It�s lightly metallic and has a good grape character. There is a lot of sweetness happening here. It�s corny... but not as corny as the aroma would have had me believe. It�s a pretty passable high-gravity malt... but I don�t know if I�ll be taking down the whole 40.

column1: Camo Silver Ice High Gravity Lager
column5: 40 oz. bottle. Pours a medium, short lived head, over a fizzy yellow (SRM 3) body......nose is raw egg white, apple, sugar, corn, alcohol, no esters.....taste is sweet, with corn, candy, apple, pear, hints of grape bubblegum,no hops or malts, no esters....mouth feel, light body, high alcohol burn, fizzy carbonation. this is a high alcohol sugar bomb. with minimal input from the usual beer, malts and hops, ingredients. The purpose of the yeast is to contribute alcohol and perhaps carbonation, but most assuredly no esters, phenols or other characteristics of a beer. It is not infected. BJCP 3/2/3/3/5

column1: Camo Silver Ice High Gravity Lager
column5: Smell of apples, corn, hay, strawberries, alcohol, malt. Taste is same, smooth but also alcohol. You don�t taste the alcohol as much as I feared, but it is there and does burn. Strong fusel influence, kinda tastes old and there was sediment on the bottom so my guess was mine had been sitting a while. Be careful to drink this slowly, as it�s like drinking two normal beers. I drank a 40 = bad idea

column1: Camo Silver Ice High Gravity Lager
column5: Maybe the worst malt liquor I have ever tasted. I was only able to drink a thimbles amount. Never again.

column1: Camo Silver Ice High Gravity Lager
column5: 24oz can. Ouch. Cidery sweet, pale tan orange. Awful sweet, I wish this was just a bad cider, but oh so much worse as a beer.

Bright mahogany red/brown color. Rich creamy tan head. Interesting brown bread aroma with hints of orange peel and chocolate. Bittersweet roasted malt flavor with a lightly bitter aftertaste. Nice fruity overtones make for an interesting brew.
Reddish-brown, diminishing light tan head. Medium to light-bodied. Malty. Lots of caramel and fruit. Smells fruity. Very little bitterness or other hop flavor.

Apart from their great oud bruin beers, Clarysse also produced this pale lager, taken over by Leroy when Clarysse stopped brewing in 2002. A gentle, genuine lager with pure pale malts, no disturbing corn or metal flavours, relatively rich and full taste at least for its style, with a nice floral hoppiness in the end. One of those old-fashioned regional �pilsbieren� which slightly transcend the big industrial average. Not sure if this is still made, though.
One of the best Belgian pilseners. Golden coloured. Nice hoppy and spicy aroma with notes of caraway seeds. Refreshing.
One of the better Belgian pilseners. Very hoppy and bitter..................
Art of Beer Festival 2004: Has an amber color and a small white head. Smell is sweet. Taste is of sweet malts and finishes slightly bitter. Overall a pretty good bock.

Pours golden brown. My notes are a little hazy (as was I at this point of the fest). This is a solid, mostly true to style bock, malty with a dry finish. Didn�t quite hold up to some bigger bodied American bock cousins, but good nonetheless.

Pour is a medium amber, with small white head, small bits of lace cling to the glass. Aroma is sweet, malty, and mild hops in the background. Flavor is sweet to start (honey, caramel), middle had a bit of tanginess to it (reminded me somewhat of banana, but with a slightly off flavor to them), ends with some hoppiness. Medium-full body, drinks very easy for the 7.4%.

Sat on this for a long time and opened it for new year�s among some friends during a great bottle share. 2009 ~ Holding up very well. If cellared correctly it�s a prime example of the style and what a bit of age can do for it. Huge pillowy white head with a mildly funky nose. Taste was lemon, wheat and light tartness that lingered. Much more flavor than expected. One of those bottles where I wish I had access to more.
Bottle at Damico�s. Pours cloudy pale yellow,with some head that lingers, nose is slight white vinous funk with citric acid, first sip is similar finish is mild tartness.
barnyard, earthy, skunky, resin, golden, hazy, frothy, medium sweetness, heavily sour, average carbonation, creamy, bitter,

Hazy pale yellow. Rather lame and lime-like aroma with mild yeast and acidity. Watery but still quite refreshing mild taste without anything really popping. Dry semi tart ending with too clean yeast notes and too mild, unfresh acidity struggling too make an impression but never really getting there..

Bottle number 4 of 150 (2009 batch) along side 2011 batch generously shared by Maltzilla at the pre-Huny tasting. Clear pale yellow pour. Sour aromas. Both were tart and sour with lots of layers. I think the consensus was the nose was better on the �11 vintage, but the �09 tasted better.

Tried the 2009 and 2011 next to each other. The 09 had a strange rotten vegetable aroma but the flavor was clean and overall the beer was still a winner as those aromatics were missing in the mouth. The latest batch was clean, tart, and refreshing. Quite good.

Bottle shared at Jasons. Poured a hazy yellow with a small white head. Aromas are wheat and lemon, with a bit of barnyard funk. Taste is lemon and orange citrus zest upfront, with some earthy minerality and a bready finish. Decent carbonation and nice palate cleanser. Berliner Bier schmeckt gut.
Bottle 44. Looks like unclear urine, no head. Smells like urine after eating asperagus. Bit dusty also. Tastes sour, fruity, fresh - but with a weird after taste. Light body.

Bomber poured a clear gold with a small lasting white head. Aromas of graininess, yeast, straw and light citrus. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry lightly tart finish. Flavors of graininess, yeast, lemon and light straw with a crisp dry lightly tart finish.
bottle shared at 5k tasting - Hazy, yellow white. Aroma is bretty, barnyard funk with a bit of bile. Taste is light and fruity, with a punchy sourness. Tart and tasty with an oaky finish.

2001: Hazy dark amber. Sticky, patchy white tiny bubbled foam. Sherry accented aroma, honey, dried peaches, candied yam, alcohol-soaked bread, pumpkin, caramel, leather, spicy alcohol, toasted coconut, fruitcake, soil, white grape, and pineapple. Underlying metallic shades, phenols, earthy hops, dates, and melon seed. Gentle velvety carbonation. Semi chewy body. Insanely rich dose of candy sugar up front. Trailing flavors of candied yam, mild toffee, vague acidity, dates, toasted coconut, brown sugar, and a decadent, honeyed, raw maris otterlike base. Finishes richly malty, medicinal, cakey, and sugary with a light leathery, citric coarseness and subtle assorted dried tropical fruit backdrop. To call this rich and complex would be an understatement. The candy sugar elements were borderline offensive, and blanketed most of the subtleties. However, the mild acidity kept it from becoming cloying. Still, a satisfying dessert sipper fit for two, with that lovely signature Southampton bottle-conditioned feel.

column4: Microbrasserie Saint Arnould (Coop Brassicole des Laurentides)
column5: Tap at the brewery. Amber with a small white head. Aroma is malt. Medium body, soft carbonation. Taste is malt and alcohol.

Cask, Kings Head, Leicester. Golden amber with a lacy foam. Aromas are oranges and brown sugar with apple and leafy hops. Woody and yeasty with herbal notes and hints of toffee. Flavours are leafy herbal notes with sweet brown sugar and toffee. Spicy and floral with a peppery, liquorice finish. Apple with dusty yeast and a fruity bitter finish. Pretty goid.

Hand-pulled pint into a UK sleeve on 26 Apr 2013 in my local Wetherspoons. Dark amber, leaning towards mahogany in colour, clear with an un-even head of off-white scummy bubbles for a head. The aroma sends out a hop message, the taste however is malty: a bitter hop finish rounds off the flavours nicely, even if it is at odds with the rest on the drink. This is more complex than it appears and is different and almost strange in its make-up. I�ve had it before and don�t remember the mood swings in the taste, difficult to dislike, but I didn�t really enjoy it either.
Cask at the Cherry Tree, Catthorpe - 16/05/12. Clear amber, thin white head. Mild hop aroma - pretty boring. Fruit taste, dull malt flavour, medium bodied and generally zzzzz boring.
A Mes rate: Cask at the Old Market Tavern. Very bland very citric bitter. Slight malt just about adds balance but there really is nothing else to shout about.

(Cask at Market Porter, Borough, London, 30 July) Colour is amber with a short frothy head. Nose is malty with dark, dried fruit (prunes, dried apricots). Taste is malty and nutty with dried fruit (prunes, raisins), initially sweet but turns drier in a mildly hoppy finish. Well balanced and fairly ok.

Cask @ Market Porter, Borough, London. Rating #800. Pours a clear amber colour with small white head. Malty aroma with some hints of caramel. Malty fruity flavor with some hints of apples. Malty fruity aftertaste.

A dark amber brown beer with a very weak white head. A sweet biscuity malt nose, slightly yeasty, with hints of tropical fruits. The taste is dry biscuity malt, followed by a sweet tropical fruit flavour, again there is some yeastiness in the background. The finish is slightly cloying. (Cask - The Fox & Hounds, Heacham, Norfolk).

Cask Handpump at The Wellington, Birmingham. Copper, short foamy head. Malty scent, with some bitter hops. Hoppy in the mouth, but not as bitter as I had hoped. Slight fruitiness of oranges. Thick and creamy on the palate.
Cask@The Trafalgar, Greenwich. Lots of overipe estery fruit, with some lactic acidity. Not sure if the beer is meant to be like this or they didn�t look after it properly, somethings not right here.
Cask @ Trafalgar (Greenwich): Very fruity, harsh apricot. A little citric but unfortuantely not in good condition. Amber with a white head. Simple bitter, which I�m sure can be better.

Cask @ Charlie�s Bar, Copenhagen. Hazy reddish golden colour with a small white head. Slightly fruity aroma with some hints of citrus and some hints of hoppiness. Fruity hoppy flavor with some hints of citrus. Long fruity hoppy aftertaste.

A dark, reddish, copper coloured beer with a thickish white head. A light, malty nose to begin with, then a touch of citrus fruit comes through. The taste is bitter and dry, but malty, along with a slightly zesty citrus fruit flavour in the finish. (Cask - The Fox & Hounds, Heacham, Norfolk).
Cask Handpump at the Borough Arms, Crewe 09/06/2005 Golden amber colour slightly dry and wheaty. Some bitterness in a malt finish.
(On tap) Amber coloured, almost clear, no head. Fruity, floral nose from the hops. Rather light body. Lots of fruity flavours with a short, dry finish. 250605

[Cask at Charlie�s Bar, Copenhagen] A hazy amber beer with a huge orange head. The aroma is sweet with hints of coriander combined with some oranges. The flavor is dry with notes of honey and caramel, combined with notes spices - especially coriander, leading to a dry bitter hoppy end.
Cask. Copper colour, small white head. Very nice hop aroma, fresh and citrusy. Flavour is also nicely hopped, again with some citrus. Moldy aftertaste. Very nice pint.

[Cask conditoned at Charlies Bar, Copenhagen] Amber coloured. Fruity and hoppy aroma and flavour. Still a little bit less hops than in your regular Crouch Vale bitter. It is still very smooth and nice with some bitterness in the finish.

Amber colour - not red as claimed. I didn�t pick up too much in the aroma, but that may be because I had a heavy cold. Fairly malty for a Crouch Vale beer, although there is a moderate hop presence in there too. Dry and fresh, clean and crisp. Not the most assertive of Crouch Vale beers, but good enough. Cask (gravity dispense), Reading Beer Festival 2005.
Cask@Reading BF. Orange/brown. A little bit cereally and nutty, slightly biscuity or something aswell. Some citric hop tang in the finish. Nice dry, medium bitter finish. Quite a nice best bitter.

Hand pulled at the Wellington, Birmingham. Amber beer, hoppy smell, small cream head. Starts out with a nice tangy malt freshness, with a margin of hops. Gets smoother and less dramatic, as it warms, and ends up being an Ok Bitter.

The beer itself isn�t particularly remarkable - watery and pungent but far from the worst I�ve ever had. The most noteworthy aspect of this pilsener is the incredibly loud colors and rather disturbing art on the can. I walked right past a cop drinking this on the street and he didn�t even give me a second look as nobody would presume that the contents of such a ridiculous looking container could be alcoholic.

Fantastic! Finally a beer I can enjoy in the finest of company! The company of Gentlemen, that is! Hear Ye Hear Ye! Nothing says "kicks" better than a billiard table, my closest and most private gentleman friends and a case of beer that tastes so awful you�ll forget how bad it smells. If the stench doesn�t kill you, the retina-burning sky blue/pastel yellow color scheme will induce an eplieptic seizure. The Private Mens Club approves!!! "By the hair on my lip, a fine pilsner!" -R.Finnius Blackinton III

Private Men�s Club, or PMC, is a very cheap NY beer with excellent can art of an 1800s men�s club. and a blue can.
