It is nearly odorless and flavourless - The flavor that it does have, mixed with the fizzy artificial carbination, is akin to pool water, but still more drinkable and less offensive than some other extremely cheap beers - PMC doesn�t have a metalic can taste as far as I could tell, nor does the alcohol flavor cut through the beer, defects that truely deserve a sub-2 rating.

I also got cans of this stuff at a Kmart. This was flavorless and watery. It had a hint of sort of unidentifiable grain (corn?). Completely flat beer that had an "infused" taste of the aluminum can it was in; metallic and wierd tasting. I only bought it because it looked funny and tasted just as I expected... bad. Don�t waste your money on this.

If I could find a can of Matt Brewing's Utica Club beer, I imagine it would be a bit like this. This comes in blue cans that suffer from the worst artwork imaginable. You can buy this at KMart now, FYI. Despite the 3" head when I poured it, this beer isn't all that fizzy and it's ever so slightly sweet. Totally devoid of flavor, this is your great-grandfather's beer circa 1920 (OK, that was during Prohibition, but you get the idea). Tastes of corn, not surprisingly.

Light brown and clear. Medium carbonation with watery notes throughout. Hardly any sweetness to speak of. Bit of a nuttiness to it. Smoky and bitter at times. Couldn't find any of the Red Ale qualities I look for in a Red Ale.
Clear, deep amber. Big and richly sweet; sort of candy-like and sugary. Some fruity notes surface here and there, along with some alcoholic notes.

Draught. Dark amber. Aroma is moderately malty (toasted light bread, caramel), lightly hoppy (flowers), with a note of peach. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter, lightly acidic. Finish is moderately acidic, lightly bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. I wouldn't call this a bock by any stretch, it's more of an American interpretation of a maerzen/Oktoberfest, but it's not bad either way.
on tap-pours a ? head and black color with red tint. Aroma is dark malt-roasty/molasses. Taste is dark malt-coffee/roasty/molasses, secondary dark fruit, hops. Not my style.

On tap at the Cheshire Cat Brew Pub. Poured a dark brown color with red edges and a small sized off white head. Aromas of roast and light chocolate. Tastes of chocolate, roast, light vanilla, and a little smokey. Thinner for a stout.

On cask @ Cheshire Cat poured a opaque black with a lasting creamy brown head. Aromas of roasted malt, bitter chocolate and a hint of coffee. Palate was medium bodied, creamy and smooth. Flavors of roasted malt, bakers chocolate,and a hint of coffee with a smooth, bitter finish.
17-Dec-05 draft at the brewery... ...Roasty, coffee aromas... ....Black, no head... ...Roasty flavors, some grainy bitterness... ...smooth, but watery... ...light and drinkable, decent, not great
Dark black with a creamy brown head. Roasty with a big smoky note. Medium bitterness seems to balance it out somewhat. One of the better Cheshires I've had.

Odd color -- hint of haze within a light brown shade. Lively carbonation. Some watery notes. Sweet malts were dryish and bread-like. Only a hint of bitterness. Not enough sweetness or roast by any means.

column1: Big Horn Big Daddys Bourbon Brown Ale
column5: This beer pours a deep brown with a thin off white head. The aromas are sewerage, really! really not appealing on the nose. the flavor is not good; its like the beer was infected by bacteria but not like a sour, its not good. It�s got a sticky mouthfeel and lively carbonation with a slight dryness. not a good beer at all. Cheers!

column1: Big Horn Big Daddys Bourbon Brown Ale
column5: Draught No head, dark brown indeed. Very obvious whisky - sorry, Bourbon - nose; vinous and liqueurish; dark malts also, but strictly nothing else. Quite sweet taste, only strengthened by the alcohol. Alcohol, fortified, pungent, near adstringent MF. Unidimensional, even after the barrel aging, this is essentialy an uninteresting beer.

column1: Big Horn Big Daddys Bourbon Brown Ale
column5: (Draught) Poured a dark brown with a medium large-bubbled head. Very unique taste with similarities to Samuel Smith beers. Had a hint of vanilla, oak, and bourboun.

column1: Big Horn Big Daddys Bourbon Brown Ale
column5: Pretty damn tasty. Incredibly creamy and luscious, a dark and rich brown ale. Lots of different tastes coming out in this one, from cinnamon, to vanilla. Nicely complex and balanced, what I like to call a double brown ale. Extremely tasty and unique!

column1: Big Horn Big Daddys Bourbon Brown Ale
column5: At the Indiana MBG Fest: Brewed in Indy, a GABF winner in 2001 for cask conditioned. This beer is different from the others such that it is aged in Woodford Reserve cask for 2 months, is about 6% ABV, and is named Big Bad Bourbon Brown Ale (gotta love the name!) The brewmaster is John Handley who now works in Colorado. On to the rating: Very dark brown with a nice oily rim, good clear "tears". The aroma was beautiful, very bourbon and vinous. Hints of roasted malts, cherry, prune, oak wood, leather and vanilla. Wonderful sweet and tart taste, complex. Earthy yet has a fresh hoppy characteristic for an aged ale. The brew is full-bodied with a oily and chewy mouthfeel. I may be the only person at RateBeer to get to enjoy this version of Indy's Big Horn aged brown since the new brewmaster, Dave, has no plans to attempt this again. All you Indiana members don't know what you missed. Oh by the way, this is my #500 rating! Roll Out The Barrel!!

column1: Big Horn Big Daddys Bourbon Brown Ale
column5: Interesting brew. The bartender told me it was aged in barrels that contained Jack Daniels. I can taste the Jack. Underneath the bourbon flavor is a somewhat malty brown ale that somehow manages not to be cloying. I was expecting this to be too sweet but it was rather well-balanced and was an interesting combination of flavors. Gets points for being unique.

column1: Big Horn Big Daddys Bourbon Brown Ale
column5: Finally, a worthy brew from this brewpub (Dallas.) Muted bourbon aroma. Light rootbeer brown. Good bourbon barrel flavor on top of a tart, chocolatey brown ale. Tartish finish. Session-style mouthfeel. My favorite beer from this brewer so far, but I suspect that it gave me a pounding headache, like bourbon does.

Quite a interesting brew, very complex things going on here. Poured a hazy dark amber with little head. Aroma was of basement, vinegar, vinous, and plums. Tastes of leather, smoke, plums, and grapes. The taste was a nice surprise, since I really didn�t detect the leather and smoke in the smell. Had a light dry body with low carbonation and some tartness near the end.

One I would have really enjoyed to have fresh and on tap. Great smelling hazy copper, capped off with a light head. Sour plums, wheat, leather and sweet raisins enticed the nose. There was a surprising smokiness in the flavour as well as some white wine, caramel, cinnamon and light tartness. Low carbonation and a thin body here, this brew would have been rated higher had it had a little more chew and zazz.
From tap at the brewpub. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is toasted malty and caramelish. Light bitter. Fruity, sweet and light caramelish. Bitter and medium dry finish.

Draught at Il Bovaro, Florence. Murky amber with medium tanned head. Syrupy caramel on the nose and not really anything else. The flavour is caramel syrup - tastes kinda like an alcoholic caramel milkshape. Bizarre. Syrupy mouthfeel. Boozy and ultra sweet cloying finish. Terrible beer.
Dark brown color. Thin palate. Some caramel and a little red meat. I wish I had more to say, but really, there was not much effort here.
On tap at the brewpub. Cloudy copper with a rich yellowish head. fruity aroma. Good toffee and fruit flavours. Body is on the light side. decent.

Cloudy chestnut coloured. Thin white head. Quite soapy in the nose, fruity and slightly tart. Not the cleanest lines I suspect and it would not be very surprising from this brewpub. Fruity orientations take strawberry and blueberry inclinations. Limited complexity, feeling kinda synthetic and aromatised outside brewing. Besides, a waxiness overpowers the darker malt profile. Insufficient carbonation also enhances the sweetness while the body is thin and dead. Soapiness remains strong throughout and with the body�s frailty, the dish water association is quickly made.
Doppio Malto Red color. Strong fudge aroma. Caramel and fudge taste. Ordinary palate.
Hazy blond color. Nice spicy aroma. Weaker body, with some good but light malt taste, also here the infusion has been a bit too long.

Sampled on draft at the Pratt St Ale House this beer poured a dark golden color with a medium sized creamy white head that left decent lacing. The aroma was dryish and a bit grainy. The flavor was bitter, grainy, grassy and a bit herbal. Medium length finish. Medium body. Meh.

Pours a half finger of head on a hazy light straw body. The aroma is mild honey. The taste is honey with a mild bite of bitterness, lemon zest and pine. Good bitter profile. The texture is crisp with moderate carbonation. It�s a good bitter blonde.
Draft. hazy yellow color, medium white head. Aroma of grassy lemon. Taste has citrus, white pepper, straw. Not bad.
Pours a straw yellow. Foamy head. Very light. Somewhat watery. Not much flavor. At at their tap room.
Draft. Pours gold with a white head. Grainy malts, light sweetness, and faint floral bitterness. Not bad.
With Tim. On tap at Pratt Street Ale House. Light, smooth feel, malty taste. Nothing too exciting.

Tap. Pours clear yellow with average, creamy white head; good retention and spare lacing. Aroma is straw malt, grassy hops, floral notes, lemon, oranges, and faint funk. Flavor is light, grainy malts forward with light fruit esters and faint hops towards the finish; dry finish. Light body and medium carbonation.

On tap at Pratt. Pours a clear gold with a medium sized white head. Soft citrus and lemon on the nose, dusty. Medium bodied, sweet citrus, lemony, grainy, sweet toast. Dusty hops. Easy drinking, light and tasty.

Tap. Pours clear gold with a medium, fizzy white head, short retention with light lacing. Aroma is hay and straw malt with light fruity hops and earthy hops. Flavor is malt dominant with light hops and medium bitterness with a dry finish. Light body and warmth with medium carbonation.
A decent beer but not to much flavor, very basic and what you would expect from a blonde ale

1 liter swingtop. I think this came from slob. Pours amber with no discernable head to speak of. Touches of white bubbles on the surface, but that�s about it. Smells very citrussy and of dry malt (more of an over the top tripel). Tastes sweet with lots of spicey characteristics and some earthiness on this finish. An interesting take on this style. Alcohol is at the forefront of this beer unfortunately, but the flavors underneath have blended together nicely in this one.

1 liter bottle, from my cellar. It�s aged for 4 years now. Sealed with black wax. Poured out a clear amber color,with a minimal head. More a ring of fine bubbles around the rim of the glass than a real head. Aromas are of citrus peel, yeasty bread, clover honey. Flavors are of citrus peel, some fruitiness, and plenty of alcohol. Hops are long gone on this beer. No hop aromas or much in the way of flavors either. More of a mead at this point than a beer. Thick mouthfeel, thinned by excessive alcohol. Burning in the throat, yet smooth on the tongue. This beast still needs some more age on it.

A pretty pale gold with a small slightly off white head. Overwelmingly sweet. You can taste the alcohol, but it is burried under the syrup that covers up all the other flavors. Not bad, but I had to stop at one. And not because of the alcohol content.

A limited release in July 2004, that still needs time to develop. Right now, it�s a one trick pony: sweet. From the nose to the palate and on through to the finish, the sweetness just totally dominated. Small head accompanied the hazy, orange appearance. I spilled some on my fingers and sugar crystals welded them to the glass. Will they give us another chance in a couple of years?

Deep hazy gold, lasting off white head. Nose on this rocket fuel is all about the sweets with belgian candi sugar, orange blossom honey, and sweet doughy caramel malt. Thank god I have a sweet tooth! :-) Blast of sweet alcohol gets combined with fuzzy fruit and flowers in the flavors. Full bodied, syrupy, soft sweet candi sugar finish. Still needs cellar time, but great stuff none the less!
Peachy gold. Sweet and spicy nose. Huge fruity blast at first taste, but gets a syrupy character that gets a mite cloying.

Same bottle as argo0 and egajdzis. Hazy golden amber color. Small off-white head. Very sweet and spicy aroma. Alcohol is quite noticeable. Flavor is sweet and flowery. Too many unfermented sugars, but it has potential. Needs more aging, IMO. Body is syrupy and coats the palate.

Sampled from the same bottle as argo... Poured a hazy golden color with a white head and nice lacing. Sweet aroma of candy and alcohol. And overall the taste included sugar, with some alcohol burn on the tongue.
(8 mos. old) Small white head atop clear hazy body. Aroma is very sweet (candy sugar, honey), peach, flowery. Taste is painfully honey sweet, with fairly strong alcohol. Full body.

Thick white head. Yeasty aroma. Nice lacing. Flavor is sweet and full. Candy sugar sweetness is just about out of control. Sugar overdose imminent! Alcohol flavor on finish but not overpowering considering the ABV.

I saw this on tap at my resort in Jamaica next to the Real Rock Lager, so I figured I should try it. The beer was fairly similar in colour to Real Rock, but with a slightly more pale hue. The smell was also a little more subtle, but pretty fragrant for a 'light' beer. The taste was also pretty good for a light, but a little less strong than the normal Real Rock. A good example of a light beer, and a pretty good example of a lager in general! I found this at my resort in Montego Bay, Jamaica -- the Wyndham Rose Hall.

Pours clearish amber with a minimal ivory head. Aroma presents strong sweet fruity, honey and fresh malt notes. Flavor features honey, tropical, pomme, stone fruit and fresh malt - yet it could just about pass for a mead. Texture yields OK body and perky fizz. Will blow you away.

Tap, Mani, Ann Arbor, MI. Deep gold, slight haze. Balanced aroma, sweet honey with banana. Syrupy first sip. Mellow with sweet banana and passion fruit. Slightly too sweet on the finish but still nice.

Draft pour. The beer is a clear amber aith a thin head that dissipates quickly. Strong oaky character with a bit of burning alcohol and toffee. Big sweetness. A little boozy. The strength of the alcohol is a bit much for me.
Bottle shared, thanks Gregg. Rich sweet caramel character with a candy edge, fairly boozy. Slightly disappointing one, may have been aged past its prime.

Thanks to Greg for sharing the bottle! Aged for about 3+ years. Poured into a taster showing ruby amber with a finger of tanned foam. The nose shows a caramel forwardness with light hints of raw meat (?). The palate is light bodied and lightly carbonated. Belgian yeast forward with a strong tea like sweetness.

Bottle shared at Ratebeer Tokyo W & CB Tasting. Thanks Gregg P! Honey, caramel malts, toffee and rum raisin bread on the nose with some light cinnamon and booziness present. Body is thin and sweet, but still nice enough.
Light brown color. Lots of plum and bread nose. Big malty very drinkable. Fallen off a bit.

750mL bottle, pours a clear amber with a small beige head. Aroma is authentic, with Belgian yeast, caramel, dark fruits and candied sugar. Flavour brings out spiced Belgian yeast, candied sugar and caramel. Not overly complex, with a spicy, sweet finish. Not bad.
Bottle - Caramel and spice with some umame. Clear caramel with no head. Caramel, light booze, sweet honey and stone fruity yeast. Not as interesting as I hoped.

750 ml bottle into chalice, 2014 vintage bottling. Pours fairly crystal clear orange/copper color with a thin off white head with poor retention, that reduces to a thin ring of lace. Minimal lacing on the glass, with a light amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big raisin, plum, pear, apple, light banana, clove, caramel, toast, toffee, biscuit, candi sugar, herbal, and yeast/toasted earthiness. Very nice aromas with good balance and complexity of fruity/spicy yeast and dark/bready malt notes; with good strength. Taste of big raisin, plum, pear, apple, light banana, clove, caramel, toast, toffee, biscuit, candi sugar, herbal, and yeast/toasted earthiness. Good amount of earthy yeast spice on the finish; with lingering notes of raisin, plum, pear, apple, light banana, clove, caramel, toast, toffee, biscuit, candi sugar, herbal, and yeast/toasted earthiness on the finish for a while. Damn nice complexity and balance of fruity/spicy yeast and dark/bready malt sweetness; with a great malt/yeast flavor balance and zero cloying sweetness after the finish. Light-medium carbonation and medium-full bodied; with a very smooth, fairly slick, and lightly crisp mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a light warming present after the finish. Overall this is an excellent quadrupel style! All around great complexity and balance of fruity/spicy yeast and dark/bready malt sweetness; and very smooth to sip on for the big ABV. A very enjoyable offering.
33cl bottle. A clear orange brown beer with a big off-white head. aroma of caramelish malt, red fruits, nuts, dry berries. Taste of dry caramelish mild oxidized fruits, raisins, berries.
Nice Belgium beer which we used as a session beer whilst over there. Hoppy with a nice thick white head
From Bottle. No description. Rating only. Transferred from an earlier rating.
Tastes relatively boozy for the abv. But it also has a lot of flavour for the abv. Tasty, complex belgian style blonde. Crystal clear. online saveur bier
Thin creamy head. Malty, maybe a bit soapy aroma. Sweetish, malty flavor with some late flowery hoppiness. Some orange fruitiness. Clean palate. One of the better helles I've had.

Clear golden body with a big foamy stable white head. Aroma is mild herbal, bready and hearty. Taste is crispy, herbal, hearty again. Mild grassy finish. Medium body, average carbonation, watery texture.
500ml on tap at the brew pub Grasmannsdorf. Aroma is light cloves, light orange peel. Appearance is cloudy yellow with a thick white foam. Taste is light bitter. Just slightly dry. Watery. Ok.
Chiara dorata limpida buona schiuma delicata nota erbacea buona secchezza discreto amaro un filo erbaceo citrico

In der Flasche, aus dem Getr�nkemarkt Frankenland Burgebrach. Ein gutes Pils f�r meinen fr�nkischen Gaumen, nicht zu herb und leicht trinkbar. Insgesamt sehr diplomatisch ohne besondere Aufmerksamkeit zu erregen, k�nnte ein bisschen mehr Charakter vertragen.
Bottle at Zapfhahn in Bamberg - clear golden color, white head. rather a bohemian pils. medium sweetness, grainy. okay.

spruce, citrus, herbs, clear, hazy, cloudy, rocky head, frothy, minimal head, white foam, pale, pale, golden, amber, orange, light sweetness, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium bitterness, lightly sour, medium sourness,
Aroma had malty and breadish notes. Over the palate came malt, bread, grains and floral hops. Finished dy and light bitter.
Goldgelb, stabile schmale Schaumkrone. Malzig getreidiger K�rper, weich im Trunk. Feingehopft.

Flasche (50 cl) vom REWE Burgebrach. - Goldgelb, klar. - Nase ein wenig dicklich (f�r ein Pilsener) hellmalzig mit etwas unsch�nen Hopfenextrakt-Noten. - Antrunk fein hellmalzig und leicht s��lich (Wei�brot) mit eleganter grasiger Herbe, die das Malz geschickt kontrapunktiert. Etwas milder rezent, sehr saftig. Im Abgang nicht besonders kr�ftige aber elegante, hintergr�ndige Hopfenherbe. Trocken-herber Ausklang, dem man den Hopfenextrakt fast nicht mehr anmerkt. - Sehr sch�nes, leckeres Pils s�ddeutsch-fr�nkischer Machart, rund und elegant.
Got this on sale at lobo and it was ok for the price. Didn�t have the great taste I expected from a German beer.

500ml on tap at the brew pub, Grasmannsdorf. Aroma is fresh cut gras, light oats, light malt. Appearance is medium cloudy orange with a fine white foam. Taste is light bitter and light sweet. Slightly dry. A bit watery but nice.
Pours a hazy yellow color, still, small foamy white head. Aroma is banana, wheat, clove. Body is light, soft carbonation, slightly foamy.

Draught @ Brauerei Kaiser, Grasmannsdorf 9, Grasmannsdorf, Bavaria Germany 96138. Hazy - murky medium golden yellow orange colour with a average to large, creamy to frothy, good lacing, mostly to fully lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is light to moderate malty, wheat, moderate to heavy yeasty, fruity, banana, pineapple, yeast. Flavour is moderate to light light heavy sweet and light light acidic with a average to long duration, yeasty, pineapple, fruity, yeasty. Body is medium, texture is creamy, carbonation is soft. [20130511]

Bottled@One Pint Pub, Helsinki (old backlog). Mediumsized white head on a hazy goldeny orange coloured body. Aroma is sweet wheat, mild citrus, yeast and mild herbal notes. Flavour is wheat, citrus, mild toffee and some slight yeasty, earthy and herbal notes. Wellbalanced.
Bottled 0.5L at OPP. Slightly bananey nose. Hazy golden colour. Pale head.Taste with some hints of banana and yeast. Not too sweet. Mild hoppiness. Quite nice.
Recht herber Antrunk, leicht hefig, bedingt spritzig. Etwas muffig, wenig hopfig, deutlich s�uerlich. Joah... 11/7/7/8//7

It�s unclear, warm golden with a huge, creamy head. The aroma has notes yeast, banana, light butterscotch, light citrus and peach. The flavour is sweet with notes of banana, yeast, clove, light fruit and the finish is dry and spicy.

Cloudy vibrant tan. Thick head. The aroma is spicy, even a little hoppy. Quite fruity and sweet-n-sour. Some footy yeast late. Leaning towards dryness. Good example, with a nice bit of fruity complexity.

Draft @ brewpub. Bright orange, hazy, with lots of white lacing. Fruity orange aroma is not too estery or sweet and has distinct wheat character. Clean palate is a bit granular. The flavors feature wheat malt in a very nice way. Although the body is thin and light it has good flavors.
Draught at the brewpub. Distinct banana aroma. Cloudy orange colour. Stable white head. The flavour has some banana as well, and a little citrus. A standard weissbier.

Cask at The Cross Keys, Byard Lane, Nottingham. Golden yellow and clear. Decent creamy head with good lacing effect. Aroma wasn�t noticeable. There is a sweet, citrus quality to it - especially in the first few mouthfuls - but as it wears on the very long, very bitter finish stamps all over it. Velvety smooth texture. Overall, good but a little too bitter for my tastes to get a massive score.
Cask. Aroma of hops and malt merge nicely, golden, pours a small white head with lace. Flavour is sweet malt, hops are shy. Light bodied, balanced. O.K.
Cask conditioned at harbury beer Fest �09. Pale gold with white head. Thinnish malty and slightly sweet beer, hints of hop with some citric notes. Bready on the close, drinkable enough though.

Cask, Nottingham Fest 08. Straw coloured with a small head. Aromas are resinous lemon with clean hops. Slightly dusty. Flavours are citrus with low minimal malts. Dry, peppery and hoppy on the finish. OK.
Cask at Fellows Morton & Clayton, Nottingham. This pale beer has some pleasant citrus and floral hop characteristics, but it�s too watery and the flavours are not full enough.

Cask conditioned - handpump - Fellows, Morton & Clayton - Nottingham. A pale gold coloured beer with a thick white head and lacing. The aroma has citrus hops through the head although that sparkler problem has returned. The taste also has light citrus notes. A too creamy texture but drinkable enough.Score 3.0 Subsequent rating also scored 3.0.

Frothy, rocky white head tops the hazy golden body. Herbal, minty and fresh bouquet with wild flowers and bulky malts. That�s well integrated! Fresh angel cake, cream and straw notions punctuate the casual breadiness. Well crafter ale with plenty of flavours gotten from basic ingredients and at an easily sessionable strength.

Cask gravity at The George, Bethersden, Summer BF 2006. Gold coloured beer with disappearing white head. Slightly hay/hop on aroma. Bit of lemon/lime citrus. Nice enough in mouth, astringent hoppy, tingly finish. Nice golden summer beer.

Cask at Fellowes Morton Clayton, Nottingham.Cloudy pour clears to a pale gold body, nice creamy white head. Served fairly cold, when it warmed through a bit there was a hint of watery fruit to the aroma, certainly refreshing on a warm summer lunchtime, good smack of hoppiness with slighty spicy fruit in the long bitter finish.

Bottle conditioned. Gold colour with faint haze, good thin head and moderate condition. Mix of hops and eggs in the nose, good hop flavour in the mouth, slightly fruity with a hint of nuts and a dry, hop bitter finish laced with yeast.
On tap at Ray's (Kent, OH). Light, somewhat watery body. I thought I was getting some berry notes from this as well as the lemon. Went well with food on a humid day.

this had some kind of taste i could not put a finger on - but i did put my lips on the mug it was served in. i hated it at first but i drink it now and then for a change. it's a nice lite summer drink for sitting outside and talking with your friends - about what else? beer, politics, and women.

Had this on draught at Cedar's Cafe in Youngstown. Nice deep yellow color but didn't notice much haziness. Nice spice flavors and some fruit (lemon? orange?). Seemed well-balanced to me and finished clean.

On draft at Ray's in Kent: Really nice deep golden color, hazy and unfiltered. Aroma is sweet and spicy. Tasted like they dumped a LOT of spices in this - the grainy palate didn't help much either. Some citrus character as well as wheat tangyness. Finished very dry. The spices were just overdone.

column1: Brasserie Artisanale de Fribourg Pale Ale 1047
column5: Handbottled. Golden coloured. Hazy. Light beige dense head. Sweet, grainy, light fruity and flowery aroma. Flavour is sweet, light spiced, has some fruits and is a bit grapish. Medium bodied. Ends on a mild sweet note, with a light bitterness.

column1: Brasserie Artisanale de Fribourg Pale Ale 1047
column5: An orange beer with an off-white head. The aroma is sweet malty with light notes of caramel and dusty hops. The flavor is slightly acidic malty, but with a sweetness in the background, and with lots of fruit - especially apricot, but also quite strong notes of dusty hops, leading to a bitter hoppy end.

column1: Brasserie Artisanale de Fribourg Pale Ale 1047
column5: Bottled. Hazy orange coloured. Strange aroma of rubber. Strange and very unpleasant sharp flavour with loads of rubber. Light body.

column1: Brasserie Artisanale de Fribourg Pale Ale 1047
column5: Bottle. Cloudy orange colour with a nice little head. Yeasty aroma with notes of caramel and malt, but someway a strange flavour....

column1: Brasserie Artisanale de Fribourg Pale Ale 1047
column5: Bottle. Hazy orange colour with a small off-white head. Malty, light rotten fruits, spicy aroma and taste, light sour. Medium body with a dry finish. Strange !

column1: Brasserie Artisanale de Fribourg Pale Ale 1047
column5: (Bottle 33 cl) Pours a hazy amber with an off-white head. Odd, impure aroma. Medium body with earthy notes. Quite hoppy and dry. Impure and unusual but at least it tastes better than it smells. 060706

column1: Brasserie Artisanale de Fribourg Pale Ale 1047
column5: Bottle. Hazy golden coloured with a white head. Aroma of malts, citrus, spices and hops. Flavour of malts, citrus, spices and hops.

column1: Brasserie Artisanale de Fribourg Pale Ale 1047
column5: Draught Blond color. Big creamy head. Quite nice aroma. Good taste, midway to a top fermentation, some sweetness, some hop fruitness. Interesting. Earlier Rating: 7/4/2003 Total Score: 4 Keg Hazy golden color; creamy head. Very nice hop aroma, strong, floreal. Very good body, sweet, enough malty, light yeast. Hoppy final. A very good Swiss PA/IPA! Good luck.

column1: Brasserie Artisanale de Fribourg Pale Ale 1047
column5: Hazy amber colour. Chocolate, strawberry, melon, and pale malts in the nose - nice combination! A little astringent, perhaps minerally. Slightly grapefruity hops and hardly any malt. Such promise - what happened?

column1: Brasserie Artisanale de Fribourg Pale Ale 1047
column5: Bottled, thanks Bov! Hazy amber coour. Flowery hop aroma. Medium bodied, veryy hoppy with a lot of grapefruit. Lingering really bitter finish.

Bottle from S�bastien @ home - Color: clear golden blond beer with medium carbonation and very high foam. Smell: grassy and fruity beer. Notes of pineapple and lemon. Very nice nose, finish yeasty. Taste: nice fruity taste. You will definitely have the taste of elderberry. Pineapple finish. Aftertaste: elderberry, sweet finish. Nice idea and good realization, except the high head!
Golden colour, not much aroma on the nose. Taste is fairly thin, more like a light juice. Didn�t realise the flavour was meant to be elderflower, but picked it straight away. Very summery.
Sattes gelb mit sch�nem Schaum. Saubere frische florale und fruchtige Nase. S�sslich-fruchtige Textur, Holunder sauber pr�sent.Ausgewogen, angenehme Rezens. Ein sehr gef�lliges Bier.
golden beer, not a big heaf. smells of elderflowers and floral hops. elderflowertaste but a fruity hidden passionfruitlike hint too. bittersweet flral ending. refreshing

Bottled 30cl. Courtesy of azlondon. It pours a beer with a huge head. Elderflower, raspberry and aniseed in the nose which is very inviting. There is a nice bite to the taste. Pleasant astringency. Yeast accented- which fits this beer in my opinion. Dry finish which is reminiscent of raspberry, blackberry and elderflower. Delicious. A top notch fruit beer. Big thanks azlondon!
Appearance: Golden yellow, clear. Some white head. Aroma: Floral, citrus, hops. Taste: Fruit, very smooth. Some citrus, again floral. Info: 300ml bottle, 23/5-2009

Handbottled - courtesy of Ungstrup. Golden coloured. Unclear. Small off white head. Distinct elderflower aroma. Very sweet. Elderflowers in the flavour as well. Light sourness to counter the sweetness. Dry and refreshing. Is rather balanced, but a bit thin and watery. Ends on a dry acidic eldernote. Not
A hazy orange beer with a thin white head. The aroma is sweet and slightly acidic, while the flavor is of elderberries with a slight stint of acidity.

(Bottle 33 cl) Slightly hazy pilsener golden with a somewhat rough, white head. Tart, citrusy nose. Medium body, sweet�n�sour feel with distinct accents of elder flower - the typical earthy touches. No real bitterness. Thanks to fiulijn for this. 170406
Bottle. Hazy golden colour with a white head. Elderberry aroma and a sour fruity taste. Medium body with a sour finish.

Bottle (thanks CH-303). Pours dark amber-copper. Aroma is smoke, raisins, bacon, malt, caramel, salt. Flavor is sweet and bitter, raisins, fruits, smoke, bacon, malt. Carbonation is quite high, body is on the thinner side. Finish is dry and sweet. Overall: very good, love the Bamberg smoke, bit more body and less carbo, and this would be 4+ beer.
Can from trade with CH-303, many thanks. Dark amber color with small white head. Aroma of caramel, smoked malt. Taste, malt, smoke, some fruits. Light smoked beer, refreshing.

Bottle at a tasting. Quite balanced, tasty and very easy drinking. High carbonation, moderate body. Caramelly nutty fruity maltiness, very light complementary smokiness, only background hops bitterness and character.

Many thanks for this beer to CH-303. Piwo ma ladny wyglad spora kremowa i trwala piana, barwa ciemno miedziana sporo metnosci slodowy posmak przypalonych tostow, nieco wedzonej szynki i sporo powidel sliwkowych. Piwo przypominalo mi nieco Rauchbier z Bamberga ale zbyt intensywnie bylo slodowe, a wiecej tej wedzonej nuty bym wolal. Thanks for this smoked beer Asbjorn.

Bottle 30cl traded with CH-303 thanks. A cloudy amber brown beer with huge head. Nose is on dark chocolate, yeast and light smoked notes. Aroma is medium malty, kind of wheat touch, dark chocolate and subtle smokes notes, touch of red berries. Body is sweet, medium creamy, delicate dark chocolate finish, very pleasant smoked beer even if I like usually more stronger smoked notes, well done !

Sample out of 12 ounce bottle. Smell the malt. Amber in color and a little bit of white head. Taste the malt. Well balanced and easy to drink. Malt after taste and very smooth. Just an awesome beer. Cheers!
Brown reddish. Bready taste. Slight fast bitter. Refreshing, but watery. Doesn't live up to its name.

12 oz bottle Second beer of Christmas The amber ale poured almost clear dark amber color with a small head that quickly dissipated. The aroma of sweet caramel malts and hints of citrus. The centennial hops is a dual purpose hops, offering both bittering and floral aroma. The taste was of sweet caramel malts and floral hops. Easy to drink amber ale,which could use more hops for bittering.

12 oz bottle from VA. Pours with a hazy dark copper brown body topped with a weak beige head. This is a mild amber ale with some sweeteness up front and a mildly bitter finish in which some hops appear.
20 oz draft. Nice clear reddish brown ale poured with a thin off-white head. The malty aroma has notes of dark fruits and caramel. Very well balanced. Nice amber ale.
Malty, nutty. Caramel-like sweetness. Smooth and full with a barest hint of hops. Pretty standard for the style.
Pours hazy copper, thin tan head. Malty caramel aroma. Similar taste , hint of hops.
Poured from a tap into a tasting glass at the Oceana Beer Festival. attractive clear chestnut. Fruity aroma, tart, more carbonated than i like.
B-. Pours a clear deep amber color with white head. A little on the watery side

Tap. Pours clear copper, small beige head, decent lacing. Aroma is malty, caramel, toffee, bread, hints of lemon. Flavor is light plus sweet, minimal bitterness, a bit nutty, malty. Medium body, touch watery.

Sample on tap at the brewpub. Good thin white head, leaving good full lace. Totally hazy pale yellow color. Nice smooth lighter carbonation. Dry finish. Light tart sweetness. Solid banana aroma. Light spice. A totally fine enjoyable hefe.

On tap at the brewpub in July 2009. Pours a cloudy yellow color with a slight white head and not too much lacing. Nose brings some fairly strong clove and spice notes. A moderate amount of banana. The taste is some slight wheat as well as clove, banana, and hints of bubblegum. Moderate body with good carbonation. Was a nice, drinkable brew after a long summer day. Serving type: on-tap Reviewed on: 10-26-2010
Cloudy yellow with a white head. Citrus aroma. Flavor of banana and sour. Bit bland.
typical lemon yellow cloudy appearance with not much head but some lacing. Typical delicate fruit notes but quite smooth and not harsh at all.

Draft. Pours a hazy, dirty yellow with a creamy, off white head. Yeast, biscuit, and lemon in the nose. Medium low carbonation with a light mouthfeel. Citrus, yeast, a little dough, and a slight metallic note on the palate. Medium short finish with a lingering bitterness. Kind of watery. Left great lacing though.
Murky yellow with nice lacing. Aroma was sweet banana and citrus. Flavor was the same with a spicy pleasant finish.

On tap at South Street; poured a cloudy straw color with not much head by the time it got to me. Nose was a bit floral, with not as much banana and spice as I like. Flavor was just ok; not as pronounced as it could have been. Some banana, spice and fruit. Not a great example of the style, but not real bad either.

THOUGHTS: It was hard to truly rate this one because the server brought it out with a lemon in it. TECHNICAL: On tap at Sought Street Brewery. Was a medium brownish orange with a small head that mostly diminished leaving no lacing. The aroma was slight banana, then some wheat and yeast but sort of flat. The flavor was very slat banana wheat and a little citrus, but they didn�t seem to blend well together. No balance at all. The light body was very watery with soft carbonation and a dry finish.
On tap at the brewpub. Peach color with a decent sized head. Sweet yeast and MAJOR Bubble Yum aroma. Taste is more complex with notes of banana, pineapple, clove, citrus and yeast. Body is very thin.

On tap at the Capital Ale House VA Beer Festival on 07/03/2010 as South Street Hefe. Cloudy orange body with a small white head. Banana, light clove and wheat aroma. Dry banana and wheat flavor. Medium body with moderate carbonation. 5/2/5/3/11 - 2.6 On tap at the brewpub on 04/25/2009. Very murky orange body with a medium frothy off-white head. Big banana and light clove aroma. Sweet banana, clove and faint citrus flavor. Medium body with moderate carbonation. 5/2/6/3/11 - 2.7 10/28/2007: On tap at the brewpub. Hazy orange body with a medium frothy off-white head. Sweet clove and banana aroma with some light spice. Sweet banana flavor, some light clove and a touch of spice. 6/2/6/3/12 - 2.9

On tap at brewpub A standard pale ale, this draft at least offers some regional flair that makes it the best fallback on pint night. If sessionable hop driven beers tickle your fancy then grab one with dinner. Even if you don�t it makes a good benchmark for their better releases to help prepare the palate. Aroma / Appearance - A caramel bronze body glimmers below head that looks like fresh layers of frosting. Malt and wheat sweep to a woody impression that dissipates quickly. Flavor / Palate - The fluid body might be a little tame. Even so it generates interest with wave after wave of gentle hops and pine. It feels a bit like someone on the East Coast read about West Coast hop driven beer then tried to make a clone. Mostly it gets the job done without much fuss; you just won�t be trading anything special to get your taste.
on tap at the brewery; very mild citrusy hop aroma; bitter, grassy, citrusy hops on a very light malt base

Not bad. Pours brown/orange, brief and small head, no real lace. The aroma is bready, a little bit of pine. The flavor is malty, a little musty, the centennial hops are right there. There�s a slight slightly citrus aftertaste. Decent.
Draft at South Street. Clear golden yellow with off-white head. Aromas of floral, citrus, light pine. Tastes of citrus, floral, wheat. Medium-light body with a dry finish.
Keg @ South Street. Deep gold with a small head. Caramel and wood. Lemon peel. Taste is nicely vibrant. Some mineral. Pine cone. Light body, active carb.
Draft at the source. Clear golden color. Aroma of grain, light pine. Taste is very bitter pine resin, hay, straw.
Yeasty tea nose. Crystal clear amber, thin head but enduring. Tea and dried leaves, very little fruitiness. Medium body. APA or amber? If the lattr it�s a dwcent example. Not very hoppy.

(2012 US backlog, recollected in abstinent tranquility). Full pint drafts @source, C�ville VA 14/09/2012. Fresh and pleasant-for-sessioning brewpub APA, with a certain direct Cascade lustre on the nose, decently repeated in the flavour, and malts taking obvious second stage. Nothing spectacular, more than serviceable after strolling in the late VA sun.

A ho hum average pale ale, perhaps a tad below average, really. Poured the amber color with a white type head, good lacing. The aroma was citrus and caramel. Flavor followed, not nearly as bitter as I was hoping, residual sweetness present too? Grainy. Mouthfeel moderate in body and carbonation.

Aromas of citrus fruit and bread. Clear red, with quickly diminishing, white head. Lightly sweet, with some berry flavors, but well-balanced with the hops. Medium-full body, with average carbonation, and a long, bitter finish with some toast.

Draft. This Amber Ale poured a small tan head. There was decent lacing with this brew. It had a brown body color and a bitter taste was observed. The aroma was a malt aroma and this brew had a lingering aftertaste to it.

This brew poured a very small head (note was served this on draft so they probably tried to make the head small) of white bubbles and a a transparent brown body. It had a mild malt aroma. Its mouthfeel was slightly fizzy at the start then smoothed in the finish. It had a slight inital hop bite and a flavor of spices and malt.

It was an ok beer at best. Lafayette Beer League created a video on youtube about how we felt. We hope you like and subscribe for more Indiana Beer Reviews! Talking about Beer #17: Mad Anthony Brew Co "Summerdaze" https://youtu.be/AfqJL44tuLU
Hazy orang pour, thin white head. Not much of an aroma, some orange. Also not much of flavor. Pale malts, some fruit.

16 oz. can pours a pale golden color with medium white head that leaves good lacing. Aroma is of wheat and honey. Taste is slightly bitter and just a normal beer at first before the sweet honey kicks in. Has a short dry finis with more wheat bread in the afteraste. Body is light to medium with a crisp mouthfeel and lively carbonation. Easily drinkable with a couple pleasant surprises.

16oz can shared. Pours a hazy lighter orange color with white head and decent lacing. The aroma is wheat and s very mild fruit almost like an orange. It�s medium bodied mild to medium flavor of wheat. Light fruit notes again. Overall a decent offering from mad Anthony and easily drinkable.

Sample at the Ft. Wayne brewpub. Hazed pale golden color with a medium bright white head that dissipates steadily to a film. Small patches of lace. Aroma of wheat, malt and fruit. Light to medium body with flavors of herbal wheat, honey, malt and slight hops. The finish is fruity and wheaty. Slightly above average overall.
(draught) cloudy medium rich amber with sparse head. Nose and taste of clover, honey, cinnamon and spice, light wheat. Interesting.
Tap at Lake City. Sweet caramel malt, citrus aroma. Hazy Golden, off white head, nice lacing. Stale wheat and citrus flavor.

On tap at brewhouse. Pours a cloudy goldish yellow, with only a slight head. LIght citrus aroma, slight hop note. Taste is ripe citrus, some honey noted as well....very smooth finish. A nice summer seasonal.
On tap at the Warsaw location. Poured a medium and hazy golden color with a small sized head. Aromas of wheat with a trace of citrus. Tastes of the same.
Draft @ Mad Anthony Old State Ale House, Elkhart. Hazy yellow colour, white head. Aroma is citrus, lemonade, soft hoppy. Flavour is lemon, bit of candy, soft malty, a bit sweet.

Hazy golden body with a big foamy and persistent white head. Aroma is floreal and grassy. Taste is crispy and hoppy at the same time: camomile, mild honey notes, grassy hops. Grassy and floreal finish. Medium body, soft natural carbonation, oily texture.
Draught at the Bierkeller. Freash, bready malt aroma, nice hoppiness. Dry, medium bitterness.
14-06-19 // 500ml bottle from Getr�nkefeinkost Berlin. Lovely. Slight haty golden. Bready, grainy, sweetish malty, mild flowery and lemon zest. Smooth.
Very slightly hazy. Bright golden. Not a tonne of head. Aroma is banana bread. Taste is pretty bready with orange peel and lemon zest.

From Fass at Be.Re. Slightly hazy golden colour, pillowy white head. Aroma of crisp malts, hint of lemon sherbet, light floral, grassy. Flavour is crisp, malty, hay, lemon, grass, light floral, firm grassy bitter finish with a hint of lemon. Light bodied, smooth. Great stuff.

Tap at roppelt bietgarten. Ceramic mug so i can't see it but seems golden lightly hazed with a creamy white head. Taste is all about biscuit malts backed with lots of hay, cereals, bread, grass and a fruity note of peach, a bit if citrus in the aftertaste. Palate is incredibly smooth, with a nutty and caramelish leftover, taste quite sweet and malty. Very good in the style, appreciated and for a good reason.

5/8/2018. Bottle from Die Bierothek� W�rzburg. Hazy deep golden colour with an average sized just off-white head. Aroma of hops, malt, fruit, banana, caramel, straw and a hint of honey. Good level of sweetness, light bitterness. Medium body, oily texture, fine carbonation. Enjoyable.
On tap at Foersters Feine Biere, Berlin. Cloudy golden, white head. Malty, bready, grainy, sweetish, nice bitter finish. Yeasty. Light to medium bodied. Very nice.

Multiple Seidla at Roppeltkeller, Frankenkellertour 2018. - - Another incremental notch on the Franconian mystery scale of infinite lager sessionability: not the most aromatic nor rustic, but subtly malty (non-fruity bread dough), subtly earthy and healthily herbal-hopbitter Kellerbier with a subdued mineral streak. Just like Lieberth's and it appears as a trademark of Hallerndorf tastes, quenching and enlivening in its finishing herbal bitterness (grasses, meadow leaves, touch of green tea). - I prefer slightly darker, (cara-)maltier, more adventurous Kellerbiere, but it's hard to argue with 1,5Liters of Seidla perfection on a hot day.
Pretty solidly done for style. None of the butter infection that plagues some Kellers. Golden pour with decent head and lacing. Clean finish.
50cl bottle from the brewery. A hazy deep golden beer with a off-white head. Aroma of clove and phenolic esters. Taste of clove, esters and wheat malt. Nothing special.
Bottle @ Brewery, Uehlfeld. Pours Hazy Golden with a White head. Phenolic Sweet with a tart edge. Sweet Banana.

0,5l Flasche aus der Brauerei. Gelbes tr�bes Bier mit extrem viel hohem festem Schaum. Kr�ftige Hefe Note. Fast etwas Esther. Der Geschmack ist sehr w�rzig. Hefe, Citrus, Getreide. Markant und eigen. Gef�llt mir.
Tap. Spicy clove and vanilla aroma. Cloudy yellow, white cream. Medium full spicy dry body, good dry berries and grain,pleasant train.
Tap. Milky orange color with creamy white head. Aroma is mineralic, wheat, yeasty. Taste is mineralic, banana, sweet. Medium carbonation. Silky mouthfeel. Ok.

Draft @ Fr�nkisches Bierfest, N�rnberg. Pours a hazy golden pale orange color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity wheat malty spicy banana aroma. Fruity wheat malty banana and clove flavor. Has a fruity wheat malty spicy banana finish.

Many thanks to kevnic2008 for this bottle. Nice, smooth and fresh beginning. Not too sweet, nice clove, fresh, mild. Nice yeast, fresh. Mild-smooth, very great. The aftertaste is smooth, mild, yeasty, lots of clove, no banana, not much sweetness. Great!
Vollmundig hefig s�uerlicher Antrunk. Angenehme Fruchtigkeit, milde Herbe, konstante Hefigkeit. S�ffiges gelungenes Weizen. 11/11/12/10/7/11
Pours a cloudy yellow color with a big, frothy, white head. Aroma is clove and yeast mostly.

(bottle) Cloudy, orange-golden colour with a blond and bubbly foamy head. Banana- and slightly citrus-fruity aroma with moderately wheaty notes. Moderately sweet and delicately sour flavour, rather light bodied with a modest carbonation for a Hefeweizen. Mildly wheaty base with present fruity notes with citrus and banana; the latter getting even more intensive towards the sweet and slightly sour-fruity finish without much phenolic spices. Pleasantly inoffensive. 01.V.12
Tap at the Franconian Beerfest 2019. Buttery, creamy biscuity malt. Flavor is big diacetyl, sweet bready malts, rich, full body. Peppery hop finish is nice but the butter is way too much.

Tap. Hazy golden color with white head. Aroma is slight butter, cereal, moreish. Taste is cereal, light butter, sweetish chewiness. Oily, a bit chewy mouthfeel, natural carbonation. Buttery, but in a decent way!

500ml bottle from EU Local Swap 2/2019, thank you Beerhunter111. Pours lightly cloudy orange, some white foam on the top. Light biscuits in the nose, touch of grass. Tastes soft, mild carbonation, light bitterness there, grassy. Malty and bready in the middle. Overall smooth and superbly drinkable, fresh. I guess this just has to be drunk fresh, otherwise has potential of not being that great. Works well with food.
50cl swing top bottle. A minimal hazy deep golden beer with a white head. Aroma of dry mild fruity hops, straw. Taste of dry and moderate spicy hops, fruity toasted malt, hints of caramel. Good!
Summer Sunday @ Dolle. Hazy golden with a small white head. Malty aroma with herbal hops and strong diacetyl. Sweet malty flavour with diacetyl and off-notes. Herbal hoppy with a bitter finish.

Bottle @ Oberfranken Neuheiten, Summer Bottleshare Odense, Summer 2018. Pours hazy yellow with a creamy head. Like the beer on tap I had, this one is also full of diacetyl. Paperbag, butter and grains beneath. BB 12/10/18
Bottle. Pours golden with hazy hue with a white head. Aroma of strawberry diacetyl, grainy, yeasty - unpleasnt, fruity. Heavy filthy, strawberry, paper, grains and some citrus.

50cl B�gel MHD08/2018, from source, Frankenkellertour 2018. - - love the name, thoug in Uehlfeld stork city you'd expect the brewery logo not to be a swan and this beer to be called Klapperla. - - Soft, doughy hayyellow pour, natural head. Fresh marzipan bread and vanilla hay aroma, springtime pasture. Natural barley lemonade with rounded curves&edges, little barley "beer flavour" - a trait Innoticed in their Hopfenstoff as well. Very easy drinking, an allround lovely beer. - - What is wrong with RB people? - apart from Moravius and a few discerning Italian Frankenlovers, people have logged this gem of a light Kellerbier & their own ratings into passing oblivion. May be that batches vary and freshness is an issue, but tasting beers at the source and bottled, Prechtel's output seems legit and unique in their 4,2-4,5% lager range. - Of note: Prechtel still uses a #K�hlschiff and mechanic transmission belts.

Vom Fa� auf dem Voggendorfer Keller w�hrend eines pl�tzlichen Wolkenbruchs an Himmelfahrt. - Sahnig mild, niedrig gespundet, enorm s�ffig. Frisch toastiges Malz, kess orangenfruchtiger Hopfen, Honig, k�hle Kr�uternote. - Erstklassiges Kellerbier.

0,5l B�gelflasche direkt aus der Brauerei. Naturtr�bes dunkelgelbes Bier, cremiger flacher Schaum. Buttriger Duft. Antrunk etwas Honig, leicht metallisch. Dann herbe Noten. Bitterkr�uter und Hopfen im Abgang. D�rfte etwas mehr Tiefe haben. Es bleibt aber ein langer bitterer Abgang.
for a light beer, it�s not bad, but that�s like saying, for a D student, he�s not that bad. No horrible qualities, but the light here means just that...light on flavor, hops, and body."

Henry Weinhard�s, Blitz-Weinhard Brewing Company, Full Sail Contract Brew--Amber Light Ale-2003 12 oz. Bottle. 4.0% ABV? (3.75 / 5.0) Amber Ale--Light--Clear thin dark amber color. Mild creamy lacy head. Mild toasted floral Cascade hop front. Thin slightly tangy toasted dry sweet caramel mild fruit biscuit body. Clean mild hop end. Tasty ""Light"" Beer." Sampled 5/24/2003.

Bottle... tasted more like a Golden Ale to me, light hop character and very sweet, not very intricate, but I feel like it was trying to be. Just not quite the hardiness I look for in a beer. Decent for a cheap macro, but would rather skip this one.
Poured a nice medium amber color with a small head. Tasted of malts, caramels, and traces of citrus. Very light, faint flavor. Not much of a kick in this beer.
Pours a nice medium amber color. Aromas of caramel, malt, and a touch of hops. Flavor is smooth malt with a little bitter in the finish. Great beer for the price.

A good light amber beer,. Not much body but had some taste. They mised on some key areas like a roasted malt that could add to the flavor. I wish they could slow down and actually ferment longer than 3 days so they can get some added flavors .

Caught a 12-pk on sale at WinCo for 6.78. Not my favorite by anymeans, though I prefer it over Henry�s Private. Where did the porter and blackberry wheat go? Very white soapy head. Nice amber color. Drinks just fine for what it is. I�d only buy it for this price while wanting to cut calories. By far better than any BMC offering.
Well, hopefully I consumed less calories by drinking this. Very light in everyway... flavor, aroma, and just the overall presense are pretty limited.

Amber with hints of ruby. Large off white head and some lacing. Caramel, some malts and citrus hops in the nose. Citrus and peppery hops dominate the flavors. Malts back this up with mostly caramel. There is a slight sweetness to it, but not much. The palate is thin and a little touch of spice to it. The finish is of caramel and citrus.

Pellucid, bronze, creamy full bodied thick head with perfect formation that lasts and gives a little lacing. The aroma is lightly malty, a touch of caramelt and toffee with a faint hint of citrusy hops. The flavor is way off balanced though, it tastes a little off sweet like fresh wort with an aged off bitterness. Finishes acidicly with a light and metallic body. The taste and finish were the downfalls here, but the aroma was decent, just very faint.

19th July 2010 Hazy amber beer. Little white head. Light palate, a little crisp and a little dry. A trace of toffee malt on the nose. Soft toffee malt, a trace of pear and aniseed. Creamy dry malt. Nicely joined up, a deft little beer from Pitfield.
Bottle at ChrisO "I�m Trying to see the Stool" pre GBBF2010 tasting. Amber, haze, lsting beige head. Some kinda spice on aroma. Decent. Odd, but ok.

Bottle at ChrisO�s "Raise the Roof" tasting, 31st July 2010. Light brown with a bit of head. Strange spicy nose that I just can�t place, along with some heady paint notes. I didn�t like it and it was a let down after the Pure Gold.

Bottle 50cl. @ ChrisOs Pre-GBBF Shindig 2010. [ Raise The Roof Tasting ]. Unclear medium brown amber color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, fruity. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20100731]

Bottled@The Chriso rock the roof down pre-GBBF tasting. Hazy ambery colour with small white head. Aroma is fruits, wood, some mild herbs and caramel. Flavour is caramel malts, some mild chocolate, nuttyness as well as herbs. Pleasant.
bottle at chris o pre GBBF tasting ... light sweet malt ...copper brown ... sweet toffee malts ... light roast ... ok
Bottle. Reddish brown with a big, tan head. Good chocolate aroma, hints of roast. Chocolate flavours, rather sweet, a bit milky. Enjoyable and easy-going. A bit on the sweet side.
Brown hazy body with a gray off-white head. The aroma is spicy and vinous. Rather strange. The flavor is malty and hearthy, nutty. Bitter finish. Tanx Tjalve!

Bottle. Dark brown with a cream foam. Aromas are rich and fruity, malty with berries and a mellow floral character. Also has chocolate and spices. Flavours are soft malts with lots of chocolate and berries. Spices towards the finish with decent bitterness and a nice level of warming alcohol. A good malty beer.
Cloudy dark amber color. Soma malt aroma and caramel. Malty, good structure, a lot of caramel, strong caramel finish, very bitter.

Hazy dark amber body. Heavy, sweet flavor. Has figs, chocolate milk, and maple wood. More heavy on the fig sweetness than other Abt. styles (has the same woodiness as a Westy, just not as pronounced). Dry flavor overall. Light alcohol and dark bread in the weak aroma. Good mouthfeel for the style.

Glass at the brewpub. Bright amber, cloudy unfiltered, medium lasting head, lots of lovely floaties. Sticky, floral-honey nose; low to medium sweetness, just a bit spicy (ginger), a bit thin and lacking in character.
Hazy amber color, little head. A little fruity with spices in the aroma. Malt, grapefruit, and spices in the taste. Good but not quite there.

Dark golden color with a moderate dense off white head. Fruity aroma with a touch of yeast and spiciness. Light citrus, coriander, white pepper, peaches and mild phenols. Some mild yeast character. Seems to just miss.
Hazy copper with medium creamy beige head. Aroma is moderately sweet, orange and coriander. Taste is medium sweet, light orange, some coriander. Medium/light body.
This had a thick golden color, with a sweet spicy scent and bubblegum flavor. Smooth. This is good stuff.
Nice floral aroma. Some spice. Medium brown body. Good flavors of bananas and cloves. This was a tasty brew.

Cask (gravity) at the Melton Mowbray CAMRA festival 2005. Been chasing this for sometime and it was worth the wait. Deep brown body, flavour like a subtle versionof those chocolate covered Scottish berries, sustained finish. Wish I could get this beer on a regular basis.

Bottle conditioned. Deep, dark chestnut colour, good off white head and good soft condition. Big chocolate powder aromas mingled with fruit notes. In the mouth the carbonation at first threatens to dominate but miraculously dissolves leaving chocolate flavours that seem to morph into coconut as it passes over your tongue and into the throat. Finish is fruity and long, with a roast barley dryness developing. At no point does the strength of the beer become apparent.

Tasted from can. Pours a hazy gold with thick white head. Citrus aroma. Moderately sweet with mild bitterness. Flavors of grains, hay, caramel, faint tropical fruit flavors. You think you'll be tasting an IPA and then get surprised by the low to no bitterness but very good for a blond ale. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500ml bottle, drinking this a few hours after Brewers Gold to compare. Clear pale golden colour with a small white head. Aroma: fruity, hoppy, malty, slightly odd apple cider like aroma. Taste: fruits, malts, citrus, herbal, initially sweet with quite a bitter finish for the style. Medium body and carbonation, smooth mouthfeel. Expected a more intense Brewers Gold, got something very different, not entirely sure this is how it was supposed to taste. First person to review this in 10 years so I suspect it may have changed a bit.

on cask at 3 judges, glasgow. golden with a faint haze and modest white head. promisingly prickly hop aroma, smooth texture, quite crisp with hints of ripe apple. slightly medicinal, minty character, pretty bitter, perhaps it wasn�t in optimum condition but still a good drop

Cask at the 3 judges in Glasgow. Minimal haze obstructs the light golden hue. Flowery and kinda perfumey, rather funky hops with a wild side. Not too grainy in maltiness, but slightly nondescript, letting most of the place to the hops. Fresh flavoured, bright and pretty aromatic. Limited minerals despite the light salty touch. Mellow melon undertones introduce the sandy, evolving bitterness. Tannic upon the finish that is bready and long-lasting. Good indeed, if not my favourite golden ale.

Cask at Black Door, Helsinki. Golden color. Sweet, malty and honeyish aroma with citrusy hops. Firm citrusy and herbal hop flavor with sturdy bitterness. Some raisiny notes. Tastes a bit like hops mixed water, this beer is probably not at its best.
Cask gravity at Jersey BF 2007. Golden with a very short head. Citrus/flowery bouquet. Not particularly bitter or sweet, slightly malty with lime at the back. Simple, refreshing, good.

Cask 3 Judges ... This took me by suprise as i wasnt that keen on the non extra variety... Light Gold ...Fruity hop nose ... light fruity the golden hop innot fond of but balanced well with some sweetness andsome fruity malt.

Cask at Three Judges, Glasgow. Golden colour. Great aroma here, with notes of citruses and grapes, yet on that low, pleasant level where it does not get overwhelming. Just plain subtle charm here. Flavour is greatly aromatic and delicate at the same time with a smooth, juicy hoppiness and superbly balanced. Low-medium bodied, with a soft bitterness that I find perfect.

Cask at Three Judges, Glasgow. Hazy golden. Rich grapefruity hop aroma. Medium sweet and full bodied with rounded mouthfeel. Seemless flavour of American perfumy lytchee-like hops. Really good beer, but I think I actually preferred the regular strength version.

(RBESG 2007, Cask at Three Judges, Glasgow) Pale golden, small white head. Fruity aroma, grapes, apples and some hops. Hoppy perfume flavor, grassy and with some metallic notes. Good beer, but I cant really see the hype...

650 ml bottle from Beer Store. Delicate pink colour? Uh no. Pours a cloudy toilet water ultra-pale yellow with no head. There may be some raspberry in the aroma but its mostly masked by a foul, sour vinegar smell. Taste is lifewise dominated by sour, acidic vinegar. A disaster.

Absurdly effervescent, ends up with a huge fizzy pink head on a red body. Smell is sickly sweet and almost rotten raspberries. Honey is missing in action here. Taste is worse, acidic and disgustingly sweet in equal measure. Thin and overcarbonated. Just bad all around.
Once again another gross mead by this company, but not quite as bad as the blueberry.

[492-20070810] Tap @ TFOB (Toronto, ON). Medium gasoline and alcohol aroma. Clear, bright red body with a medium-lasting foamy white head. Sweet burnt honey flavour is mostly a cloying raspberry seed base. Medium body. Offensive sweetness but interesting to try.

650 ml bottle. Pale pink colour, slight sparkling character as well. Nose shows light raspberry character over a hint of wildflower honey. A little bit floral as well, but the nose is quite simple and straightforward. Flavour is quite sweet showing honey and appley sweetness with a soft jammy raspberry flavour. Fairly dessert-wine like. There is a a hint of bitterness on the back that seems unusual given the ingredients. Not terribly complex, but it�s a servicable melomel.

Bottle: Don�t know whether I got a bottle of cleaning sludge from the fermenter or not. No red color to this...I got a cloudy, roily looking pale straw colored liquid with a instantly disappering cap. The "aroma" is more like a "reek" or stench: Strong fetid- musty(mildew) smells and thick fusel alcohol with vinigar-like sourness...I think I got some cleaning fluids from the fermentor! The taste was not mush different from the smell....astringet vinegar tastes with some artificial berry tastes, thick fusils and a nasty yeast taste. Sink- pour and the last anything I buy from this brewer. I think this drink can go the match with Steelback Tango as the most offensive malt beverage on the market.
Seemed like a raspberry cooler to me. I dont think I will drink this stuff again.

Bottle (250ml). Poured with no head, bright red / red-pink, lots of very fine bubbles which coat the glass. Aroma is very strong overripe raspberry, sugar, honey and a touch of vinegar - no alcohol at all. Taste is surprisingly like tart well-done toast, the raspberry�s more in the finish - slightly sour, lightly oily moutfeel. A bit bitter at the end. Still don�t taste the 9% alcohol. Not my thing - I�ve had real mead, which I quite liked.

650ml brown bottle. Poured blood red, eternally fizzing thin head. Raspberry nose. Shows brief signs of tartness, some fruit. Rather thin, over carbonation detracts a lot from this brew. Finish is acidy. Not my cup of mead.

It sorta reminds me of the Wildberry, only replace wildberries with raspberries obviously. Nice appearance here.....decent red body, with a foamy and short lived pink head. Aromas are vinegary, raspberries, sweet citric aromas. taste is citric, raspberries, some vinegar, sour fruit, all sorts of stuff I cant discern. It�s ok.
Yes it has that sweet honey meady taste, but the blueberry taste is absent. Slightly grapy. Overall it's pretty dull and alcohol-y. Not much carbonation. Cough medicine.

375 mL bottle purchase at the LCBO. Sealed with a cork which was near � impossible to open. Pours a dark cherry red with plenty of carbonation and no measurable head. The nose is off. On the palate there's a mix of flavored with nothing really discernible. There may be a hint of blueberry and there's definitely some residual honey. There is a fairly long finish which is neither pleasant nor unpleasant, it's just there. Not sure if this is typical of needs (which I have had very few) or if I really find this to be a poor product. Would not recommend, would not buy again. Note that this product is emblazoned with "Lanark County" but it's actually just brewed in Oakville. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, Embrun LCBO. Reddish brown pour, foamy white head. Odd sweet, red wine like aroma with fruit, not pleasant. Very sweet honey up front; the fruit comes in near the finish. Harsh alcohol burn. There is some flavour here, but what a harsh unrefined package. Not enjoyable at all.

375ml bottle. Clear reddish body, small beige head with poor retention. Aroma of grains and honey, a little floral, fermented bread. A winy taste: fermented bread, honey, tart berries, splenda, strongly alcoholic. Nasty stuff.

Bottle: Poured a light blue-ish color mead which is very still. Aroma of gross blueberry notes with overly sweet ester. Taste is absolutely atrocious with no balance and gross notes with blueberries barely standing out. I don�t� recall having tasted such a bad mead in my life. My buddy homebrewed mead is better than this crap.
Poured bright, dark red with a disappearing off white head. Aroma of sweet, tart berries. Medium body, flavour of the aroma, quite bitter sweet.

Originally rated April 2005. Pours a darker-then-medium red with a big fizzy head that reminds me off a soft drink, but stays a few seconds more. Lots of particules floating around. Fruity nose mixed with lots of alcohol. Thin mouthfeel and not much taste. Alcohol going to the head, that�s about it. Mild fruity berry aftertaste. Still waiting to find a good Trafalgar product. Average for now.
The grossest alcoholic beverage i have ever tasted. i could not even finish it which ia really bad for me
nose is nice does smell like blue berry, flavor is over carbonated, syruppy sweet, like they are making a mead cooler, i want to like it but just cant

Relatively light in taste and feel for a beer made with real juiced berries AND honey - I detect a little blueberry in the mix, which it is NOT a powerful flavor compliment to the base ale and so has to be accepted as part of the overall effect rather than a distinct feature. Said effect is a light, pleasantly drinkable vaguely fruity ale with a nondescript base ale character and far too much alcohol paying the price for the minimal entertainment. Quality to an extent, but a novelty.
A little bit of a sharp after taste but good flavor. Not too dark. Great for Ipa flavor.

Surprised to see this show up at the local distributor, only in 1/2 bbl kegs, I thought this beer had been retired but it is back with a heck of a hops wallop. Very aromatic hops, darker amber color and heavier in body than most IPA�s and seems to have that 8.8% alcohol at least. Give this one a try.

On tap at MacTarnahans Taproom in PDX (8.1% ABV) --Poured a copper-amber body with a small whitish head. Nose of piny, bitter, acidic hopiness. Grainy, metallic (slightly) and highly carbonated for the style. Bitterness and oily hops all over tongue. Not much bigger than the Thunderhead and similar flavor profile. Not well balanced, but definitely hoppy, and I like that in a beer.

A clear amber beer with a small off-white head. The aroma is sweet with notes of caramel and hops - though no overwhelming hop notes. The flavor is sweet and hoppy as well as grassy. A nice brew, but not as extreme as I had expected from the name.
Bottle. This stuff smells really hoppy. Has a nice opaque amber color with a slight lace head. Has a good flavor to it. Not too bitter but it bites you a little. Weak finish but overall a good beer

Draft. Reddish amber color with no head. Pine malt aroma - big hops. Pine tar and citrus (grapefruit) flavors. Some caramel. Nice full mouthfeel. Can just feel the alcohol. By far their best beer. If they could make this a regular, I�d be there more often.
(Great American Beer Festival 2004) Very fresh hop nose. Full and bitter Sweet and barley wine like. Average to good.
Hoppy aroma and taste- I�d guess it�s close to 100 IBU�s. But it does not hide it�s alcohol well.
I love this beer. So hoppy my mouth was in love. After a few pints do not drive home. Oh my goodness, I want some right now!

Heavy, VERY hoppy brew. Thick body, somewhere between a barley wine and an IPA. Alcoholy warmth after you've had a few sips. Head doesn't last very long unfortunately. Could be a little more malty for my taste. (this is a rotating beer that they make every few months at the local alehouses as part of their Brewer's Handle series.)
Well crafted set of aromas sadly the beer it self was not the freshest. Hoppy, earthy that kills its freshness.

Originally rated March 2006. Comes in a clear bottle. Pours a yellow colour with very high carbonation. The head is white, creamy-fizz, has medium retention and leaves a bit of lace. Aromas of alcohol and bad grass. Smooth mouthfeel. The taste is kind of weird with some corn in the finish. Some kind of cheap malt or hop, tasting like cabbage. Tastes much better dranked from the bottle.

Corn adjucts.. pale lager... rating it... beer... watery... sweet... yeah.... To spend a deep time imersing yourself in providing a useful rating for other to look at might be considered by some a waste of time. Look at the numbers and do the math.
looks like beer and taste like beer. not great but not bad. would only buy it again when they drop the price back down to 26.40.
Medium dark amber body with an average sized white head. Corn, grain, cereal, and skunk in the aroma. Slight bitter corn flavour. Thin, watery, and nothing draft or premium about it.
Swillfest �04: Malty, grassy aroma. Relatively sweet body, with a hint of sourness in the finish. Could be worse.
Aroma of sweet malt, weak hints of hop extract. Pale gold. Some nutty element, sweet brown sugars. This beer is too sweet to be refreshing.
Who knew that PC made beer! Discovered at a friend's place, it was golden, typical white head. This isn't a bad beer but is uninspired and a little bland - mostly from lack of any depth or character.
(Bottle) Pours a medium, white head and an amber body. Slight hops aroma. Sad hoopy taste and overcarbonated. Poor.
Gold in colour. This is just another typical bland, boring, waste of time beers made by Labatt's.
Not bad looking even if you forget that this is strong lager . Sweet and malty . Just average overall .
Medium thick head, mostly lasting, slightly opaque yellowy colour. Insignificant smell, good taste - slightly acidic, little bitterness, strong malt aftertaste. Quite good.
Slightly sweet, some meadow flowers, malt. Hops are well placed in structure but does have unusual yeasty feel
Wypite przed kilkoma laty, nie jest ju� produkowane� Ocena przepisana z notatek.

Very good strong lager from Grudziadz brewery! Big, foamy head, golden colour. Little aroma, but this beer has got a complex, herbal flavour with nice dry end and absolutely no traces of alcohol. Lilltle hops or malt, which is very unlikely for a Polish strong lager. Surprisingly good, especially in its class.
Sweet and malty . Offensive alcohol, one of the weaker members of euro strongs found in Poland..
Pours a clear straw from a tap. Crisp aroma is faint, wheaty. Flavor is faint and wheaty too. Meh.
Draft. Pale clear yellow color, medium white head. Aroma of straw and vegetables. Taste is bread and straw.

Tap at Rams Head Tavern in Annapolis MD. Clear good pour. Weak head. Nose is heavy diacetyl and small lemon. Taste is big diacetyl and DMS creamed corn. Palate is suddy and buttery playoff. Butter bomb.
This beer was only a slight step ahead of say a bud light but not to bad for a light beer.

Draft @ Ramshead Tavern & Fordham Brewing Co, Annapolis, MD. Pours a pale yellow color with a white head. Has a fruity grainy aroma. Sweetish fruity grainy slightly watery flavor. Fruity malty grainy finish.

Tap at Ramshead Tavern in Annapolis, MD. Pours clear gold with a spare, fizzy white head, short retention and no lacing. Aroma is medium malt (grain, straw), corn, spicy noble hops, and a clean character. Flavor is grainy malt, corn notes, lightly bitter hops, and a clean and dry finish. Light body and warmth, medium carbonation.
Sample @ Ramshead Tavern, Annapolis, MD Pours clear pale yellow with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, grain and hay. Taste is light sweet. Body is light, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.
On tap at Annapolis Brewpub. Pours clear golden with white head. Aroma and flavor was all sweet corn. Decent beer for the masses but does not do much for me.

On tap at Ram�s Head in Annapolis. Pours an extremely pale light yellow color with white head. Very little aroma, other than some faintly skunky citrus. Flavor has a touch of slightly chemical-cleaner like lemon. Inoffensive citrus peel finish.
Clear aple yellow, thin white head. Aroma of apple, pear, caramel, hay. Taste is like dirt and water and throw in some more hay.

Draught @ Brauerei Br�utigam, Dorfstra�e 12, Eltmann-Weisbrunn, Bavaria, Germany 97483. [ As Br�utigam Helles ]. Clear medium yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, grain, fruity, pale malt, sweet malt. Flavour is moderate sweet and light to moderate bitter with a long duration, sweet fruit malt, sweet malt, fruity, caramel notes, grass notes. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20140510] Earlier Rating: 6/8/2011 Total Score: 2.7 Bottle 500ml. @ home on the terrace. ABV: 4.9%. Clear light medium yellow colour with a large, frothy to creamy, good lacing, mostly to fully lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, grain, hay, cereal, toasted, light hoppy, grass, green gras, sour green grass. Flavour is moderate sweet and light to moderate bitter with a average to long duration, sweet malt, sour grass, big peas earthy. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20110604]
It�s golden with a white head, and the aroma has notes of hay, grain and malt. The flavour has al light sweetness and notes of hay, straw, malt, and it�s a bit boring.

Bottled 500ml (BBE 11/2011) Thanks bierkoning! Pale yellow color, small white head, lace. Strong herbal-grassy, vegetably aroma (green beans). Light bodied. Grassy-herbal hoppyness, sweetish maltyness but then boiled-vegetables which are off-flavors (DMS perhaps).

draft, as Helles. Light coppery gold with nice head. Aroma has slight diacetyl and caramel. Palate is light but the flavors linger. Has some nice toasty malts at the finish. That�s nice but is too caramelly for me, smells like a caramel candy. Good brewery tho.
As Lager Helles. Dull gold. Caramel and woodsy hop aroma. Good hop bitterness, lots of bread, caramelly malts. Good balance. Rich & warming.

draught at the brewery in weisbrunn. clear and effervescent yellow with a dense and foamy white head. meat-like nose of baloney (!) fat and pale malt. flavor is somewhat sour, hints at green cabbage and aspirin and stale bread. buttered bread finish, medium body, messy malt texture. not good.

Draft at brewpub: Yellow golden. Dying white head. Worty, unclean nose of nutty yeast, honeyed malt, and herbal hops. Prickly carbonation. Weighty body. Curious absence of hop flavor is overrun with a sharp and overaggressive hop charge. Dully hoppy with toasted malt husks. Intensely nutty, crunchy and cereal-like. Pistachio-like yeast character further weighs the body down as it exacerbates the poor attenuation and high honeyed-grain concentration. Again, no salvaging refined hop flavor to be found anywhere. Finishes doughy, muddled and abrasively hoppy with a late herbal snap. Bad batch, who knows? Very unclean and poorly attenuated.

Bottled@brewpub (thanks to SADESA for sharing). Golden colour, small white head. Aroma is diacetyl, malts and some herbs as well as hops. Flavour is grassyness, some bready malts, diacetyl. Even though the big amount of diacetyl, very pleasant and drinkable.

Draught at the brewpub: Presumably golden with a creamy-lacy head; solid herbal-hoppy nose; moderate to solid bitter-sweetish flavour, light bodied; slightly lingering bitter-strawy finish. Pretty good...........
Cask at the brewpub as Helles. Their bottles say 4.9%. Clear golden colour. Stable frothy white head. The flavour is nicely malty, distinct bitterness, slightly rough.
Dunkles gelb, im Geruch malzig getreidig , im Geschmack s�sslich malzig w�rzig getreidig, ganz in Ordnung

Many thanks for this beer to Mariusz. piwo wyglada ladnie w kuflu jest spora piana, puszysta i trwala, piwo o barwie bursztynu, klarowne. W smaku slod, nieco karmelowosci, wytrawna goryczka, zblizalo sie smakowo do amber ale. przyjemne, fajnie palone slody daly sie odczuc ale doslownie ciut, nie wiem czy takowe stosowano ale cos w tym kierunku czulem. goryczka pozostaje na podniebieniu.
A really good Kellerbier from Gutenstetten, near Neustadt an der Aisch. A gem of a Kellerbier, that tastes herby and fresh all in one.

500ml bottle. Barely clear, amber colour with average to huge, frothy, moderately lasting, minimally lacing, off-white head. Slightly doughy yeasty and bready, caramel malty aroma, a protein touch. Taste is minimally tart, bready, strawy and caramel malty, minimally doughy yeasty, minimally soapy hoppy, a touch of protein, some malt-spiciness, subtle sweetness, slightly bitter hoppy finish; soft carbonation, minimally watery. Quite complex like a good Zoigl, sadly a tad anaemic.
0,5 l Flasche gekauft in der Brauerei. Farbe: hellen bernstein. Aroma: Malzig, Getreidig. Leider keinerlei co2, wahrscheinlich Dichtung am B�gel defekt. Hopfen nicht wirklich warnehmbar.

Bottle bought @ Landbierparadies. Pours pretty much clear deep golden brown with a rather small frothy offwhite head that doesn�t leave much trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is malty and slightly floral with doughy dark bread, biscuits, sourdough crackers, hay, minerals and lemon peal. Taste is tiny sweet, bitter, slightly malty and floral. Mouthfeel is crisp, slightly dry, slightly astringent and light to medium bodied. Finish is bitter with dark bread, crispbread, sourdough crackers, hay, minerals and lemon peal. Pleasantly crisp and refreshing. Fairly dry with prominent floral bitterness. Enjoyable!
Clear amber color with an off-white head. Aroma is malty nad caramel. Flavor is medium sweet.
Getreidig bitterer Antrunk, wenig hopfig. Der Hopfen steigt dabei noch etwas, die Malzigkeit wird trocken. Starke Karbonisierung, insgesamt rund mit einigen Kanten. 8/8/8/9/8/9
Bottled, from Landbierparadies, Nuremberg. Lightly hazy golden, small head. Grassy nose. Dryish with medium body and firm, rounded mouthfeel. Grassy and fruity. Salty bitter finish. Well balanced.
Ins Glas ergie�t sich ein tr�bes dunkel orangegelbes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig herb, grasig. Geschmack herb, malzig, grasig.

Had on tap at the brewery in Austin. Light golden, almost see through pour with a thin white head, no lacing. Slight, industrial cleaner aoma, not pleasant. Flavor has a slight bit of honey sweetness but melds into something akin to glue. Not a pleasnt experience. Suffered through the whole pint.
"Smells like an outdoor urinal" says Jen. She may be right. Vegtable taste too and no bitter. Oily mouthfeel. Not good.
A style I despise: this is what they serve the guy who wants a Budweiser. Flavorless and unchallenging, almost to the point of their Copper Light beer.
Draft 1/3/05 (Brewery)-Pours orange with a small head. Aroma of caramel, sweetness, and malt. Taste of the same. This medium bodied brew is one of the better brews I�ve tasted today.

Tap. Well, SWEET...they finally brought this back so I can inch a little bit closer to 100% of Bitter End beers.
