Date: 04/23/2004 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub cloudy yellow, nice white head, banana wyeat aroma, soft body, nice light flavor with lots of banana character, touch of citrus -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Date: 07/07/2005 Score: ii+ to i astrengent clove, glad i�m just stealing a taste form ed�s glass -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Date: 11/01/2007 Score: i to ii hazy pale yellow, big white head, lots of thick lace, light aroma, light wheat based malt flavor, nice spicy character, hint of sweet citrus otherwise very dry, Aroma: 4/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 9/20 Rating: 2.4/5.0 Drinkability: 7/10 Score: **/4

On tap at the brewpub. Very light hazy golden coloring with a small white head. Very heavily citrus aroma. The flavor was dominated by lemon, but there was a good bit of malty mouthfeel here that kind of threw me off. I�ve had better and I�ve had worse.

Clear, lemon yellow body and a pillowy white head. Floral, lime coriander in the aroma with a hint of orange peel and light clove-like phenols. Phenols come through more prominently in the flavor and become a touch too plastic. Dry with moderate bitterness, but the impression is more orange peel than hops. A solid wit and refreshing summer beer.
keg at the brewery as renamed to aldahat amber... Copper.. Thin white lacing.. Soft sweet toffee fruit nose.. Light thin floral fruit.. wishy washy

I had it on tap at Bitting. It pours amber with almost no head and good lacing. The aroma is malt and caramel. The taste is heavy on caramel and malt with a hint of hops and bread. The mouth feel is pretty smooth. It�s a good amber.
Clear copper with no head. Aroma is mild malt. Taste is mellow malt and some grains. Pleasant enough.

3oz sample at the brew pub. Pours a clear amber color with a small foamy off white head. Aroma of sweet grain, toasted malt, and old citrus. Taste of rotted citrus fruit, grapefruit skins, soap, and toasted malt.

Tap. Pours clear amber with a medium, frothy light tan head, short retention with light lacing. Aroma is grain and cookie malt, pear fruity esters and a pine hop character. Flavor is moderate hops and bitterness with supporting malt and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.
Draft at the source. Hazy amber color. Aroma of light pepper and caramel. Taste is similar.

On tap at J. J. Bitting. Pours a clear tawny gold with a thin white head. Sweet malt, toast, caramel, light dusty hops. Medium bodied, light citrus and malt, earthy hops come through. A touch empty. Moves to a nice bitter finish with touches of earth and grapefruit.
Draft. Pours amber. Nose and taste of light fruit, malt and bitter hops. Dryish better finish. Medium body.
I would say that this was just your run-of-the-mill amber, but actually I liked this one more than average.
Draft. Pours golden amber with a white head. Light sweet malty aroma with a hint of hops. The flavor is well balanced, with sweet malts and floral and earthy hops. Pretty good.

Bottle: Oh yeah, I totally forgot about this beer, until I saw it here. Remember it tasted well, better than what the market usually sell. Nothing that superior, still nice but don�t need more. A bit watery and just a hint of hops, this is not close to being tops. Now it�s not available anymore, that�s what you get for a beer so mediocre�
An orange beer with a white head. The aroma is hoppy and the flavor sweet malty. Quite a boring beer from Hertog Jan - the best thing was the fine wrapping.

I can only say, don't judge a beer by the color of its skin!! Nice wrapping but a quite boring beer. Pours a clear golden body with a white head. Aroma is yeasty and malty with some woody dryness. Flavor is watery and thin, dry and somewhat citrusy.
This is a very boring beer in a very nice packaging. The 75cL bottle comes in a stylish black and golden bag. The beer is very thin and boring.

Golden colour. White, medium-sized, rocky head that leaves a nice lace. Perhaps it's the appearence of the bottle+folder but I believe this is quality... Nice malt and hop presence, long finish. Slight fruitiness (from the top-fermentation?).
Fresh hoppy and floral aroma. Pilsener looks, better head. Taste is floral and hoppy, some malts. Some bitterness. Fresh palate.

Just a hint of hops and caramel in the aroma. Caramelly flavor with a slight hoppiness and some malty sweetness. Hint of citrus. Subtle flavor, nothing really stands out. But the beer has enough to be worthwile tasting.
Clear golden color, short but lasting head. Hoppy, flowery aroma. Quite sweet taste. Easy to drink, refreshing palate.
Clear golden colour, average head, diminishing. Fresh aroma, bit hoppy. Flavour of the HJ pilsener and some additional belgian ale. Refreshing and very easy to drink, but not very special.
Light peach aroma. Golden color, white head, good lace. Light, refreshing, hoppy, light sweet, fruity. Like a combination of Hertog Jan pils and Hertog Jan Meibock. Light bitter finish.

September 9, 2017 - handpull cask - at The Rake (Borough Market). Clear, bright and refractive amber-gold with an attractive off-white lasting head. Tangy acidic/alpha bitter aroma - nice and malty; taste follows, definite fuggles character - just a solid straightforward bitter, nice to find one for a change - and at The Rake! Chewy, solid body, light carbonation, not too grainy or funky in the finish - I would have this again for sure.

Poured up at the Ahwetukee Arriba�s where they have around a 5 barrel system in use. It looks clear gold with near bright white head. The aroma offers up bits of floral hops, sweet malts, grainy malts and a sense of yeastiness. The taste is similar with floral hops, grainy malts, some sweetness and sort of a sense of floral hop influenced yeastiness. At the edges I get thin ribbons of acidic lemon like notes. Overall this has a thin body, a modest level of flavor and as such is a decent hot weather brew.

(On draught at arriba scottsdale). Pours a clear golden color with thin white head. Aroma has cracker, bread, malt. Taste has some sweetness as well as some bitterness. A bit metallic, but the bitterness more than makes up for it. Medium bodied with a bitter, dry finish. Not bad at all.

Tap: Was served with a lime attched to top of glass. So you will get a lime citus aroma. Yellow body color with white head, some lacing. Flavor hade a lime and lemon citrus to it. Was a good beer to go along with eating chips and salsa.
Cloudy yellow with a very small head. Aroma is lemon and citrus with a slightly bitter hops, lemon and citrus flavor. Not bad.
(tap) I tasted very little difference between this and the amber actually, though it is lighter in color. The more I drank this one, the less I liked it.

(On draught at the scottsdale location). Pours a clear amber color with off-white head. Aroma has caramel malts, bread, cracker. Taste is sweet with some bitterness. Thin with an oily texture. Finish is bitter. Not a bad beer.

Another travesty in brewing...again with the same odd flavor profile as the Bock (perhaps they were infected). Dark copper color with a 1/4 inch head that quickly turned into a ring before disappearing altogether. Caramel, toffee, and an off-putting spice. Pass.

The lime definitely overpowered the beer. But that�s partially because the beer was fairly plain and bland. (Of course the food is STELLAR, but that�s a seperate rating) A very dark beer for an amber. Some caramel and citrus characteristics (citrus was probably more lime than beer itself). I thought it was better than most, and this one had a little more bitter to it than most ambers. I felt this one was a bock for a brief moment.

I would have to hink the lime severve with this one took away most of the main charistics of this beer. Other than the the body was amber in color it�s aroma and flavor was also like the pilsner. Good beer anyway with dinner.
On tap at the Ahwatukee location. Dark caramel/ amber with a smallish head. Aroma was sweet malt and cinnamon. Flavor was a spicy with a sweet caramel finish. Good refreshing beer.

(tap) This is one of 3 beers brewed by this Mexican restaurant with several locations in the Phoenix area. The amber was a murky brown which smelled mainly of the lime that was placed on the top of the glass, and which kinda tasted like the lime as well. It definitely didn't have much flavor. I had the Bock and Pilsener before but i shall rate them later when I have had them again.
Draft in Glendale. Not impressed. Looks and almost tastes like really old cola. Flat. Overly sugary. Beginner�s homebrew level. (#5977, 5/25/2015)

On tap at the Awhatukee location pours up amber to copper in color supporting a light tan head. The aroma offers up caramel malts, sweet and seemingly slightly tart dark fruity esters like a bit of a hard candy like sensation. The taste is pretty rich and sweet with sugary caramel malts, some sweet dark fruity esters and a touch of earthiness. I wasn�t expecting this to be as rich and yummy as it is. I�ll sure have it again my next visit.
Dark brown pour. No real head. Aroma is barely there. A bit malty. Funky grainy. Flavor is odd. A bit skunky. A bit tart. But not as bad as it sounds. Weird.

This was truly a terrible experiment in brewing...cola-colored and with minimal carbonation. Aroma was quite sweet with an odd spice added to it...couldn�t really place it. Funky, sugary, and not at all refreshing. Avoid this one.
(Draft at Casa Arriba, Scottsdale, AZ) Pours a cloudy dark brown body with a small beige head. Aroma of molasses, brown malt, and caramel. Flavor of toasted malt, molasses, and some dark fruit.
A classic dark body color. Goes down smooth. Truly refreshing. Zero aftertaste.
Tap : This one had an aroma of spices. Dark body color with of white head. Had a sweet caramel and spice added in to the flavor. Left somewhat of a dry aftertaste. Good Beer.
Ahwatukee location. Dark red amber with a light crisp aroma of caramel and spice. Flavor is sweet, spicy with a yeast finish. Not bad.

Typical Belgian pils, yet even sweeter and more lifeless than most. To be honest, the body and flavour are not bad at all due this abv, but that makes it all the more a shame that it has no more hops and characterless fermentation aromas. (25cl bottle from Prik & Tik Leuven)
Bottle @ home. Clear colour, white foam. Crispy and bitter beer. Light and weak, refreshing and easy drinkable. Not a bad low alcohol beer!

Pours clear blonde, not much of a head. Smell is crispy, malty, a lot like a lager to be fair. Is this low fermentation ? Taste is surprisingly bitter. Still tastes a lot like a lager, but the bitterness this one has is nowhere what you would expect from a beer like this. Of course, the body and the back don�t stand up to this strong taste, but given the abv, i�d say thats only reasonable. Kinda good, for what it is !
25cl, best before 01.15. The beer starts malty fresh, hints of grain, slightly smooth. Not too deep but fullbodied. Grainy-smooth and fresh aftertaste with quite lots of bitterness. Very nice.

27/XI/14 - 25cl bottle @ Gent Horeca Expo - BB: X/2015 (2014-1410) Clear pale, very pale yellowish beer, creamy white head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: lots of grains, malty, hay, bit sweet, sugary, some almonds. MF: soft carbon, medium to light body. Taste: lots of hay, grains, malty, little sweet, bit off. Aftertaste: bitter, metallic, lots of grains, cow fodder, more metallic.

Bottle 0.25l taste sample with tderoeck at Horeca Expo Ghent Belgium 2014.Pour it golden color with small white head.On the nose malt grain.Taste and aroma of sweet, funky, metallic and bitter after taste.Not good

Bottle: Served in a Chouffe glass: Loud plop. Clear yellow body with medium to bigger sized lively and quickly demolishing airy white head on top. Aromas of malts, corn, soap, some hay, grains, spices and a hint of hops. Flavours of malts, herbs, grass, some hops, bitters, grains, hay, light spiced, corn, green plant ish tones, some light floral tones and a sprinkle of something yeasty. Aftertaste is a mix of grains, herbs, grass, malts, bitters, hay, plants. Medium carbo, creamy mouthfeel, low to medium bodied and a creamy texture. For 2.25%ABV this is a good beer.

Brown 25cl bottle, best before Nov 2010, poured into a �La Chouffe� stemmed tulip glass and reviewed on 6 Oct 2010. Didn�t know what to expect, I got this in Brugge without the aid of my glasses: memo to me; wear glasses when buying new beers and check alcohol levels! Very lager/pilsner like in apperance, light golden body with the regular snowy white head. The aroma was again typical pilsner/lager, grains, with hints of yeast and hops. Dry and boring flavours, neither bitter or sweet. As thin as a beer gets in the body stakes, but it is only 2.25%ABV so one shouldn�t expect too much taste or richness. All in all, I got what was on the label (just couldn�t see it without my glasses).
Bottle. Frothy white good mostly deminishing head. Pale yellow colour. moderate malty and light hoppy bad grainy aroma. Light bitter not pleasent flavor. Short finish. Watery palate.
dry hoppy aroma,golden pale, clear, white foam, medium bitterness, light body, dry hoppy finish.

column2: Newcastle upon Tyne, Tyne & Wear, England
column5: Had this bitter in the Three Judges, Glasgow October 2005. Cask, handpump dispense. Clear pale amber in colour with a thin white head. Sweet aroma of raisin fruit in the malty aroma. Thin but refreshing mouthfeel and good lacing. Juicy pale malt gives a digestive biscuit base with slight raisin fruit noted. Hop resins give a strong aromatic , spicy flavour to the short bitter aftertaste. Finish is slightly bitter with citrusy flavours in the mouth. A decent session Golden Ale.

column2: Newcastle upon Tyne, Tyne & Wear, England
column5: @ Canonsgate. Light golden. Fruity aroma, maybe a bit appley. Light fruitiness is accented to apple. Light malts. Fairly bland.

column2: Newcastle upon Tyne, Tyne & Wear, England
column5: @Cannon�s Gate, on the Royal Mile, which thankfully does not oversparkle their beers. Clear honey-gold. Hop aroma is not noticeably amarillo but is clean and grassy. Palate is soft. Herbal flavors are interesting array of Chinese herbs like astragalus. Would benefit from a chilldown, but has a nice juicy body and astragalus flavors.

column2: Newcastle upon Tyne, Tyne & Wear, England
column5: Cask, Angel View Inn, nr. Gateshead. Fruity, light tasting rust orange coloured ale. Aroma of crunchy apple, medium bitterness and a reasonably balnced finish.

column2: Newcastle upon Tyne, Tyne & Wear, England
column5: Golden with a small white head. Aroma of fruit, especially pear and hay. Dry and bland grassy flavour.

column2: Newcastle upon Tyne, Tyne & Wear, England
column5: Cask @ GBBF 09, Great British Beer Festival, Earls Court Exhibition Centre, London, England. Clear light to medium yellow orange color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is light to moderate malty, toasted, caramel, light hoppy, citrus. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a average duration. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft to flat. [20090807]

column2: Newcastle upon Tyne, Tyne & Wear, England
column5: Cask at GBBF 09 ... golden yellow ... lemon fruity nose ... light soft lemon hop ... middling

column2: Newcastle upon Tyne, Tyne & Wear, England
column5: Cask@GBBF2009. Golden colour, small white head. Aroma is hops, yeast, fruits, floral hops as well as some mild vegetables and bready ntoes as well. Flavour is quite much the same. Mild grassyness in the finish.

column2: Newcastle upon Tyne, Tyne & Wear, England
column5: Cask@GBBF 2009. Golden color, small white head. Grass, citrusy hops and vegetables in the nose. Woody and grapefruity hoppy flavor. Lingering lemony bitterness in the aftertaste.

column2: Newcastle upon Tyne, Tyne & Wear, England
column5: Nice looking blonde pint, taste has an odd sour edge to it which I can�t quite put my finger on. Taste is light bitterness, some citrus and a little sweetness. The sour edge makes it different, but not sure if it�s in a good way or not. Will have to try again later.

column1: White Marsh They Made Me Do It Blueberry Ale
column4: White Marsh Brewing Company (Red Brick Station Brew Pub)
column5: Tap at Red Brick Station. Poured amber with blueberries in the bottoms of the glass. Weak malt ale with a nice finish. The after taste is a bit sweet like blueberries and cream.

column1: White Marsh They Made Me Do It Blueberry Ale
column4: White Marsh Brewing Company (Red Brick Station Brew Pub)
column5: Tap at Fire Station 1. Pours clear amber with a small, purple tinged head. Okay retention. Good lacing. Nose is heavy diacetyl and sugar. Taste is mega diacetyl, sticky old candies, melted toffee. Just a butter bomb. Hints of blueberry go unnoticed. Chemical finish. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

column1: White Marsh They Made Me Do It Blueberry Ale
column4: White Marsh Brewing Company (Red Brick Station Brew Pub)
column5: Even though there were blueberries floating in it.. It wasn�t overwhelming. It almost tasted like watered down blueberry-flavored moonshine. Nice red color, thin.. not that bad.

column1: White Marsh They Made Me Do It Blueberry Ale
column4: White Marsh Brewing Company (Red Brick Station Brew Pub)
column5: Not much aroma. Dirty golden in color. Didn�t really care for this take on the blueberry beer.

column1: White Marsh They Made Me Do It Blueberry Ale
column4: White Marsh Brewing Company (Red Brick Station Brew Pub)
column5: Cask at Pizzeria Paradiso, courtesy of RJ - thank you sir! Bright golden, thick beige head. Aroma of very faint and subtle fruit, dirt, dust. Taste is like a dilute lager with bitter fruit. Not very interesting.

column1: White Marsh They Made Me Do It Blueberry Ale
column4: White Marsh Brewing Company (Red Brick Station Brew Pub)
column5: Location: On tap at the Brew Pub, 8/16/09, and they put the Blueberries into my glass without asking me Aroma: Even with the blueberries in the glass I hardly smelled anything at all, light blueberry nose and not much else Appearance: Clear reddish color, with the fruit on the bottom of the glass Flavor: Again, faint blueberry and little else Palate: Thin and light Overall Impression: This beer was really dull, I got almost no flavor, no nose, nothing. I�m not sure if the 2009 was just a bad batch, but it seems others enjoyed it in past years much more then I did this summer.

column1: White Marsh They Made Me Do It Blueberry Ale
column4: White Marsh Brewing Company (Red Brick Station Brew Pub)
column5: Draft at the 2009 MD Spring Fest. One of the better blueberry beers I�ve had. Deep orange-brown-purple color. Looks filtered. Dry and fruity, with no syrup taste. Excellently smooth. Garnished with real blueberries at the brewery.

column1: White Marsh They Made Me Do It Blueberry Ale
column4: White Marsh Brewing Company (Red Brick Station Brew Pub)
column5: Reddish copper color with a spoonful of blueberries added during the pour. Tart and tangy blueberry flavor, obviously. Very drinkable and surprisingly good, although I drank this after a hoppy beer, and I think that bitterness was still lingering on my palate.

column1: White Marsh They Made Me Do It Blueberry Ale
column4: White Marsh Brewing Company (Red Brick Station Brew Pub)
column5: At tap at the Red Station Brew Pub. Poured a medium orange color with a smaller sized head. Aromas of light blueberries. The blueberries were a lot stronger in the tastes. The aromas were on the tart side whereas the tastes where on the sweeter side. Started of sweet and ended lightly tart.

column1: White Marsh They Made Me Do It Blueberry Ale
column4: White Marsh Brewing Company (Red Brick Station Brew Pub)
column5: Purplish color with a light purplish/white head. Aroma of blueberry. Tasted of blueberry, lightly sweet, refreshing, but not something i particularly want to drink every day. Plus the blueberries floating around in the beer looked like deer turds.
On tap in Corvallis. Pours a cloudy yellow color with a large white head. A big citrus fruity nose, light biscuit. Pils malt, lemons, low bitterness, lemon peel. Zesty and soft doughy malts. Good.
Tasted @ the McMenamins Kennedyschool in Portland. Cloudy yellow colored brew. Fruity aroma. Malty sweetness. Some fruits and light bitterness. Not really an ordinary kolsch.

Draft at the White Eagle, pours clear yellow with small white head. Sweet aroma of malts and honey, citrusy and slightly peppery aroma. Floral. Flavor is light and malty and pretty sweet for its light color and body, definitely citrusy and maybe a slight hint of anise and hop, no bitterness. Very drinkable but not much to it.

Draught. Poured cloudy yellow with almost no head. Very fruity, spicy aroma, almost like a saison. Sweetish taste, very little bitterness until you get to the finish. Lingering fruity taste, peaches, pears and clove spice.

On tap at the Kennedy School location. Pours a cloudy pale golden color with a thin layer of fizzy white head. Some fruity yeast greets the nose at first, bringing out some aromas of banana and light pear; not the expectation for a kolsh, but pleasant nonetheless. A touch of crisp, lemony, wheaty acidity adds a clean refreshing touch. Light bodied, gently carbonated mouthfeel. Served a bit on the warm side for the style, which perhaps accentuates some of the yeast aromatics noticed. Clean, refreshing lemony wheat flavor with a touch of lavender hops. Finishes dry, with a wave of hop bitterness that has a harsh stalky, stemmy quality and inhibits the drinkability somewhat.
[Tap - Hillsdale Brew Pub] A golden thing color with a nice head. Good hop aroma and I loved the flavor this was a good summer brew. I�ll have anohter as I sit here and type.

@ Bagdad Theater, Portland (not sure who they�re partnered with). Hazy straw colour. Crisp, herbal hop aroma. The malts are fresh on the palate (bready) as are the hops (earthy, herbal). Well-balanced, as close to authentic Kolsch as I�ve had in the US...though the reference is a bit strange as fireflies (while a summer feature they may be) do not exist west of the Rockies.

Draught at Boon�s Treasury, Salem, OR. Slightly hazy yellow color with white head that laced the glass. Aroma was light citrus hops. This came out again in the flavor along with a fresh cereal grain taste. Light and refreshing.

Had this one over the summer at Ram�s Head. Straight from the farm this one, has some grassy vegetal notes and has the slightest bit of bite upon first sip. It gets pretty basic after that. Easy to drink and makes a great sit out on the porch and drink summertime beer.

On tap at Ram�s Head location in Portland. Somewhat clear golden with a white head. Light grainy aroma with a hint of creamed corn. Moderately sweet. Flavor has notes of grain, corn, light caramel and somef hop bitterness coming in at the end. Medium to light body with medium level of carbonation. Decent easy drinkin� beer.

Hazy blonde with a thick foamyish head. Light coriander riffles through the aroma. Zesty coriander with a possible splash of citrus and a soupcon of funk left in the bottle. A fair attempt at a witbier.

From the can (that looked more like CZ Lager than Oz Lager) - It poured a clear golden body with little carbonation that somehow managed to support a large creamy head regardless. Laces well, too. The aroma is grainy with a touch of apple and a bit of tin. The start of the taste is a fairly decent sweet malt, but the tinniness comes forward and remains for the finish. Sal�s Beverage World, Elmhurst, IL

Nice golden colour with frothy white head. Taste is clear and smooth. A nice refreashing beer. Makes me realize why people from Ausralia get upset when everyone thinks Fosters is the only beer they have. Good brew.
Golden colour. Cidery, slightly grainy aroma. Light, wet, slightly cidery flavour and palate.
Deep gold colour, mostly diminishing creamy white head. Grass and hay aroma. Grainy and sugary, with a light salty and bitter finish and a metallic aftertaste.

440ml can, 4 pack. First tried it out of the can and tasted corn and can. Tried the last can in a glass. Rich head and attractive in the glass. Full mouth feel and an aspect that raised it above my first impression. The flavour reminded me of a Strong Belgian Ale yeast. The website says this beer is coming soon so I am not exactly sure what the goal of the brewer was. I think they missed but i gave them a point or two for the effort.
An okay maibock, though not anything special. Has some checmially character with quite a bit of light fruit and sugary sweetness. Tried in 2010 for the first time.

Tap at the brewpub in KC. Clear golden pour. Sparkling, higher carbonation. Mild vegetal DMS nose is par for the course for this brewpub. Sticky sweet, cloying body with cidery off flavors. Another exercise in identifying brewing flaws.

Had on draft @ The McCoys, Kansas City .. . Pours maple gold, light head, good medium lacing .. . he pinched me bum! your bottom? .. . light maple, sugar, and sweet malts .. . not a bad maibock but maybe a bit thin .. . Hey, guys? Just so you don�t hear any wild rumors, I�m being indicted for fraud in Australia. That�s no reason to block the TV.
Clear golden with a fizzy white head. Sweet malty and citrus aroma and taste with a crisp bready finish

On tap at the 2010 Microfest in St. Louis. Pours a bright golden with a decent white heads that sticks around. Taste is sweet pale malt wi8th some hop character. 7% ABV not evident. Quite a good example of the style.

On tap at McCoy�s in St. Louis Park, MN. Pour is amber with a quickly fading off white head. The aroma is sweet, almost butterscotch. The taste has a nice malt backbone with sweetness layered on top. Balance was nice on this one, my favorite McCoy brew to date.

On tap at the Parkville Microbrew Festival. Pours a deep rich gold with a thick off-white head. Has a very chewy and thick body. There is sweetness galore to this one. This is a yummy maibock and perhaps one of the best American-made ones that I have had. I suspect that it is lower ethanol than most.
A very nice bock, this was quite enjoyable to drink. Deliciously fruity, with a bittersweet malt background. A very true to style American styled Maibock
This was their best beer ... a nice amber appeal with a rich malty goodness. A bit of the alcohol shines through, but it�s deliciously rich and well-bodied. Excellent.
Great looking, with orange and yellow throughout. Light caramel, apples, and floral aroma. Head was completly gone by the time the pint got to my table. There was a sourness in the aftertaste.
Tap. Golden with small head. Another simple, but decent beer from these guys. Light body, mild ginger, and a bit of sweetness. Refreshing.

I actually enjoyed this. One has to remember that this is a Shandy and not an overly complex beer. The aroma was of strong ginger. The color was like, well, Ginger Ale. The mouth feel was highly carbonated and crisp. Ginger is the flavor that hits you first followed by sweetness with a little spice. This borders the line of a wine cooler but can still be classified as a beer. Refreshing.

Hazy yellow with a pure white head. Good, strong ginger aroma and even better ginger flavir accented by quite a bit of sweetness. I enjoy this quite well. A sweet ginger beer. This would probably be great when you�re sick, but then again, I doubt that�s a good idea. Wait, yeah, sounds good.

Tap. Pours a clear light straw yellow color. Light foamy head. Aroma has a big ginger element with some tartness and lemon peel. Flavor is lots of ginger, spices, lemon and citrus. Finishes with a floral, soapy element. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at McCoys. Pours a golden color with white head. Ginger, lemon, fruity flavors. Not my thing.

February 27, 2013 - tap at Foundry. Cloudy whitish pour with head and lacing. Aroma was lemonade with a splash of ginger. Taste was consistent but thankfully not too much ginger, which I don�t care for much. Little bit thin and an odd aftertaste.

the aroma of lemons was very enjoyable. Had the appearence of a cloudy lemonade. Taste was very pleasent of lemons even wife liked it. no aftertaste clean palate. This was a very suprising beer loved it

It poured a cloudy orange copper color with a tiny white head. The aroma was of lemons, ginger and sugar. The taste was of some ginger, syrup and a lttle soda water. A decent beverage on a rather warm afternoon.
Draft at the source. Hazy golden color, small white head, decent lacing. Gingrr is subtle in the nose, but grabs you in the taste. OK if you like ginger.

Draft sample at Microfest 2012. Of the four, I�m not sure why I reached for this one. Probably because it was 90 degrees and the festival was on a parking lot. Pours a cloudy yellow-orange with a finger of frothy white head. Notes of lemon citrus, ginger- and a lot of both- along with sugar, and some bread. Light-bodied, with high carbonation and a crisp, sweet, gingery mouthfeel. Spicy and sweet at the same time, refreshing. Not bad, actually.
Cask Stillage at the Victory Hall Mens Club, Mobberley 27/07/2003 Golden coloured with some wheat and fruit aromas. Lasting bitter finish.

Cask, The Chequers, Sevenoaks. Good pub in town centre serving 6 ales in good condition. Beer is yellow colour with soft bubbly head. Soft, almost creamy body with little up front, but finishing with a biting earthiness. Not impressed.
(Hand Pump) A light straw coloured ale. A sweet aroma with some fruit. Hoppy and dry on the palate. A very pleasant, clean tasting beer, with an intense bitter finish.

500ml Bottle - Hazy amber with a white head. Rye, caramel and notes of dried fruit and spice in the aroma. Malty, fruity and fairly sweet taste with rye, toffee, sultanas, dried apricot and some peppery notes. Bready and quite nice at first but becomes a bit cloying by the end of the bottle.

�Sternbr�u Kellerbier�, Flasche (50 cl) vom Landgasthof Sternbr�u, �hergestellt & abgef�llt von Brauerei Friedel, Zentbechhofen�. - Wundersch�nes Rotgold, leicht opak. - In der Nase angenehm toastiges Malz, dezente Butter, aromatische orangenfruchtige Herbe. - Antrunk satt toastig-malzaromatisch und gerstig mit milder r�stig-nussiger Note, karamellig aber kaum s��, zart rauchig. Trockene zitrusfruchtige Hopfenherbe. Gut rezent, schlank und trocken. Kr�ftig hopfenherber Abgang, langer Nachtrunk. - Schlank, sauber gerstig-malzig und knackig gehopft � ein Kellerbier ganz nach meinem Geschmack! (Verkostung: 17.5.2018.)
Bernsteinfarbenes Bier mit einer geringen wei�en Schaumkrone. Geruch leicht r�stmalzig, Karamell, reife Fr�chte. Geschmack w�rzig, sehr malzig, viel Karamell, nussig.

From tap at the brewpub. It�s dark amber with a creamy head and a mild aroma with notes of caramel and malt. The flavour has a light sweetness and notes of caramel, malt, light syrup and the finish is dry.

Malzig-gerstiger, eher harmloser Antrunk. Sp�ter wird das Bier frischer, die Aromen entfalten sich. Etwas hopfiger und herber, angenehm, auch wenn das Malz hier keinen gro�en Stellenwert beseitzt und unter den Tisch f�llt. Nett, mehr aber nicht. 8/9/9/9//9
Bottle. Pours a dark golden color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity grainy and slightly buttery caramel aroma. Fruity malty buttery caramel flavor. Has a fruity malty caramel finish.

500ml bottle - at ChrisO�s - thanks! 5 Big butter aroma 3 Rich red, tiny head 4 Scarily buttery taste. 2 Ditto, butter everywhere. 6 Nope. Too massively buttery. Ruins all sense of the beer behind that.
Bottled. A dark amber beer with an off-white head. The aroma has notes of malt and caramel. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt and caramel, leading to a lightly bitter finish. The body is light.
clear caramelly brown, small white head. strong sweet caramelly sweet malty aroma, flavor is soursh, berries, caramel, butter. doesnt taste good. palate is a bit gluey. not my taste.

Bottle 50 cl. Courtesy of fonefan. Clear dark amber with a rough and dissipating off-white head. Sweet caramel and honey in the nose with a honey touch. Medium body, very low carbonation, hard roasted malts, some flowery hop accents and a smoky touch. Surprisingly bitter finish. There�s a metallic touch and a light tartness. As fresh I bet this could be a great beer. 171110
Clear deep amber with a large off white head. Aroma had roasted malt, diacetyl, caramel and barnyard. Flavour had roasted malt, caramel, rye bread, smoke and barnyard. Finished smoked and dry.

�Sternbr�u Pilsner�, Flasche (50 cl) vom Landgasthof Sternbr�u, �hergestellt & abgef�llt von Brauerei Friedel, Zentbechhofen�. - Goldgelb, leicht opal. - In der Nase angenehm getreidiges helles Malz, dezente Butter, mild hopfenw�rziger Hopfen. - Antrunk satt hellmalzig mit sauberer Gerste, ganz dezenter Vanilles��e und feinster, hocharomatisch kr�uterig-zitroniger Hopfung. Mild rezent, etwas vollmundiger als sortentypisch, weich. Gediegen zitronig gehopfter Abgang. - Was sich in der Beschreibung so banal anh�rt, ist tats�chlich ein �u�erst schmackhaftes, da enorm stimmiges, mit allerfeinsten Aromen komponiertes Pilsner s�ddeutscher Pr�gung, weich, rund und ohne die aggressive Herbe eines norddeutschen Pilsners. Gro�e Klasse! (Verkostung: 18.5.2018.)
Klares goldgelbes Bier mit einer geringen wei�en Schaumkrone. Geruch getreidig malzig, leicht s��, gering hopfig, floral. Geschmack gering bitter gehopft, grasig, malzig, leicht s��.

Rating from 2009. Dunkelgoldene Farbe, s��lich-milder Geruch. Der Antrunk ist vollmundig-weich, fruchtig. Leicht herb, frisch-fruchtig. Im Nachgeschmack lang anhaltend frisch-herb-blumig, sch�n rund und ausgewogen. Im letzten Tel des Nachgeschmacks feinherb-mild. Leckeres Pils, sch�n s�ffig & ausgewogen herb. 10/12/10/10

From tap at the brewpub. It�s hazy golden with a creamy, white and lasting head. The aroma is mild with notes of malt, flowers and light biscuits. The flavour is moderately sweet with notes of malt and flowers, and the finish is dry.
S��-getreidig, etwas herber Antrunk, pl�rrig wirkend. Muffig, wenig ausgepr�gt, das Getreide kommt im Mittelteil in schwacher Form hervor. Monoton. 10/7/7/8//8
Bottle at yespr. Clear golden coloured with a small white head. Malty aroma of hay, caramel and hops. Malty flavour of hay, caramel and hops. Sweet and hoppy finish.
Bottled. A dark golden beer with a thin white head. The aroma has notes of malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt and straw, leading to a bitter finish.
Bottle 50 cl. Courtesy of fonefan. Clear deep golden with a white head. Malty nose, some aroma hops. Medium body, malty and metallic with a solid if somewhat rough hop bite. 121010
50 cL bottle, courtesy of Papsoe. Pours clear and golden orange with a fully gone head. Aroma is cornish and slight metallic. Bitter, cornish and slight grassy. Bitter and slight cornish finish.
Cloudy golden with a off white head. Aroma had straws, grassy hops and hints of malt. Flavour was bone dry with malt, grassy hops and straws. Finished dry and bitter.
Fles thuis geprobeerd. Het heeft een fel rode kleur met weinig schuim. De geur is chemisch zoet, kersen, snoepachtig. De smaak is kunstmatig kersen.
Pours unclear Red, small white head. Smell is sweet, strip, some Twigs, geen aspect, as well as the obvious kriek. Taste is sweet, intense fruity, twigd. Not bad.
backlog, deep red colour with a pink head. nose is intense sweet cherries, raspberry syrup. candy sugar, chemical sweetend. artificial sweetness. bad
Bottle. Hazy deep red color, pink head. Aroma of tart cherry, light citrus. Taste is very sour cherry, tart finish. Refreshing enough.

2006 vintage opened in 2015. Flat w no head or carbonation. Aroma of cherry candy and sweet hay. Sweet candy cherry bomb on the front that gives a slick mouthfeel. Becomes a little tart in the middle but finishes sweet. Some additional raisin and plum notes - probably from the aging. Ok but a bit too candy sweet. Needs to be tarter. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The kriek in this series, made from 2003 till Riva went bankrupt and fortunately not restored by Moortgat so far; very sweet, syrupy kriek, tasting and smelling of not much else but overtly sweet cherry extracts. I am glad the trend of light, witbier-based, onedimensionally sweet fruit beers seems to have passed a bit now.
Dunkelrotes Bier mit pinker Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr s�� nach Kirschen, genauso ist auch der Geschmack.

This beer pours a hazy reddish-brown color with a medium foamy off-white head that recedes quickly to an outer ring. Spotty lacing on the glass. Aroma of cherries and malt. Light-bodied with flavors of tart cherry, malt and roasted nuts. The finish is mildly tart with a short cherry aftertaste. Average overall.
September 2011. Bottle. Sweet and artificial cherry aromas. Dark red with a pink fizzy head. Cherry and sticky flavors. Easy one to forget.

Pours a red beer with a small pink not long lasting head. It smells like cherry, much cherry. Very very sweet. The taste is very juicy. Cherry lemonade , very sweet and little sour. It has a thin body, watery texture and a lively carbo. This one is way to sweet and missing the alcohol.
can bb 12/20 ambrata limpida discreta schiuma non molto persistente melassa frutta matura caramello dolciastra leggero etilico niente luppolo
500 ml can poured at home. Pours red with an off white head. Smells like caramel malt. Tastes the same. Okay.
Birra ad alta gradazione alcolica decisamente troppo dolce per i miei gusti, una delle peggiori per il prezzo a cui viene venduta.
Bevuta in lattina ad una grigliata. Aroma dolciastro. Color rubino. Gusto: bock? CfgMp
De Carrefour. En copa Bavaria. Viendo Black Summer 1x05. Muy acaramelada, quizas demasiado, con un puntito alcoholico que no se va de madre. No desagrada pero tampoco entusiasma
Way to sweet testing for me. Not a beer I enjoyed drinking and I really like Amber, Red beers.

Can. Pours clear dark amber with a large, frothy beige head, long retention with excellent lacing. Medium toasted and caramel malt, some alcohol notes, light spicy hops and a lightly sweet finish. Full body and medium carbonation.

05.08.2018 -- 0.5l can from geant casino in st louis. pours a clear deep amber with a big frothy head. aroma of malts, prunes, booze. flavour of strawberries, malts, sugar. surprisingly drinkable for this abv (but nothing outstanding).
1500 ml plastic bottle. Golden body with a white head. A little but sweet malty aroma. Flavor has a relatively OK maltyness, sweet and actually some hops. Could be worse.
1,5 l plastic bottle. Gull Pils indeed. Very pale, faint smell of vomit, a hint of boiled carrot. Truly bad, I�m happy to tell you that this beer only has local distribution.

1500 ml plastic bottle. Deep golden colour and crystal clear. White fluffy head with some coarse bubbles. Crisp noble hops, mostly saaz. Classic pilsener aroma at first. Smooth texture as the carbonation is quite mellow. Somewhat sweet malty flavours. Little hops in the flavour. Clean maltiness, but it is a bit too thin. Little aftertaste, but it is a bit sugary and grassy. After a while it builds up a cloying oxidized aroma.

Medium white fine-laced head. Greenish yellow body. Peppery hop aroma with rubber notes and some light malts. Taste is light, clean grass, faintly sweetish, with bitter, papery aftertaste. The bitter, papery taste lingers unpleasantly. An OK pilsener, but spoiled by that aftertaste. (1.5l plastic bottle.)
Plastic bottle. Golden clear colour with no head. Weak aroma of maltness with notes of sulfo. Light flavour of malt and ends up watery.
Pale golden colour with a very small white head. Malty, apple fruity aroma with a light grainy note. Malty, fruity flavor with a light caramel sweetness. Dry, light acidic finish.
Big plastic bottle. Very light in colour, aroma and flavour, but fairly clean. Rather bitter. Not very pleasant to drink 80cL of in one go, though.
Plastic bottle. Golden colour with a small whith head. Sweet malty, carboard aroma and a sweet malty, corn, light carboard taste. Medium body with a sweet finish.

(Plastic bottle 150 cl) Clear, pilsener golden with a small, white head. A light aroma of hops. Thin and somewhat watery body with traces of pilsener malt and a dry finish with a discreet hop bite. 061006

Plactic bottle. Pale yellow. Unclear. Off white head. Sweet and grainy aroma. Flavour is fruity and very bland. Has some vague caramelly notes. Thin bodied. Watery mouthfeel. Ends on a very light bitter note. God I�m bored.
Bottled(330ml). -my beer was 3.5%ABV, not so good beer, malty with some soury aroma, vain and bitter finish
Bottled Light amber with a white, rather longlasting head. Quiet malty to be a folk�l. Short and rather thin taste with a fine and nutty flavour.
Golden color. Nice creamy white head. Not as sour as I thought it would be, since it's a 2,8... Quite a good thirst-quencher on a sunny day. Not much of bitterness. International Standard Lager.
330ml bottle (One Pint Pub, Helsinki, Belgian Beer Weeks 2004) Aroma was lightly spicy and yeasty. Spicy and hoppy taste, but tarnished by being clearly alcoholic, not well hidden at all.
Bottle: Poured a hazy yellow straw color with a bubbly white head. The aroma is a spicy and malty. Taste is a bit rusty metal and malt, finishes spicy with a bread yeast finish.
7% ABV Cloudy blond color, with a lot of floating objects. The smell is strange, with glue and plastic. Thin mouthfeel, very simple Belgian Ale, some spices and some sweetness. Not good.

Bright yellow superhazy. Stinks like a belgian strong coriander spicy golden. These are all starting to smell alike to me but this one smells a bit like overripe alefruit if you know what I mean. decent whitehead. A little bittuer/trashy ripe taste for a belgian golden, otherwise normal, a bit more fruity perhaps, a little heavier in the palate. no loss that it is, I heard, deleted.

This golden ale poured with a modest white head. The flavor is sweet with a slightly bitter finish, and is quite balanced. This bottle did not suffer from the infection found in other batches, and was quite drinkable.

My bottle claims 7% ABV only Unclear orange-straw coloured beer with irregular, dirty-white thick head. Very alcoholic nose, as some spirit, some maltwhisky features. Very spicey as well, characteristic, but I�m unable to pin it down. Honey too. Strange spicey taste, at the verge of sourishness, and mannah-like flavour. Some little residual sweetness, white bread and some alcohol. Vegetable flavour retronasal. Alcoholwarming, little burning feel, medium bodied and certain slickness. Infected, I�m sure. As was their first try, which I dismissed out of hand. This might well be their last, and not much is changed, �t would seem...

Cloudy, light yellow with a fine, egg-white head that cloys to the glass. It looks very much like a wit. Aroma is more weizen-like with clove and banana notes, but coriander brings me back to Belgium. Coriander and yeastiness are dominant flavours, surprisingly dry throughout, spicy finish. Medium bodied. An excitingly different Belgian wit.
Bottled.Cloudy, large creamy head. Graasy aroma with banana-notes. Way too much alco-feel. Takes away everything else...
bottled. hazy blonde. lots of apple peel and vanilla and cheesecake, some clove earthiness in the finish. soft and furry and drinkable. light yeasty quality, solid
Bottle. Soft and quite dry, lemon skin and yeast, some lemon scented toilet cleaner in the aroma. Flowery. Quite carbonated, decent.
(Bottle) Pours a deep amber body with a small beige head. Aroma of molasses, raisins, toasted bread, caramel, and prunes. Flavor of raisins, plums, vinous, and light cocoa.
bottle thanks to bu11zeye, dark brown colored pour, a foam head, good aroma of cinnamon, spices and alcohol, flavor is whiskey, cola, oak and malt, effervescent finish

Bottle thanks to bu11zeye. Pours with a large, creamy, off-white head and a deep brown body. Aroma of really strong cinnamon, raisins, brandy and dough. Taste is brandy, dough, vegitables, and cinnamon. Creamy mouthfeel with very light carbonation.
bottle from bu11zeye. brown pour with a tiny bit of cream froth. thick scent of vanilla and oak. very sweet malts with a very sweet finish. not too shabby overall.

(Bottled, very old vintage). Dark ruby color, small steady beige head. Fruity, toffee aroma. Slightly sour, toffeish (vintage) notes. Dark fruits. Ageing has made body quite thin, madeira wine -like. Foamy carbonation. Aged better than Ambree.

Bottled. Deep ambery brown colour, small beige head. Aroma is earth, caramel hops, mild sourness and some slight tobaccoish notes. Flavour is wood, some mild caramel, mild licorice as well as some sour fruityness. Long earthy and sappy dry finish.

My bottle, bought at Beer Mania, was sadly contaminated too, a shame as the fruity twiggy chocolate malt aroma was promising, but strong acidic cidery notes cut straight through to ruin the the palate and finish and I ended up pouring down the sink.

scura buona schiuma piuttosto persistente note caramellate cioccolato un tocco di acidita legno come se fosse invecchiata un tocco fruttato in bocca acida in contrasto con il malto caramellato forse era infetta anzi penso che proprio era infetta ma al naso era molto particolare

(Bottled, 7.5% ABV, aged sample from BeerMania, thanks TBone!) Dark, hazy brown with a small, but firm and very lasting head (no lace like in the Ambr�e, though). Aroma of caramely-licoricey malt, dark fruit, some anise. Dried-fruity flavor with lightly roasted, sour malts, some caramel, tart oud bruin finish. Medium-bodied, dry palate with quite high, but smooth carbonation. Very mixed reviews it seems, but I liked this one. Pleasantly dried out with ageing - or maybe it was like this from the start. Anyway - I�d like to have another one, if the brewery still existed.
7% ABV Mahogany color; persistent thin head. Both aroma and flavor have some vegetables touch; the mouthfeel is thin; unfortunately this one is also quite infected. Bad.

column1: Piece Collars and Cuffs Blonde Ale
column5: On tap at Piece. Poured clear paler golden with a short cap of white head. The aroma was soft with bready and honey notes accented by dusty lemon zest and floral hoppage.. pleasant. The flavor had more of the honey with grassy and lemon bitterness.. softer and well-balanced, but the sweetness was too focused on the honey.. bitterness was light. Lighter-bodied and very dry on the palate with a refreshing finish.

column1: Piece Collars and Cuffs Blonde Ale
column5: Tasted 4/30/08. 6th sample from the brewpub. Hazy with a golden straw hue. White lacing head. Yeasty citrus and melons in the nose. Touch lemon/lime note. Bready and wheaty. Citrus. Ever so slight Crunchberry flavor. Muddled and a touch peppery. Too tart. Good hop presence, but unmelded with the yeast character.Just off.

column1: Piece Collars and Cuffs Blonde Ale
column5: Draft� DLD�08� Hazy, straw-colored ale with a mid-sized, fluffy, white head. Great, tight, creamy retention. The restrained aroma is of earthy, piney and grapefruity PNW hops. Light-bodied, but creamy, with modest carbonation. Lots of citrus and pine bitterness flanking moderate toffee sweetness. Crisp, bitter, dry finish.

column1: Piece Collars and Cuffs Blonde Ale
column5: Hazy and toasty scented. Not a whole lot going on. Taste is definitely bready and toasty. Not a huge fan, grassy tasting. Meh.

column1: Piece Collars and Cuffs Blonde Ale
column5: Pour is hazed golden yellow with a bright white head...smell is lightly citric and toasty...taste is crisply grassy...faintly toasty in the finish...nice...

column1: Piece Collars and Cuffs Blonde Ale
column5: I had originally ordered Piece for delivery but they told me they had the Jockey Full of Bourbon on tap so I ran down there to pick it up myself. Unfortunately, they lied and the only beer they had on tap that I hadn�t had was this one. Pours a cloudy blond with a nice white head. Aroma of lemon and some spices. Goes down easy, does almost taste like a wheat. Not a bad beer, but I was just so pumped to try the bourbon one :(

column1: Piece Collars and Cuffs Blonde Ale
column5: This was good but boring. A little cloudier than I expected. Pretty lemony, tastes sort of like a wheat bear. Not a whole lot of hops, but I guess thats the idea. This would be good if I was doing a marathon of drinking, but just not enough going on to excite me.

column1: Piece Collars and Cuffs Blonde Ale
column5: Poured a cloudy yellow color. Aroma of spices and banana. Tasted of some spices, and sweet malt, not much hops of any kind.

column1: Piece Collars and Cuffs Blonde Ale
column5: Draft at Piece. Decent looking beer, yellow with a small but lasting foamy head. Nice malt profile is both light and sweet, delicate and grainy. Magnificent.

column1: Piece Collars and Cuffs Blonde Ale
column5: Tap at Piece: Clean light gold hue with a fading fizzy head. The aroma has notes of grains, biscuity malt, apple esters, grassy hops and a hint of soap. The taste is pretty much what I expected, mild pale malts and light-handed bitterness in this session ale. A bit musty tasting too. The mouth feel is sprite and light-bodied. A ho-hum ale, drinkable with pizza but nothing you need to go outta way to get.

Malty. Caramel, licorice notes. Very light bitterness. Deep copper brown clear with thin tan head. Med heavy carb with med watery body. Malty caramel taste. Dry. Weak & watery. Weak sour coffee. Light bitter acidic finish but very clean after. Not what I would guess as a stout.
Bottled. Dark ruby with rich creamy head. Sweet and clean with some plum and licorice. Empty for such a big beer with a salty metallic finish.

Plain almost black beer with a slight coffee aroma like a stout, but that's where the similarities end. The flavour is fruity and leaves a fizz on the tongue. Overall a disappointing beer as it is a Belgian ale crossed with a stout.

column4: L�wenbrauerei Hall Fr. Erhard Schw�bisch Hall
column5: "Haller L�wenbr�u Edel-Pils", Fl�schchen aus dem Pilsbiere-Mixpaket vom Biershop BW. - Goldgelb, blank. - In der Nase pilstypisch schlanke, etwas schmalspurige Hopfenherbe. - Antrunk schlank und erfrischend hopfenherb mit bitterer Zitronenschale, zart schwefelig. D�nnes helles Malz, zarte Rests��e. Stark rezent, sehr schlank, trocken. Im Abgang knackige aber etwas leere Bittere. - Schlankes, gut bitteres aber doch rundes Pilsner. Sch�n.

column4: L�wenbrauerei Hall Fr. Erhard Schw�bisch Hall
column5: Klares Goldgelb mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Malzig, leicht s��lich, leichte Zitrusaromen, getreidig, spritzig, leicht herb.

column4: L�wenbrauerei Hall Fr. Erhard Schw�bisch Hall
column5: 33cl bottle. A clear pale golden beer with a mid-sized most good lasting white head. Aroma of straw and mild grainy malt. Taste of mild grainy malt, straw, grassy dry hops, pale malt, medium bitterness.

column4: L�wenbrauerei Hall Fr. Erhard Schw�bisch Hall
column5: 19-07-2017 // tap at Olli�s, Schw�bisch Hall. Clear golden beer, small white head. Light and solid Pilsner, mild grainy, mild bitter.

column4: L�wenbrauerei Hall Fr. Erhard Schw�bisch Hall
column5: From the draft. Appearance: A clear golden yellow colour with a average, frothy, white head, whcih leaves some good lacing.Aroma: moderate malty, grain, hay, light hoppy. Taste: moderate sweet ,light to moderate bitter with a long to average duration, malts, hay, metalic tones , crisp and dry. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. A more then decent pilsener.

column4: L�wenbrauerei Hall Fr. Erhard Schw�bisch Hall
column5: Gezapft in den Schwarzwald-Stuben, Berlin. Sehr sch�n Gold, klar, sch�ne angemessene Schaumkrone. Geruch: Zitrus, Hopfen. Geschmack: etwas Zitronenlimonade, bitter, brotig. Sehr erfrischend. Mittellanger bitterer Nachgang

column4: L�wenbrauerei Hall Fr. Erhard Schw�bisch Hall
column5: Vom Fass und aus der Flasche. Goldgelbes Bier mit weissem festem Schaum. Herber Hopfenduft. Klassischer Pils Geschmack. Leider hat die Flasche kein Goldlametta mehr.

column4: L�wenbrauerei Hall Fr. Erhard Schw�bisch Hall
column5: Klare goldgelbe Farbe, ordentlicher Schaum, feinherb leicht s��lich im Geschmack sehr s�ffig

column4: L�wenbrauerei Hall Fr. Erhard Schw�bisch Hall
column5: Tap at a ice cream shop in Gaildorf Clear light golden with a medium sized white head, light lacing Mild aroma of grains. Taste is grainy, bisquity and citrus Good

column4: L�wenbrauerei Hall Fr. Erhard Schw�bisch Hall
column5: Malzig-brotig. Leicht s��lich mit mittel-herbem Nachgeschmack. Sehr s�ffig.

column1: Lighthouse Beacon ESB (formerly India Pale Ale)
column5: Draught at The Beagle Pub, Victoria Dark amber color with creamy head. The aroma is very mild, some caramel; also, the beer is too cold. Mild caramel flavor with correct bitterness and not much hop character. Ordinary Pale Ale.

column1: Lighthouse Beacon ESB (formerly India Pale Ale)
column5: Pours amber, frothy head. Aroma is lightly hoppy, slightly earthy and fruity. Taste us mildly citrus peel, fruity, finish is quite lovely. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

column1: Lighthouse Beacon ESB (formerly India Pale Ale)
column5: Love Lighthouse beers for being refreshing and easy to drink. This one is pretty good, pours golden amber with a fizzy head leaving no lace. Very earthy and malty for an IPA too. I�ll stick to their Switchback (an AMAZING beer) as far as IPAs go and take a pass on this one.

column1: Lighthouse Beacon ESB (formerly India Pale Ale)
column5: Bottle 5.3% Taster pack. Clear amber pour with a weak, white head that bubbles away to a ring. Aroma is strong with hops, roasted malt, and is quite earthy. Taste is more of the same, dry hops and roast malts dominating the flavour, with a hint of caramel. Finish is dry, but balanced and satisfying. Quite good

column1: Lighthouse Beacon ESB (formerly India Pale Ale)
column5: This is not an IPA, unless we are speaking about the world according to Alexander Keith. Beyond not being an IPA it�s also boring. A little malty without any head or lacing, pours clear orange. Tastes like a lager. Average carbonation. On tap at the Beagle Pub.

column1: Lighthouse Beacon ESB (formerly India Pale Ale)
column5: Well Lighthouse what have you got for me tonight? An IPA you say, well then lets get this done. Lighter non-intense IPA, almost chocolaty, watery, lemon, earthy spice. Heavy malts with upfront bitterness that fades to sweet in the finish. There is a nondescript sharpness in the aroma that�s driving me nuts because I can�t figure it out. Good easy to drink beer with nothing really bad about it except probably one of the last IPA�s I�d ever reach for.

column1: Lighthouse Beacon ESB (formerly India Pale Ale)
column5: Pity pack. Light amber, sticky thin of white head. Maybe my nose isn�t working. It�s fairly muted. Somewhat sweet caramel, light citrus and even lighter pine. English IPA style. Super drinkable. Heavy on the malts, light pine and spice, dull fruit but something makes my mouth water. Sharpness, much better warm.

column1: Lighthouse Beacon ESB (formerly India Pale Ale)
column5: 355ml brown bottle. Medium golden pour, large white head, foamy and airy. Some patchy lacework left in the glass. Nose has some sweetness and fruity notes and is pretty mild. Taste has caramel malt and fruitiness up front, grassy and mildly spicy hop notes. Grassy finish, late bitterness. Medium body, average carbonation. Overall pretty unexciting middle of the road English type IPA. Probably would not drink this again.

column1: Lighthouse Beacon ESB (formerly India Pale Ale)
column5: 355ml bottle pours a pale amber color with a finger of white head that leaves some decent lacing on the glass. Aroma is floral with some grass and hints of caramel. Taste is grassy hop bitterness with a generous malty sweetness for the style. A little on the sweet side for an IPA, but overall, still tasty and recommended as a good session ale.

column1: Lighthouse Beacon ESB (formerly India Pale Ale)
column5: Amber, Copper. Floral hops comes through on the nose. Some oily bitterness but doesnt linger long. Good but not great IPA.

From Sept 2008 I got this bottle in a trade with jwc215. Thanks Joe! It pours a hazy orange with about an inch of foam. Looks like some good lacing and head retention is above average. The smell has notes of caramel and some fruitiness, mainly oranges. A nice light but good nose. The taste is yum. The oranges hit my taste buds first followed by another fruit I can't put my finger on, some caramel sweetness and bread and a rather substantial citrus hop goodness right before and through the finish. Right at medium bodied, the carbonation is also medium, and man, is this Blonde Ale drinkable. Holy cow!! This is one that I could have easily drank all summer long! Bottom line: Usually, when I try an American Blonde Ale, I go in without expecting much but this one is a real winner in all categories. Love it!
12 oz. Can from craft 12 pack by distributed. Nice smell, with quite bit hops for a summer ale. But much appreciated.
Tastes very hoppy for a summer wheat ale. I liked the hoppy taste but that�s cause I�m a hop head, but i can see how this beer doesn�t appeal to certain individuals.
Pours hazy golden brown. Sweet, citrus notes, but they�re overpowered by hoppy bitterness. OK, but not great.
12oz bottle. Poured a hazy yellow color with a smaller sized head. Muted ... wheat, citrus, and floral

Aroma is floral, hoppy, spicy. Taste is bitter and alcoholic. Spicy flavor with a wee bit of wheat but more hop than anything else. Not too easy/pleasant to drink due to the bitterness/alcoholic-ness throughout.
12 oz. bottle picked up in Boston. Pours clear yellow. Nose is floral with honey; flavor is wheat, floral hops. Bitter finish. Easy to drink but not a lot of flavor.

Aroma is light floral and some caramel. Not what is expected for a wheat ale. Hazy golden appearance. Lightly bitter with some sweet notes. Easy drinking light body. I am confused, this seems like a typical blonde ale and barely has any wheat present in it.

Tap at Plan B, Springfield, 19/05/13. Clear pale golden with a thin white head. Nose is pale malts, citus, hops, caramel. Taste comprises pale malts, grass, citrus, light hops. Medium bodied, fine carbonation, light bitter notes in the finish. Ok stuff - basic but refreshing.

(Bottle) I was impressed this ale would hold the white fluffy head throughout the entire length of the glass, complete with lacing. Nice unfiltered light golden complexion with persistent light combination. The flavor is light without being too watery or weak. Very drinkable for warm weather beer.

This is one of the most all around beers. It seems to go good with everything. It�s not too strong, not too weak,more noticible than anything is the perfect texture going down. The bottle fermentation is really noticible; everytime you pour it a big foamy aromatic robust head forms, even down to the last drop.

I like this beer a lot. Compared to a classic like Old Peculiar, I would say that it has a better balance of sweet and bitter, whereas Old Peculiar is a little on the too sweet side. Definitely one of my favorite strong ales.
Ok, this beer is extremly good. Alot of flavor in the rosted malts. The hops balance nicely with the malts. I'm not going to rate this beer a 20 but it's very good.
Had on tap at the Walnut Creek Alehouse. An orange/yellow color with very little head. Smooth. Hint of Orange. Not the beer I expected but not bad!

Dark Brown w/ruby highlights. This beer is smooth,caramel/chocolate flavor with just enough bitterness to back it up. I was told that Mount diablo porter had just won the silver medal at the World beer cup. I can see why. Delicious
Nice dark dark brown color. Thick brown head sits on top. Fresh ground coffee aroma carries over to the taste buds. Full bodied and smooth finishing.
A nice brown color, rather bubbly, chocolate/coffee aroma, lots of malt and a very good taste!

Nice opaque black color. Frothy brown nitro head. Nice aroma of coffee and nuts. Flavor is fairly mild considering the strength of this beer, but it does have a nice roastiness to it. Very smooth going down as well as the aftertaste. Not bad.

I had this at the sacramento ale house and it was called "K street nitro" but it's the same. It does have a strong coffee flavor with a hint of choclate. A very bitter finish. I would just say it was a average stout.
It's a good copy of Guinness. I enjoyed it. Black in color, tan, smooth, foamy head. Nice roasted coffee taste. Very good!
Klares goldgelbes Bier mit einer ordentlichen wei�en Schaumkrone. Geruch leicht s�� malzig, Citrus, getreidig. Geschmack sehr malzig, getreidig, leicht s��, langweilig.

Rating from 2009. Dunkel Bernsteinfarbe, s��lich-neutraler Geruch. Der Antrunk ist vollmundig-s��lich, f�r ein Helles sehr aromatisch-voll. Zum hauptteil kommt eine deutliche Herbe hinzu, leicht penetrant-pelziger Nachgeschmack. W�rzig, aber irgendwie muffig. Schade. 5/9/3/4

From tap at the brewpub. It�s warm golden with a creamy and lasting head. The aroma is mild with notes of malt, light soap and caramel. The flavour is rather sweet with notes of malt, light caramel and the finish is dry. IMO it leans towards a dunkel.
Herb-muffiger Antrunk und Verlauf mit lascher Hefe. Bleibend, das Getreide bindet sich an die �u�erst milde Herbe und wird st�rker. Zum Ende aber dann doch s��er und leicht w�ssrig. 10/7/7/6//6
Bottle at yespr. Clear golden coloured with a small white head. Sweet aroma of malts, caramel, hops and butterscotsch. Fruity flavour of caramel, hops and berries. Hoppy and berryish finish.

Bottled. An amber beer with a thin fast disappearing off-white head. The aroma has notes of malt and caramel. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, caramel, and a bit of spices, leading to dry finish.

Bottle 50 cl. Courtesy of fonefan. Cear deep golden with a small white head. Malty and slightly smoky nose. Medium body, tart, malty, fruity and metallic. Fairly bitter finish. Clearly infected. 121010
50 cL bottle, courtesy of Papsoe. Pours clear and golden orange with a fully gone head. Aroma is grassy and slight cornish. Smoked, metallic and slight cornish. Dry smoked and cornish finish.
Cloudy golden with a tiny white head. Malty flavour with grassy hops. Flavour was dry with grassy hops and hints of malt. Finished dry and bitter.

Bottle 500ml. @ home. Clear medium yellow orange color with a small, fizzy, virtually none lacing, fully diminishing, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, grain, toasted, cereal, light hoppy and buttery. Flavor is moderate sweet and light bitter with a average duration, rotten water. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft to flat. [20100810]
Pours an amber color. Malty aroma with a nice caramely flavor. Pretty good.
Vielen Dank an koelschtrinker f�r dieses Bier. Bernsteinfarben, sch�ne beige Schaumkrone. Geruch kr�ftig malzig, s��, leicht oxidiert. Geschmack s�� malzig, kr�ftig, etwas w�rzig, oxidiert.
Deutlich herber Antrunk, leicht malzig. Im Mittelteil R�stnoten, frischer milder Hopfen. Vollmundig hopfig malziger Nachgeschmack. 12/10/10/12/9/11

Pours a clear amber color with a lofty cream head. The smell is bread, sweet fruit, touch of caramel and grassy hops. The taste is fruit, bread, hint of chocolate, grass. The body is light/ medium with nice carbonation.

Malzig-r�stiger Geruch mit einem Hauch von Rosen; sehr ungew�hnlich. Frisch-herber und etwas malziger Start ins Geschehen. Angenehm fruchtig betonte Malzmitte. Sanft r�stmalzig und bitterer Abflu�. Sch�nes Bier, �berzeugt.Test vom 27.10.2009, Gebinde: Glasflasche

bottle from Bierzwerg. Clear amber-brown golden colour, mid-sized off-white head. Malty nose with a "homemade" character. Intensively malty with lovely roast malt flavours and aromatic hops. Very slightly fruity. Very nice indeed!

The bottle looks good, a little bit different than the other bottles from this brewery. Starts malty, modest sweet, fine notes of caramell and fruit, plum and raisins. Soft finish, woody-malty. Well balanced. Very good!
Red amber color, frothy head, fading away slowly. Pear and caramel aroma. Sweet caramel flavor. Medium bodied, in fact no herbalness or hoppiness to compensate. Not bad, but slightly disappointing.
Nothing special. A light watery flavorless decent NA pale lager. No head, high carbonation.
pale golden colour, medium white head; aroma of some hop and grass; taste is a bit watery with malty sweetness and some bitterness, too; surprisingly better than the alcoholic version

23/06 A 0.5 l bottle courtesy of Marko, thanks for sharing! It poured clear yellow body with smaller head. Wonderful cabbage, paper and lemon cleaning solution aroma. Exquisite typical NA grainy and premium cornflakes maltiness flavor. Medium body with actually decent finish, showed some slightly bitter herbal notes which helped this to be quite OK for a non-alcoholic lager.
Bottle from Hungary. Pale golden body, small white head. Lemony worty cardboardy aroma. Eh. Grainy worty malty taste. Very light bitterness. Salty, liight lemon. Not too tasty.
Bottle. A typical non-alcoholic beer, but not that bad. Pale yellow colour, weak head. It�s aroma is sweet, and the taste is also. Light bitter at the end.
500 ml bottle. Budapest, Hungary. Clear pale golden colour with small white head. Aroma is burned malt, rubber and that�s it. Flavour is malt and maybe tiny hint of corn. Almost drinkable.

Bottle I bought at Brouwerij Kasparus (wife of the brewer is from Hungary I believe). Shared with DutchDrebus. Although it�s still pretty watery, it does have a nice flavor and smell, albeit overall just decent. But not bad for a low alcohol-beer.
Shared a bottle with benzai. Taste is pretty decent for this low alcohol beer. Not as watery as some other beers with 0,5%

No 782 Rated: 27.07.2009 Bottle brown, 500 ml, rated at Bogacs, Hungary. Appearance: Pours pale golden, perfectly clear body texture, carbonation of the body is weak, head is white or greyish white, initially medium, quickly decreasing to small, frisky, quite fizzy, unstable, leaving no lacing. Aroma: Nice gentle, citrusy-hoppy and typical for Low Alcohol on the other hand, very pleasant, fresh, herbal, lime, lemon, kind of perfumy, thin and weak in terms of malt but still crispy and pleasant in that aspect, in overall weak but positive. Flavour: Very soft, refershing, easy going, enjoyable Low Alcohol, still characteristic in its simplicity and pleasant soft aromatic hoppy nose, very mineral, slightly herbal, notes of powder milk, finish duration is short. Palate: Body is light, texture is wattery, carbonation on palate is moderate, finish feel is flat, clean, neutral, mineral.
Bottle. Medium head with short duration. Color is pale yellow. Aroma is sourish malt. Taste is watery and sour malt. Citurs like finish.
Cask Handpump at the Sir Robert Peel, Bury (JDW) 06/07/2003 Golden colour with a slightly cloudy appearance. Earthy aromas. Some acidic taste and a bitter finish.
Cask Conditioned at a local Macpub. Red Amber beer very flat, treacle, caramel. How do Wetherspoons manage it?

Cask Conditioned, a Masque Haunt, London Pale golden colour, but wouldn't have gone so far as to call it a blonde ale. Pleasent butternut aroma, quite unique. Manky minerally flavour that petered out to a fairly flat finish.
wygl�d �redni, m�tne, ze �redni� pian�, niezbyt g�st�, w smaku alkoholowe, lekki banan, zero go�dzik�w, nic ciekawego, a wr�cz bardzo s�aby weizen
Optisch wunderbar. In der Nase etwas gammelig, im Trunk Nelke, sauer. Bin mir nicht sicher, ob das so sein soll. Matter Abgang.

Aus der Flasche getrunken (Direktlieferung aus der Brauerei). Tr�bes Gold mit feiner wei�er Schaumkrone. Unauff�llig in der Nase. Der Weizencharakter kommt gut durch, ohne die �bliche �bertriebene Hefigkeit. Im Nachtrunk leicht w�ssrig.
0,5l Flasche. In der Pr�senz sieht es toll aus, schmeckt auch angenehm hefig-nach Banane. Insgesamt stellt sich das ganze als Leicht variante im Geschmack dar.
Ein simples Weizen mit einigen fruchtigen Momenten und ein wenig S�ure im Abgang. Mild, schlapp, eigentlich geschmacklos. Aber zumindest trinkbar.

Pours out of the bottle in a cloudy, dirty amber colour with no real head and medium body. Aroma of old bread and old laundry (not that I have that at my home). Taste of overripe yeast, bacterias, baking yeast, malt, barley, bread and bananas. Dusty finish of nuts and basement. Not that nice to drink with its high carbonation but not that much banana like some other Weizens. Okay, average.

Frisch-hefiger Geruch; sehr sch�ne, helle tr�be Bernsteinfarbe. Antrunk flach, aber vollmundig. Der Hauptteil ist etwas muffig, aber sch�n angenehm hefig-s�� und sehr mild. Etwas flach. Sehr s�ffig. Zum Nachgeschmack wird das Bier etwas herber, zusammen mit sch�ner milden, cremigen Hefenote. Im allerletzten Teil den Nachgeschmacks wir das Bier sehr herb-bitter dominiert und etwas metallisch-negativ auffallend. Ansonsten aber ein leckeres, s�ffiges Weizen! Test vom 10.9.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 12,11,12,9,12,10 - 10,60
Bottle looks really good. Beer in the glass dusty-turbid, small head. Starts mild, modest yeasty-malty. Fruity like apple. Modest sourish. Finish less yeasty, still fruity. Okay.

#835 Ziemlich arm an Kohlens�ure pr�sentiert sich dieses Hefeweizen. Es ist gar leicht muffig. In der Nase nur hefig-s�uerlich, etwas Bananenaroma. Der Antrunk ist sehr leicht und schal. S�uerlich, bananig auch im Geschmack. Im Abgang trockener werdend. Nicht so doll! Test vom 19.1.2010, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 8,8,9,8,9,8 - 8,20

500ml bottle. Hazy golden colour with average to huge, frothy to creamy, lasting, white head. Slightly spicy wheaty and yeasty aroma with a fruity apple note or more precise, with an autumnal note of foliage and slightly scruffy apples. Taste is slightly watery and sourish, moderately spicy, especially towards the finish.

Tasted this in the Fox & Hounds, Houston in May 2009. Cask, handpump dispense. Clear pale straw in colour with a thin white head. Dusty floral hops present in the short aroma. Thin resiny mouthfeel and good lacing. Pale malt base gives citric fruit notes of lemon and limes, grapefruit and honeydew melon. Dry dusty hops give a bitter bite to the aftertaste. Finish is malty and warming with a hit of mead. An excellent summer session bitter.

2nd January 2009. Bottle. Clear gold beer - not much head. Crisp palate. Just a tiny bit of hop aggression. The honey is supposed to give a sweet finish but only manages to prevent a bitter one. A bit watery.

Cask, Newark Fest 09. Golden orange with a small white head. Aromas are toffee malts with honey and resinous lemon. Some biscuit with light spices and floral notes. Flavours are biscuit malts with citrus and dark honey. Fairly sweet with herbal notes. Decent.

Cask@Newark Beer Festival, 2009. Orangey/amber beer with a strong head. The aroma is mildly honey and hopped, and the flavour is mildly rich, hopped and fruity. Overall a nice fruity and hopped honey beer.
Cask, gravity, at 7th Devonshire Arms Beer Festival, Bedford. Dark gold with a malt aroma. Sweet malty taste with a mid bitter finish. Bit too much fizz, I thought.

Cask at The White Horse, Harborne, Birmingham. Slightly cloudy amber with a short head. A lovely flowery citrus scent, mainly of tangerine. Decently bitter with a dry end. Grapefruit and oranges in the mouth, with a hint of the honey (but not as much as I expected). Really quite good.
Cask at paisley beer fest. Alround rating: Standard golden bitter, honey and grassy hay hop. Decent but lacks character.

Bottle. Quite sour aroma, kinda like gueuze or something, but not as pleasant. Palate does show some of this ourness, but it has a sugary honey flavour, which i was expecting. Quite dry, with some slight yeastyness and quite carbonated as well.

Cask conditioned - handpump - The Globe Northampton. A copper coloured beer with a white head and lacing. The aroma is sweet and honeyed. Not overly sweet like a lot of beers with honey in. The taste is quite smooth and the honey sweetness comes through. Decent.
Golden yellow colour ... Tight white head ... lots of grapefruit hop in front ... light malty honey linger.
Cask (gravity dispense) at GBBF, day 4 on 4 August 2006. Hazy pale gold appearance. Bit of sulphur on the nose. Otherwise soft and slightly grassy. OK but nothing particularly outstanding here.

Cask conditioned at Fellows, Morton & Clayton, Nottingham. Pale straw with white head. The best of the beers in this pub, bitter and dry with a touch of yeast and burtonisation sulpher. Quite flavoursome, citrusy, astringent and quite drinkable.

Cask conditioned - handpump - Fellows, Morton and Clayton, Nottingham. A very pale blonde coloured beer with a thich white head. This beer was served with a very tight sparkler and took ages to clear. The aroma is a touch yeasty and has lemony citrus notes. The taste is citrus and yeasty also. A reasonable session beer but I would like it to have a better hop note.

Cask at GBBF 2006. A hazy pale yellow beer with a white head. The aroma is sweet with a weird hop note giving it light notes of sulphur - is it the Pioneer hops? The flavor is sweet malty with primary notes of citrus, but also light notes of sulphur. An OK refreshing beer.
Another bitter to the list. Veyr nice though, and veryt good foam. I have to admit it is well brewed.

(Cask at GBBF, London, 2 Aug) Colour is golden yellow with foamy head. Nose is fruity with citrus (grapefruit, lemon) and a grassy hop aroma. Taste is fruity and hoppy with grapefruit, lemon and a bitter, grassy, slightly soapy finish. Nice and refreshing.
Cask @ GBBF 2006. Hazy pale golden colour with a white head. Fruity hoppy aroma with some hints of citrus. Malty fruity flavor with some bitterness and hints of citrus. Slightly bitter finish.
Cask at GBBF 2006. Hazy yellow gold, thin white head. Quite a good hoppy, golden bitter. Bit of farty yeast. Grapefruit on end is excellent. Bit juicy.

[Cask at GBBF] Hazy golden. Honey and spritzy orange up front. Fairly dry with gentle sprakling mouthfeel. Light bodied. Dominated by orangey citrus flavour. Medium bitterness. Excellent aromatic bitter!
Cask Stillage at the GBBF, Kensington Olympia 03/08/2001 Golden coloured smooth on the palate and slightly pale. Some bitterness in a hop finish.

Clear orange. Another sweet malty nose of bubble gum and corn. Sharp hops and grain in the flavor, leading to a dull pale malt finish. A little spicy at times, with rye or wheat or something. A little alcohol in the nose as it warms.

had this last weekend at barleys on tap: orange tan color with little to now white head. very difficult to get any nose out of this, as most of there beer. musty sweetness. in the mouth not much going on. very sweet and maybe a slight crystal malt flavor. not a good maibock.
Tap @ Reno Festival. Amber brown color with a light brown head. A toasted malt aroma and flavor. Medium to full bodied.
Almost a deep brown color with a still character. The beer is sweet, caramel and vaguely nutty. Not the best Maibock in Vegas by any means. OK.

Clear and yellow-gold with a frothy, lasting head ("whipped egg whites" is a pretty accurate description). Nose was sweet and spicy. Lightly crisp and fairly clean mouthfeel. Some watery notes, but not bothersome. Malts were light, husky, grainy, earthy and cracker-like with an underlying sweetness that matched nicely. I found the beer pleasant to drink and rather refreshing. It also had a nice amount of bitterness to balance things out and keep it interesting. As far as "Summer Beers" go, it wasn�t a bad one.

Tap at Beachwood BBQ. Dark orange. Super fruity aroma. Maybe like orange tussin w some yeast and spice. Flavor is medicinal at first followed by oranges, yeast, spice, a touch of grain and a light funky flavor. I thought it was a little thin, but it was interesting.

On tap at the Carlsbad PP with golubj. Poured a brownish color. Aroma was of chocolate and dark fruit. Flavor was very sweet, which I happen to like. At the time I described it as "drinking liquid brown sugar joy." Very enjoyable beer from the people at Drake�s.

Draft at Carlsbad Pizza Port. Amber pour. Aroma is slightly roasted, chocolate, and fruit. Flavor is very sweet, with brown sugar, toasted malt and chocolate. Pretty good beer. Alexanderj felt like he was "drinking liquid brown sugar joy" and gave it a 3.8-3.9.

So I�m sitting at Carlsbad Pizza Port and I order a Alpine Nelson and one of this here Drakes Belgian dark ales and it�s like yumm! Light brown ~ small lingering head. Light malt and date aroma and big malt, date, raisin flavors with hints of sour tropical fruits, hops and grapefruit. Lovely.

On tap @ Drakes. Bready aroma and deep copper color with small off white head. This was like Chimay white with a few sugar cubes in it! A bit cloying on the mouthfeel, but a decent flavor. If bottled, it would probably be quite nice after a year or so.

Listed as Belgian dark GABF 2007. Dark tan pour w/ a light tan head, good lacing. Light bread aroma, some clove, pretty light and basic. Good wellc arbonated palate. Nice flavor. Sweet malts, coming through as sugars.. maybe its the yeast... anyway sugar on bread w/ a dry finish and a touch of honey. very nice brew.

Tap at Drake�s Friday tasting. Must be a different batch than listed here, alcohol is listed at 8.5%. Pours with a brown color and a nice head. A wonderful brew, very well balanced and complex. Yeasty flavors, with some caramel and banana flavors. Nice full mouthfeel, smooth finish. I would call this a Belgian Dubbel.
Good effort for a first belgian. initial head disapates rapidly. Floral spice and yeast nose with some alcohol up front. some grassy hop notes that mingle with the clove and banana esters.

Orange gold color. Small head. Aroma is orange and fruity. A medium bodied Belgian ale. Malts are fruity and sweet, orange and apricots. Yeastiness is very subdued. Soft carbonation. Smooth and flavorful, but the flavors seem toned down to a very mild level. Slightly sweet finish. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly sweet. Bottle # 142 of 375.

This beer was sampled at the 12 Hour Belgian Beer Festival 2004 thanks to Beerguy101..go mitch! This was bottle #142 of 375. It poured a clear orange hue with slight hints of yellow and a heavy degree of carbonation. The head was pretty small and non-existant.. a soapy little mess that dissipated quickly. The aroma was yeastiness at its finest..but it was a pretty light nose... took a little while to get the real scent. Some fruity nectar there as well (yes iceman..i said nectar). The taste is very light and slightly yeasty. Some fruity orange in there, and a nice mild finish with suspended yeasties at the bottom of my glass.. But really this had little to no kick at all. This beer was overcarbonated and underloaded with fruits and other flavors.. next!

column1: Hal and Mals Zita Vienna Lager
column5: Caramel malt and slightly phenolic lager aroma. Ruddy chestnut brown with off-white head. Nutty, a little vegetable, moderately hopped and dry. Good medium body with a long bitter finish. Did well with their roast beef sandwich.

column1: Hal and Mals Pearl River Pale Ale
column5: Moderate cascade and malt aroma. Cinnamon colored with short creamy head. Medium-heavy western hopping. Crisp, woody, lemony. The hops didn't wear out their welcome in the finish. A very solid brewpub PA.

column1: Hal and Mals Mundts Scottish Ale
